Pq6Y0imx2Eh7Xu7fe15dYw.text: Tender is located inside the Luxor Hotel, Ate here because I was fiending for a nice piece of steak, and heard they they have fresh seafood and meat flown in daily.   Can't complain about the service because our waiter was awesome.  The head chef also made his way to our table making sure we were well taken care of, and asking us how are food was.  The decor was elegant and classy red walls, dim lighting good ambiance.   Started off with the wild mushroom soup, damn i really wish they gave me a bigger portion of this soup because it was absopositively delicisous.  Never had anything like it.  I ordered their prime rib, but to tell you the truth it was whatevs, I was more into the wild mushroom soup then the prime rib lol.  Although the prime rib was a really nice cut, I couldnte even finish it all.    Overall great restaraunt out of the many restaraunts in vegas.  Pricey, but they have prix fixe menu's for that.

TE35VL8waAErmR71sCC6Dw.text: Enjoyed drinks at the lounge last night.  Friendly service, reasonably priced wine list and relaxing environment.

IZ_NH96GL5yGZPbWVaA24A.text: I was very satisfied that I chose Tender as the steakhouse to eat at.  I  made a reservation online before my trip, and even had a $20 off coupon that was emailed to me from Luxor.    I ordered the chef's special as an appetizer, which were multi colorted heirloom tomatoes, with basil, buffalo mozzarella, with garlic evoo.  Very good, but a little pricey  for just tomatoes and cheese!  As an entree I ordered the filet mignon which tasted like butter! It was cooked to perfection, my bf had the ribeye which also was prepared to a tee.  As a side we shared the grilled aspargus drizzled with lemon evoo.  I was a little disappointed with it, not quite as crunchy/flavorful as I would have liked.  When we had finished out meal, the waiter came out with a cake and a candle.  I had completely forgotten that I had wrote on the reservations request online, that it was my bf's birthday!! They had actually read it and remembered!! I was very impressed with that gesture, as well as the excellent service, nice place, cozy, romantic, would definately recommend trying!!

CQN_mmEUhOBCE3OPXPNpNA.text: We needed a place to get us in QUICK before the (absolutely horrible, negative ten stars, but that's another review) Criss Angel Cirque show. They were great - sat down our party of five, got us drinks and food superfast, but didn't rush us, and got us out and to the show (unfortunately).   We had the surf and turf burger (HOW DECADENT! kobe beef and lobster?!?) which was one of the most amazing things ever. Also the trio of soups (delicious, but it wasn't steak so not as spectacular as it could've been), the ONION RINGS which somehow were as melty and  incredible as a hot Krispy Kreme donut, the roasted carrots (YUM) and the blue cheese bacon iceberg wedge. Which was also fantastic.  It was all good good, good, so good. OH and the best Mojito I've had, like, anywhere. It was fabulous. We should've stayed there all night instead of rushing off to that absolutely godawful show.

7NVPYQmv0LtwDoYX478ffQ.text: My husband and I ate here for our last night in Vegas on a saturday night, for my birthday dinner no less.  We were staying at the luxor, and we decided to stay "in" for the night, but didn't want to go out on the strip for a good dinner.  After reading the other reviews on yelp, I decided this place was worth trying.    We had to wait maybe 15 mins for a table, but had a really good drink at the bar, so it wasn't a bad wait. After finally being seated, we decided the wait was worth it.  They seated us to a very nice, intimate booth.  Right away we could tell this place was great.    We started out with an iceberg lettuce salad, I had the 2.25 lb lobster, and my husband had the angus ribeye.  My husband requested his steak medium rare plus, and most places don't ever get this right.  His steak was cooked to perfection.  My lobster was brought to me in a covered dish, with a lobster bisque type sauce, which was delicious, even though I usually prefer my lobster plain.  For dessert, we ordered the flourless chocolate cake, which the waiters presented me the cake with a candle and chocolate "happy birthday" design.    Tender is definitely worth checking if you want a fabulous steak or surf and turf dinner!

EVuGklxMYGrgfDttEtpXvw.text: If you receive Juan and Raul as your servers, you are in for great service and entertainment.  The food is excellent.  They are attentive, personable, and I did I mention their impeccable

OGdZBWv90nM-ahcqAzVYCA.text: Overall a great place to grab dinner in Vegas for a reasonable price (by Vegas standards). Lobster bisque is tops!

PnRDy2oraO3v67VAzqtHwA.text: We tried Tender only because we were already staying at the Luxor. The food was ok, but I wish we would have used our limited time better and check out a different place. The presentation of the meat is lacking. The steaks were ok, but not keeping up with other steakhouses on the strip. The bill wasn't shocking, so that was a nice surprise.

gN-pEyu8EtOlG0HzOxg6mw.text: I went to tender steak house in 2009. First started off with the waiter treating us like we knew nothing about food. There menu is huge and a couple of meats that we wanted they didn't have in stock. The carpaccio was warm and very unappetizing. I got a kobe beef sirloin it was not TENDER at all. My friend had the dry aged rib eye which he said was great. Overall the meal wasn't worth the money. Comfy decor just not worth the money.

S3TG1mBWXu0IHLcWmbzNwQ.text: Much like a slot machine, looks promising, but it just takes your money and doesn't deliver.      The pros:  oysters were good as well as the wild game tasting (don't forget to eat the marrow).  cons: bad service, the waiter avoided our table after the food runner poured oyster ice down the side of my friend.  He was MIA for most of the meal. The supposed diver caught jumbo scallops were gritty, all five of them! (which make me wonder if they really were diver caught - me thinks not!)  - the grittiness left what looked to be promising - inedible.  My other dinning companions ordered steaks and they were under seasoned and left us underwhelmed.  The rest of the sides, (grilled asparagus, exotic grains tasting trio and fingerling potatoes) while good, nothing worth mentioning other than they didn't suck.  Oh the sauteed Hudson Valley foie gras was delicious. Unless i go on a bender, i wouldn't go back to tender.

RIHbeoRsqhi44wdvWZyAfg.text: My partner and I had dinner and dessert at the Tender to celebrate our anniversary. At our table we were greeted by two very attentive gentleman that took very good care of us throughout our dining experience. The ambiance was electric, the service was slendid, the steak was like butter, the mashed potatoe with truffles was delicious, and last but not least the chocolate fondue was extremely yummy.. 5 stars from the beginning to the end.

nuhQeRy5dK-6MGjgaxXg5w.text: Mediocre at best.  How bad can U Fup asparagus which came thin dried out and looking like a reject from the grocery.  Wifes lamb shank good but way to salty. All ala carte and very pricey for the quality.. service spotty at best.  If there is a manager they are not watching or don't care.  Also if they have a chef he is not testing or tasting.  Desert was adequate.  Would not go back unless they make changes.  Recommend Ri-Ra they have better service and food for less money.  Good luck People

ZH3wUV3Qg7ctcuVJfEvu6A.text: After reading the mixed reviews we were a little nervous on what to expect.  We went to dinner at Tender with our best friends on our recent trip to Vegas.  Each couple had a My Vegas Rewards voucher, not problem using both, plus we also each had a $20 credit from the coupon book that the Luxor gave us at check it, great deal.  Our bills each came to over $150, but with a huge tip on the full price of our meals we still spent less than $100.  My husband and I started with drinks.  He had an IPA beer and I had the Red Maiden off their cocktail menu.  Delish.  For appetizer my husband had the Big Eye Tuna platter, his favorite was the planks.  I had the Mushroom Soup (amazing, def. A+ for flavor, I am very picky about my mushroom soups, have had a lot in my day).  For Dinner I had the range-fed beef, Silver Fern Farms, New Zealand. Medium Rare, it was cooked perfect, no need for a sauce, it was great all on it's own.  Very juicy and filling at 12oz.  My husband had the range-fed, Silver Fern Farms, New Zealand beef with a side of bearnaise sauce.  Honestly he didn't need the sauce, it was great on his own, but he wanted sauce.  The sides are large enough to share so we shared the lyonnaise potato gratin roasted onion & cheddar sauce with sour cream & chives.  Amazing and it went great with the meat.  We even had a little left over. We chose not to have dessert as we were already full and it was 11:00, late night dinner as we flew into Vegas that night.  Our waiter was very good at helping us with info on the food items and taking care to use our vouchers.  He was very friendly and quick to take care of our bill so that we could head out for a great night of fun.  Though the food is expensive, we easily spend the same amount in Portland, Oregon on the same type of food with the same quality.  In Vegas it is pretty expected to drop money on a nice dinner out.  The atmosphere was warm and inviting, yet not overly hush hush, as we were in Vegas and wanted to have a great time and not into the romantic.  If you were there for romance, ask for a corner or side booth.

HELuHCSkrJqLJWc4_dLvYA.text: I took my hubby to Tender (located in Luxor) and we loved it! The steak was perfect!! The service, food and ambience is 5 stars!!! The decor is very romantic and classy and it was nice to not have blaring music like so many other upper end restaurants do. And not as over-priced as some other classy steakhouses. We will be back! Please NOTE: the reason I gave Tender 4 stars instead of 5 was the annoying photographer. I've never been to a high end restaurant and had a photographer interrupt our conversation/dinner and loudly ask if we want a photo. It's tacky!!

dHRKIDREfrpFPs29Z7KoOg.text: Wasn't expecting to like this place.  Fine dining and the pyramid don't really go together, but wanted to eat in house.  Clearly the best place in the joint is Cathouse, but didn't book that early enough because of questions of whether it was inappropriate for a 13 year old girl.  Wanted to try a different place (company?) but kept getting steered to Tender.  Very surprised when I saw it, it is a beautiful space.  I believe it is very new as there were not yet even the directional signs for it in the lobby.  Actually, was pleasantly surprised by look of all the various restaurants and lounges in the Luxor.  The wines by the glass list was fantastic.  It's probably a bad thing that I knew all the wines since I don't really know as much as I would like about wine, but nevertheless I knew all the offerings and, better yet, liked them all.  So that was positive.  The menu looked absolutely fantastic.  So many choices that looked appealing.  Started with the ceasar salad since that is a True way to determine if a place is good or not, by the quality of their ceasar.  This one, not so good.  Trio of soups was equally uninsprining, the butternut squash/apple was decent, but the wild mushroom and the lobster/crab both just tasted like cream.  Got the Japanese Wagyu fillet (I just can't help myself).  Was it like True Japanese Wagyu?  No.  Was it one of the best fillets I have ever eaten.  Probably.  Does that make it worth the three digit price tag?  Probably not.  Aly wasn't too impressed with the menu so I suggested that she get the lobster.  It came in a ramekin that was probably four inches in diameter.  When a thirteen year old girl who eats more than a quarter of the food on her plate about once in a blue moon finishes everything in two minutes and then jokes "well, I guess I am done with my lobster", you know the portion is a little light.  They do have a larger lobster on the menu, but the meat from a 1-1/4 pounder should have been plenty.  She liked the mashed potatoes.  I liked the approach for the creamed spinach.  They don't cook the spinach to death like most places do, it is still kind of fresh.  The garlic cream sauce was also pretty good, but the entire dish was ruined by too much salt.  Doubt I will go back because if I ever eat in the Luxor again I want to try Cathouse, but if the situation arose I would not hesitate to go back to Tender.

LJIt1itAT4qutkxLLCKNsw.text: Awesome Kobe beef selection. Probably best selection of Kobe beef (from Japan, the US and Australia) in Las Vegas. The Kobe melts in your mouth. Service is excellent. Huge selection of wine. Been there 3x. Zero complaints.   Only downside is location. Luxor isn't as hip as it used to be.

F-QD1Exp7K9XMT-g8aQTbw.text: A traditional steakhouse in a not particularly special environment,  especially for Vegas. But the food is top notch and the service is even better.  It's a good choice especially if staying at Luxor or Excalibur.  I am a repeat visitor especially because of Addie, who is so wonderful and is the lead waitress in the bar. Go a second time and she will remember exactly what you ordered on your first visit.  The steak is as good as anywhere in Vegas. Try the bread--but dont get filled up; its addictive.

-mMOyfdg4t2PgBJJVRVKqw.text: A definite 5 Star.......  Please. Please. Please try the Wild Game Platter, which consists of Boar, Antelope and Venison..... sounds a little Out There but.....  The Wild Boar was extremely tender and well prepared. The Antelope... the best entree.... was perfectly prepared and melted with each fork-full.  I would avoid the soups..... not well considered.  Enjoy

ayIksj1jFR9M2WtmKkZXfw.text: Pretty underwhelming experience. I'm picky about steak because I cook a killer steak on my $89 propane grill at home. I was impressed by the meat selection, but the cut I got just wasn't good. It was a thinly-cut Kansas City Strip (bone-in). I love bone-in steaks because the meat close to the bone is great and very flavorful. Ordered medium-rare. It came out barely medium, pretty much well at the edges and MAYBE medium by the bone. I asked the server what he thought and he started writing something down without answering me. He acted like he didn't wanna offer me a new one, and since I was with a group of people who had to get to a show, I chose to just eat it. Pretty much just your average char-grilled outback-style strip steak. Except it was almost $50. Not gonna give them any more money, that's for sure. That server should've looked at my steak and immediately said, yeah, it's not quite right, let's get you another one. The sauces/complements were very good, and the New York boneless cut that my buddy ordered was fine. Nothing special here. Plenty of better options on the strip.

Xw050kxujoyOt-Q3RUc6FQ.text: This was our final dining experience of the three evenings we spent in Las Vegas. We booked a reservation to eat at Tender because it was convenient to the BELIEVE show we were attending that evening. We had dined at some notable restaurants the previous two evenings (both associated with celebrity chefs), so we didn't expect much. We were happily surprised! The service was excellent! The wait staff slightly older, more experienced (kudos to our waiter Juan). The atmosphere was such that we could actually hold a conversation. And, the food was superb.

e7j6GPTctoIaGRH-E8DFAQ.text: I know there are many great restaurants or steakhouses to chose from but we come to Tender at the Luxor. Great food & service! We were truly disappointed though when we found out the chili we enjoyed so much on past visits had been taken off the menu. We hope the next time we visit it will be added back.

zVcPXWrNddG-jAa1vkh2AQ.text: I was reluctant to try a steakhouse inside the luxor but I was pleased. The service was absolutely excellent and so was the food. The BLT wedge salad was delicious and had a nice big piece of smoked thick cut bacon.  The side dishes we had were very nice. We had the lobster risotto and wild mushrooms. Each side dish is large enough to share with 3 people.  We could not finish it all. The risotto was bursting with lobster flavour.  Our steaks came perfect. My fiance had the filet and I had the T Bone. Absolutely delicious.  We ordered a bottle of wine and they kept it chilled table side. The service was so good that we never needed to refill our wine or water glasses ourselves.   Comes with nice table bread as well. I would go back if it was not for the 100 other places I want to try.

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

No5qMGXvBdnJwE_yj2F9oA.text: We decided to spend our New Years Eve dinner at Tender with friends.  We had early reservations because of the night and how busy is was.  It actually worked out perfect, we came in and it was slow because of the 5pm timing.  We had a great table, great server and side server.  We never wanted for anything because we were asked before we could want.  We were told of the specials for this night and were happily surprised we all wanted the specials.  All of out food was absolutely done to perfection.  My filet was MR to perfection, our friends shared a Tomahawk was M to perfection and yes they finished it... My man was so excited to find out he would eat his lobster with only a knife and fork.  He was utterly amazed and fascinated that they had someone take ALL the shell off for him.  He now says "I will never be the same."  I would love to go back if we are in the same area, great service and great food!

yvyKw9-PkVXBaEx9uoDfXw.text: My wife and I celebrated our anniversary here before seeing a show. From the moment we walked in, we were treated superbly. Everyone we encountered was extremely friendly and helpful.  My wife ordered the special - a wagyu flat iron steak. I had the bone-in ribeye, Both were extremely delicious and cooked to perfection. In addition, the soup trio was really good, and all sides ordered were enjoyed thoroughly.  To top it off, they sent us a cake & ice cream dish after the main course. Not necessary but very appreciated!  The prices are definitely on the higher end, but I do feel it's justified by the high quality of food and preparation. I've been to many other steakhouses on the Strip, and I would not hesitate to place Tender in the upper echelon.  All in all, a wonderful experience.

CFS2ApUyWHxm4GZfikVEdQ.text: This is our second visit. Tham and Emilio really treated us with their expertise and humor.  I had the special Filet and Crab and grilled asparagus. The crab deshelled, which was perfect. The filet was so tender. It was the best filet , I have ever had. The crab was thick, sweet and plenty of it.  My husband ** steak. And creamed spinach. The steak was also excellent. The creamed spinach was too rich for me but he loves it.   We tried the maple bourbon honey, Hawaiian honey and Las Vegas honey with vanilla cream. All delicious . My favorite was the maple honey.   The iced tea I ordered was awful. changed for a decay coffee and at was good.

h4SmOE4R4qDXBsLxpkRRJA.text: Remarkably unremarkable.   $76 for a bison steak (no sides, no nothing) and a cocktail and tip.  The steak was flavorless.  I don't eat steak often and save it for a special event.  This was a real disappointment.  I wish I ate a GOOD In And Out burger instead.  Service was OK but this is Vegas and I expect it to be exceptional.

wLU0Fn_JJkysfYC0_MUcdQ.text: Great food! Very tasty! Super attentive waitstaff. The waiter came by so regularly and offered suggestions, but was not too involved. It was just right!  The ambiance was very upscale. I would definitely come back. Thank you for a great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. asparagus in the back, yummy dipping sauce in the front. ;) enjoy!!
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. pan roasted salmon served with seasonal vegetables and mashed potatoes

zOdjqbdGHbwTKzKXO5zq-A.text: There are only three words you need to remember when you dine here: Bison Osso Buco.   Other guests were very pleased with their filets.   Good service.   Not super excited about the appetizers but plenty of good sides to be enjoyed.

zsf1EA8Vbaw7aKkS9hf1mA.text: The food was great but the service made the experience even better. James the manager came out to great us at the table and explained exactly how they age their steaks, I was curious when asking the question but I did not expect the extra added explanation in other processes as well.   We got the seafood tower, tomahawk steak,3 sides and bone marrow...it fed 3 of us with extras! We might have over done it in the amount of food but  everything was just so delicious. Our waiter was also amazing and been there for 23 yrs (who would guess we'd get the waiter from Hawaii). I often judge other servers by how empty my water gets before refilling...not even half way, not once! When in Vegas this will def be my go to steak house!

QJ9_JXx2AXJdlyq5E80FHg.text: The asparagus, potato gratin, ribeye and ghost pepper sauce is beyond amazing. Be prepared to drop $150 at least per couple.  Perfect for an intimate evening for 2!  Wonderful date experience  Quiet and the service is the best in the business of hospitality

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak trio, potato gratin, ghost pepper steak sauce, and asparagus

OTsA8G8fUO4UPdL6W569CA.text: I have to say, this was a very pleasant surprise. I asked the concierge at the Luxor for a recommendation for an "upscale steakhouse" do dinner, her reply was "try ours", so I did. Easily in the top 5 steak experiences ever - New Zealand beef was so tender I hardly needed a knife. Wine list is excellent, service proper and professional. You have to try the truffle mac and cheese side - perfect side to the perfectly prepared NY strip. I would recommend this place over Morton's or Ruth Chris's any day!!

XyoegCw6fwqHvZ-4D7sQfQ.text: Food was good, but the wait staff really blew us away at this place. A woman at the table next to ours harassed everyone who came over to their table, including the host, servers, the manager, and a photographer employed by the restaurant, to ask for free stuff for her friend who was getting married (it was a small bachelorette party crew). She degraded them about their job, demanded free things, complained about and haggled their prices, harassed them to get them to bachelorette photos with the women that were in poor taste etc etc. The waitstaff went above and beyond to be patient with this woman and we watched from our table as they accommodated the women far beyond what they should have, and tried to politely shut down the situation. The woman was particularly rude to the photographer, a young woman who looked visibly uncomfortable but remained cool and professional the entire time. These people totally kept it all together and were kind in the face of utter disrespect and obnoxiousness and we wanted to let them know we saw them handle the situation like total rock stars.

PDsBiybOU3uWbf2UzOt9ww.text: While the restaurant is a bit on the pricey side, me and my clients had a great experience. The service was pretty good aside a minor mixup (they forgot to bring me spoon for my soup even though they told me they are "on it") but the food was amazing! Big portions, you will not leave hungry, that's for sure! :) The cheese selection was spot-on and my personal favorite one was the one with black truffle! Great place and the hostesses were fantastic, especially the young African American lady.

3I27dd5VBZ2PA7rnpDJFZQ.text: I have to say right off the bat...the service was BAD. I even felt bad, because it was just a mess. Very nice wait staff though.   The food was very nice.  Our appetizer was the salon sampler.  I'm new to eating fish, but I enjoyed each item. For my main course, I had the 8oz New Zealand filet with blue cheese topping. Yum! Also a side of creamy mashed potatoes and a wonderful wedge salad that was very fresh!   I had to try the bread pudding for dessert...it was good, but I didn't want to finish it. It was very delicate and refined. I was hoping for something a bit more classic.   The food was moderately priced for a steakhouse and pretty decent quality. The drinks really bumped the bill up at our table by quite a bit (6 cocktails total). I'd recommend sharing a bottle or two at the table rather than pricey cocktails.

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon sampler

o0F8CCRA_WQzqg4heVTVWw.text: We loved this place. It has a great atmosphere and friendly waiters. You should know it is really expensive. We didn't realize walking in from the casino that it was such a high end steakhouse. I got the tomahawk ribeye and it was amazing. And huuge! I'd definitely recommend going here.

0Tku6_cKvWUMPn9Yfs10UA.text: Fantastic, the service and food was excellent. Had the tomahawk steak, grilled asparagus,  creamy spinach and mushrooms it was my hubby birthday and the brought out a delicious chocolate cake with ice cream. Atmosphere is intimate and private. Great place and great quality food

HG2rlM4mG4IBX4q5S0ZngA.text: Dropped over 4 grand in here last night. Worst meal ever. 10 people and no one had a decent steak. I had a 14 Oz bone in strip that looked and tasted like a waffle house steak. I sent it back and didn't reorder as the 20 Oz rib eye on the plate of Lady beside was so big she wouldn't finish it. Well we both didn't finish it because it was so tough and had no flavor.   The chef nor the manager EVER came to our table. I sought the manager out privately and told him our issues. He did apologize but he NEVER came to the table. They still CHARGED me for the steak I sent back.  The liquor selection is better at  at the airport.  The service was ok. I actually felt bad for the waiter but in the end he did nothing to correct anything.  So my advice... there are literally dozens of better places to drop this kind of money in Vegas and actually enjoy it.

w0gOJ4SU7tkWIg-zU4sEwA.text: Excellent food. Definitely a little upscale. We had the lobster appetizer...this is a must have! Must have! Did I stutter?  My meal consisted of the lobster bisque which had bits of lobster in it and was creamy to perfection. I also had the scallops with quinoa...yes please! I would definitely order this exact pairing over and over and over again.   Many from our party had the steak mentioned that it was perfect.  Our sides included lobster risotto (wowzers), mashed potatoes (creamy) and the mac n' cheese which was sub par. Stick with their specialties.  We were a little disappointed with dessert, some strange cookie chocolate thing with peanut butter ice cream.. we should have got the creme brulee.

sZyoxqV8sOcQ9WbzvpqINw.text: While the food was good, the standards for which we are paying are very poor. One stars for the food only. Working in the restaurant business, I know how easy and difficult it is to "step up" your "game". Tables needed to be refinished. But I wouldn't have noticed that if the service was excellent.   The hostess sat us at one table and then realized it wasn't ready for us and put us in the very back by the server station. There was one rowdy party back with us that soon left after we got there. We had several different "servers," couldn't tell you which was ours or if they were a server, but we were definitely an afterthought, even though we made reservations. And we felt as though we were in the server's quarters. They were clanging dishes, making loud noises doing the normal server stuff that most servers do behind kitchen doors, in front of us.   You really pay for the service and if you are charging a certain amount, you should be getting that quality of service. They needs to take giant leaps forward... would never, ever return.

qj46hK72zbflsAgXHywC7w.text: No complaints! Service was stellar Lobster bisque YUM! Maine lobster YUM The hubby got a kobe style ribeye steak that he loved (as seen in my previous reviews, he is a steak crack head). He said it was so tender that he cut it with his fork and didn't need his steak knife Great ambiance

VRX5zbEHrnvh5WK_NntFSw.text: I'm giving it 4 stars only because I didn't pay.  The steak was outstanding and service was fairly decent.  Not amazing but liveable.  I wanted to try to Kobe but that was a bit pricey so I stuck with the bone in rib eye.  Very flavorful and juicy.

ZYVr0q6PMQymBIxtUsHPIg.text: TENDER Steak & Seafood at Luxor is an unexpectedly great dining place. The food is SPECTACULAR, even though the atmosphere and service is not on par with that of a fine dining establishment. If you plan to check this place out, you must try the lobster risotto. Also, they have A5 wagyu kobe-style beef that is to.die.for. The pricing is similar to other fine dining restaurants, and rightly so due to the quality of the food. However, it may seem slightly pricey since there isn't the full fine dining experiencing, lacking in the areas of service and overall environment.

Djk644zWGTFMDy4NtWop1Q.text: Who would have thought a steakhouse in the Luxor would be a treat! To be honest, our first choice was to try Carnevino in the Palazzo but couldn't get a table - ARGGGG - so we "settled." But to our surprise - the services was excellente!   Granted the apps were a little pricey but what isn't at these restaurants right?! I digress - why talk about the money in Vegas.  It was a party of 12 so we ordered just about every appetizer there was on the menu - the escargot was delicious, but comes in services of 4 per order - the entire time I was thinking about how much escargot I could get a the buffet down the street!! LOL  For our main, I ordered their Rib-eye steak, medium rare and the wife ordered a filet mignon. I have to say, my 20oz piece of steak was DELICIOUS - it was the way I wanted it cooked - crispy on the outside, juicy inside.   TENDER may very well be added to the family destination for Vegas from now on...will have to return for a second time to see if the service and food is consistent - then it'll become a family tradition!!!

t7RYRpYTzl7MfYYIySlCsA.text: Don't know where to start. You get bugged by a guy taking your picture , then he comes back trying to sell them to you. Then you have the quality of food. Had to be the worst most unflavored steak I ever attempted to eat. It was the 8oz kobe. Was over cooked dry with no flavor at all . Best thing about the whole visit was getting out of there.

Sjhn57Y_Gxr--Touxe6HEw.text: My boyfriend and I went to Tender on a Tuesday night with an 815pm reservation through OpenTable, but it wasnt needed as the restaurant was NOT packed, it was very sparce actually. Here is what we ordered:  Lemon Drop martini: it was very well made, strong, but was tasteful. 5/5 Lobster Bisque: It was warm, not hot, and it was good but a bit too...buttery. 3/5 8oz Angus Filet Minon: Cooked perfectly (medium), very tender, took it without sauce since I like to savor the taste of meat and it was delicious. 5/5 Kansas Rib Eye?: Asked for medium, it was very RARE. We both cant eat rare meat and it was NOT cooked correctly that my boyfriend pretty much had a piece then ate off my plate. 1/5 Yukon mashed potatoes: moist, very good. 5/5 Grilled asparagus: Cant really mess these up. 5/5 Cheesecake: VERY creamy, chocolate topping was very sweet, crust was delicious. 4/5 Chocolate cake: its not really a cake as much a souffle, very sweet and creamy, wish there was more of the break part. 3/5  On a brighter note, my boyfriend shared our experience with the manager and he comped our desserts but we were pretty much done with dinner so we declined to have the steak recooked. We had a food comp to use so it wasnt too much of a hassle for us but if we were paying out of pocket I would have been VERY upset.  The ambiance on the other hand was dim-lit, we had two waiters, one was good but one was very slow, took a LONG time for absolutely everything. They also keep your waters next to you in this little hanger thing so everytime the waiter for the table next to us needed to grab water or drinks for the table next to us, I felt like our privacy was a but invaded. The decor is beautiful but the music they play is NOT correlated well with the ambiance of a steakhouse, it lowered the quality a bit. I would not bring children, its a great place for small parties I saw many parties of 4 dining here, but it doesnt seem to be very packed....is it due to the quality of food? Who knows?

olTa8Qga-1emgnPa5_CFSw.text: This place was a joke! We were seated by 3 young, and I mean young girls, that were half dressed at the hostess table. We sat down at our table and were given the wine menu, it was our 32nd Wedding Anniversary. The place was empty! We ordered a beer and a screwdriver. The menu came, OMGOSH! Everything, if we would of ordered, came separate, the protein, the vegetable, the potato, the soup or salad, nothing came with the protein and none of the proteins were less than 35.00????? Potato was 15.00, vegetable was 12.00, salad was 15.00 if you wanted to add that! Are you kidding???? The place looked like it used to be maybe a cafeteria, not a romantic dining place and we would NEVER pay a price like that, all dinners should come with a veggie and potato for that price, Lobster was like 85.00 and that was JUST the Lobster. We drank our drink and paid and left, went over to the Pub next door at the Mandalay Bay and ate like King and Queens and the price was great! We won't ever be back to Tender!

op_7ANNONX_5s8DzenMYtw.text: The steak was good just don't think worth 46.00.  I can't believe a Cesar  salad was $10.00.  Way too pricey for the taste, I get better taste and value at longhorn!

rf_nvVzXf1bA5X6SfW-Jnw.text: This was our second time here at Tender.  I remember the first time being a little bit better, but it still was a great experience.  So considering Tender is inside the Luxor, the quality of this place is great.  We made reservations, we were seated within 5 minutes, and our server was efficient.  Highs and Lows:  - The bread and pumpkin seed pesto was delicious.   - The photographer kept lurking around.  Annoying. - The shrimp cocktail was delicious, but not enough.  It came with 4, which is probably normal, but they served it with a number of different dipping sauces, which only accentuated that there were only 4 shrimp. - I got the filet mignon.  I ordered medium, but this was definitely medium rare.  Still good enough to finish. - The husband got the porterhouse.  He would have picked up the bone and gnawed on it if I would've let him.  It was that delicious.  He also got the mushroom sauce, which he loved. - The green bean casserole was great. - The Yukon mashed potatoes were very smooth and rich. - For dessert, we got the grandma's chocolate cake, which was recommended by our waiter.  It was obviously sitting in the freezer for a while, but it was delicious! - We also ordered the espresso martini with our dessert...FREAKING AMAZING!  It was sweet, but strong and super delicious!!!

XW4YZUwtXw7Ed5we3XFc7w.text: I'll save you the trouble and simply tell you what you should order: The lobster soup. Arugula salad Filet Mignon (Australian cut)  And if you have one other person that doesn't mind a wandering fork: Order your guest the mahi mahi pasta in pesto cream sauce, and down it all with one of their impressive wines.  I was so impressed with the hospitality, service and quality at this restaurant, it nearly made up for all of the subpar places we visited all around it.

wj8nsdQSz5YAX_enHYDclQ.text: I went here right as they were closing, which made the food come out extra quick, obviously cause the staff wanted to leave.  That was one of the few good things, and there aren't too many compared to other fine dining in las vegas.  Anyway, the decor is pretty cool. Reminds me of an old country club style or maybe even a law office with dark wood and comfortable booths. also a plus.  The wine and cocktail lists were good. They had a wide variety of stuff, this is standard in Vegas though.  I had the halibut for an entree and I must admit it was pretty good! The reason why this only gets three stars is because of the appetizers. The chili was bland, I like staggs better and it's much cheaper. The shrimp cocktail was...small, expensive and are probably the same shrimp you can get at the all you can eat buffet.   Overall, food was average, everything else was great. There's so many good places in Las Vegas, it's hard to give this anything more than 3 stars.

Zpfax5QuIUNL54hQy3HIkw.text: This'd place was a real good. The service was right there. Very helpful. The port house was pretty good, could have been a little thick. I don't think it was True to weight. I had the Kobe A5 grade filet. That was just outstanding. So worth it. Don't be afraid to spend on yourself. You won't be disappointed.

rCc8gaNsOzM0jQZVgLjaBw.text: Wow, Lobster Bisque soup and lobster were amazing. Of course the steak was amazingly tender and good, but it could have used a bit more flavor for the money. However, the service was absolutely top notch which leads to an amazing dining experience.

sRdrmwNZ8Q_y8MWfW5T1gg.text: Easily my favorite steakhouse in Vegas. And one of the best sirloin steaks a Ive ever had. Service is outstanding and the sides and sauces are all fantastic. Can't go wrong with any of the protein selections on the menu! I come every time I'm in town.

5s3Z_fP6fDjHo4fEgjMqrw.text: The steaks were not of the quality that I expected. I ordered the Rib-eye wagyu Dixon Ranch and for $75 it was terrible. I asked for medium rare and got medium well instead.  I've grilled better rib-eyes myself from Stater Bros for about one tenth the price. Everything else from the drinks, appetizers, sides were okay but nothing special. No need to ever go back to this place.

VSflffMS388Ix-Uj3BJLdg.text: We meet some people there for a meal after their wedding.  We got a glass of wine and soda at the bar, and it was $23.00.  $19 for the glass of wine, and $4.50 for the soda.  We were seated and the menu was to the point.  We ordered, and the service was excellent.  I got Filet Mignon and Shrimp.  The steak was very tender, and the shrimp was nice.  The only minus was that the shrimp didn't have any flavor to me.  There was also no salt or pepper on the table.  I would have liked to put some on my baked potato.  Overall, it was a good meal.  Rather expensive for a place at the Luxor.

1sX4w-aFmccsoM3VAJcLxg.text: I only know this place from loitering in the restaurant after it was closed. (When I say closed, everything was open and completely accessible.) The chairs were UBERcomfy. Security kicked us out though at 4:30 am. Sorry - we didn't know!

zTjx1V6RMDonCbzEmo-L_Q.text: Only had dessert here but they were legit and surprisingly affordable inside the luxor! 7 bucks for a solid dessert. I had a Smores dessert with peanut butter gelato (9/10), our group also had grandma's chocolate cake (9/10) and the milk chocolate coconut soufflet (7/10).  We aren't big soufflet lovers so that rating might be a bit harsh. Overall a solid late night dessert for out on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grandmas chocolate cake, smores dessert and soufflet

4L2zx8QFLbbc8DY0AjZLdw.text: Service was terrible from the second we got there. When they forgot two of our four drinks, and the tab was still $50, I think my group gave off the 'we're not rich' vibe..but from there we were ignored through the whole meal and we might have ordered more drinks. Wished I'd went someplace I knew was good rather than risk it.

eoukUOAS5lgHK58VhSIaHQ.text: Conveniently located off the casino portion within the Luxor, Tender is a great spot for a "fancy dinner" splurge.  Went to LV for a long weekend and we decided on Tender for dinner our first night.  The menu has so many delicious items to choose from, and, they start you off with delicious bread and pesto dipping oil.  Our server, (Dewey I believe) was amazing, he was attentive, informative and friendly.  The menu is al a carte, but, the portion of the sides are enough to split.  (we had a group of 4 and I would say each side is enough for 4).  The bar made yummy drinks and the time between sitting down, ordering and receiving food, was just enough to make it a comfortable experience.  The restaurant offers little tables for your purse to keep it off the floor which, was nice.  The decor would be considered a bit dated if it were a standalone restaurant in BOS but, for Vegas, it was great.  There is a woman that walks around to take "prom" style photos of your table (I find this is a staple at most of the restaurants I have been at in LV), we had fun with it.

8OO4YkjtsFudcEHr7kIG2g.text: Steak was excellent, wine was great. I wish our server was more attentive, I felt he was rushing out of the steakhouse. It was the only white spot in an otherwise enjoyable dining experience.

ldBIdwi8OCHi0uRQ5rCd2Q.text: The only reason I am giving this place more than one star is because they have McConnells ice cream from my home town, but don't expect your server to know where it is from...I ask and he said it was a local gelato...I asked why does it explain it from grass fed California cows ICE CREAM? Why doesn't it say gelato? He didn't have much of a response. But after trying it I'm sure where from. Anyways if you can't tell already, the service was horrible.  The  server, Alan, was preticerly rude and very short and unknowledgeable about the products at the restaurant he worked...or he just didn't care to give us the extra time. Either way the food definitely did nothing to commend the service. Lobster in the bisque was chewy...gross, I didn't even take more than 3 bites. Steak was over done and under seasoned. Creme brulee is hard to mess up and was the best flavor of the meal. I don't recommend wasting your money here. There are so many places in Vegas... Go somewhere they appreciate their guest. I'd recommend Delmonico's or the Steakhouse in circus circus.   Goes without saying but I will anyways, we will not be revisiting this restaurant. This was our first and last meal here.

ELPCNcg9pC2h8Rr2qk0r7A.text: I won a gift certificate to Tender at work and was looking forward to trying out Luxor's steakhouse.   My expectations weren't high as I haven't heard anyone really talk about Tender before. I was pleasantly surprised by how nice my dinner was!  We had two male servers who assisted us for dinner which was different for a steakhouse. Both were kind and professional and made a point to check up on our table throughout the evening.   We got a half dozen oysters and a salmon platter to start. I really enjoyed the salmon platter which came in three small presentations: salmon poke, seared salmon, and smoked salmon. For steak I got the dry aged rib eye and was pretty impressed! It lived up to the name of the steakhouse; very tender and juicy. There wasn't too much fat which I liked. For sides, we ordered the asparagus for some greens and the lobster risotto. Asparagus wasn't anything special and the risotto was very rich and creamy.   I would choose Mastro's or Craftsteak over Tender but I still really enjoyed my experience here. I think that some may underestimate how good Tender actually is!

Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half dozen oysters and salmon platter

DunoKrS0vGDKoNaZQMdicg.text: I like the food here. I haven't had a steak here that wasn't done correctly. We went during their slow hours, so we got seated immediately. It wasn't crowded at the time, so it was quiet and able to have conversations you can actually hear.

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Whatever this cake was, it was a great way to end a meal!
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wagyu Beef Carpaccio &amp; Ribeye Steak Sampler

r0QHV_EnsKnO9165bZIpEA.text: Well I'll tell you what, for a place that sells a $90 steak, I had better not be sitting there looking for service.    Waited 5 minutes and walked. Went to the Italian dive about 100 feet away, saved $200 and got great service

0S5RJIJhiIMYLhyPQVrjIg.text: Tucked amidst the casino in the Luxor Hotel is a beef eater paradise. Tender Steak & Seafood is a high end steakhouse with premium cuts of beef at premium prices. The back room is similar to old style steak houses in New York with great personal service from experienced waiters.   Menu items; The Ribeye trio which is 3 different cuts of meat including bison is a wonderful selection. All steaks were tender and flavorful. Side note: Don't come to fine steak restaurants and order steaks medium or well done. A great juicy steak is prepared rare to medium rare.   The Tomahawk steak looks like something the Flintstones would eat. Both of these cuts of meat can be split among two people.  The fish choices were somewhat unspectacular however if you are going to a premium steak house, you should be prepared for the turf and not the surf. The grilled asparagus, mash potatoes, cream corn are all extra ($10 ea)   Deserts: the banana foster was recommended and for a good reason, the rum sauce was simply great. Overall a great dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomahawk steak

2HcQzW2tnJnat1kaET_QiQ.text: Tender is a quite Oasis in the madness that is Vegas, It was our first night and the wee Cuz's Birthday and we had vouchers courtesy of the Check In Desk for free Cocktails.  The Menu was not huge but the Server was very knowledgeble about the cuts of meats and best sides to have with what.  I ordered a Lamb Shank and a side of Yukon Gold Mash, and the wee Cuz ordered a trio of Fillet with a Kobi,Bison and Venison and a side of Bone Marrow.  My Lamb came with Lentils and Vegatables although I very much enjoyed having the Potatoes they were not really necessary, the lamb was very tender and tasty. The wee Cuz loved all of her cuts of meat they were cooked just as she wanted and she loved the Bone Marrow.  We had a glass of house wine with dinner I had a very nice Merlot and the wee Yin er usual Rose with Soda and Ice.  We were not thinking of Pudding as we were both happily full, but the attaentive server had heard Pauline say it was her Birthday and brought her a trio of Desserts with Happy Birthday pipied onto the plate a very nice gesture.  Ther was a delicious Creme Caramel with a shortbread biscuit topper, Chocolate cake and a Caramel Cheese Cake, Mmmmm I am not a big pudding eater but the Creme Caramel was delicious. After Dinner we retired to the Bar and had our complimentry Cocktail I had a very nice Cosmopolit and and wee Cuz had a Mojito.  All in all a very nice dining experience so much we returned on the Saturday to repeat the experience.

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oscar boca
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Venison Bison and Wild Boar Chop
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yukon gold mash

B3wH1LLbxzBFlyEfM72Blg.text: We had a reservation and we're seated about 10 minutes after our reservation.  We had 2 servers (one in training).  They worked separately and the trainee was not very good.  He was not personable, took forever to even take our drink order, barely paid attention when we were giving him our order because he was too busy listening to the other tables conversation and then kept saying to us "what do you want?" in a snarky tone.   The other server, amazing! Luckily he stepped in towards the end and finished up everything.  Even gave us a complimentary dessert for our anniversary that we were celebrating. The food was pretty good.  I ordered the sea bass, my husband had the rib eye.  Then we ordered 3 sides (I think the deal was 3 sides for $20).  Oddly enough, our favorite item.  The creamed corn.  Amazing!  Also ordered mashed potatoes and wild mushrooms.  If you aren't into truly exotic mushrooms, I wouldn't recommend.  They tasted great, but there were two types of mushrooms in the blend that we so hard and mealy they were basically inedible.  The meat and fish were good, not the best we've ever had, but pretty good. We'll be back next time we're in town, just hoping waiter #1 won't be there! ;)

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy dessert assortment!

-MV-mMKgavKiWu09pdhBPg.text: Review #500  Allow me to preface this review by thanking Yelp for providing me the opportunity to become part of such a friendly and positive social community.  I am thankful, as well as grateful, for all the acquaintances and friendships that I have nurtured and developed over the past five years.  Since becoming a more active member last year, I have attended numerous enjoyable and lively events, met many fun and humorous people, gained knowledge on the art of photobombing, co-hosted three UYEs, and established new friendships.    Though this review is about a restaurant, it's significant since my meal at Tender was with two wonderful friends I met thru Yelp.  At the same time, my main purpose of traveling to Las Vegas was to meet and reunite with old/dear friends.    And so, I dedicate my 500th review to Yelp, good friends, good food, and good times.  Now, on to the review:  a TENDER moment.  Truly some of the best food and service I have experienced has been in the gambling capital of America, Las Vegas.  Many thanks to fellow yelper, Rod U., for introducing me to his "kitchen" while vacationing in Las Vegas recently.  Located on the casino level of the Luxor, the bar area is inviting while opening up to the remainder of the spacious restaurant.  Though Tender doesn't look very grand or large from the outside, surprisingly the restaurant stretches farther within (as I soon found out after a visit to the restroom).  Since Rod had dined here numerous times (and actually regained his Dukedom during the trip), I allowed him to take the lead on where to sit and what to order.  Rod's area of choice:  the bar, of course.  Now, for those of you who are not fond of bar seating, I implore you to rethink your decision.  Bar seating is quite enjoyable and entertaining to say the least.  It was clearly no surprise that Rod knew practically all of the bartenders working on both of our visits.  Mike and Robin stand out, particularly, in my memory for their outgoing and social personalities.    FOOD:  *Tomato salad (shared):  A special consisting of various types of tomatoes from the Napa Valley served with mozzarella cheese and spattered with olive oil.  It was exquisite.  The perfect start to our meal.  Recommended if available.  *Chilled salmon tasting:  Three types were served including house cured gravlax, hot apple-wood smoked Skuna Bay salmon, and cold smoked Atlantic salmon.  Absolutely delicious.  I'd order this appetizer again for sure.  *Lamb Tasting:  This dish included lamb rack chop and lamb loin porterhouse.  Served with couscous and rosemary garlic lamb sauce.  Having only tried lamb once before, I decided to be adventurous.  The lamb was prepared well, and I enjoyed this dish immensely.   Cuts and portion size were just right.  The second dinner/visit with Rod and Terry K proved to be more enjoyable, humorous and full of laughter.  It seems its always a party with these two whether in Hawaii or on the mainland.  Of course, we all sat at the bar where we could engage in good conversation with the staff and amongst ourselves.  Plus, another round of drinks is quicker to order at the bar (*wink).  FOOD:  *Escargot (shared):  A nice start to the meal.  Small portions shared between the three of us.    *Bone Marrow:  Generous portion that looks intimidating, until you realize the actual portion must be separated from the bones themselves.  Very delectable.  For those that have yet to try bone marrow, take a chance and do try it at least once.    *Pork Chop:  I was shocked when the dish was finally set before me.  The portion is a behemoth certainly.  My fear was I wouldn't be able to make a dent after all the appetizers we ordered.  The meat was tender and preparation just perfect.    DRINK:    Martinis and wine were the beverages of choice for dinner.  An extensive wine list is available.  DESSERT:  *Espresso martini:  The perfect end to a delicious meal.   That is all.  SERVICE:  Friendly, accommodating, meticulous, with superb attention to detail.  And I'm not just talking about the bartenders.  All staff we encountered exhibited such exceptional customer service.  Waters were readily refilled, rounds of drinks were quickly provided when requested, plates were cleared away and silverware replaced in a timely manner.  Appetizers and entrees were also delivered within a reasonable amount of time from when orders were placed.  There were some great conversations had with the bartenders especially, as they asked about where we were going and what we planned to do while in Vegas.  All the while they were also seeing to other patrons and filling drink orders for the restaurant.  Just an outstanding showing of camaraderie, teamwork, and exceptional service overall.  A job well done.  BOTTOM LINE:  A memorable and delicious meal shared with two wonderful friends, whom I never would have met were it not for Yelp.  Cheers to good friends and good food!!

Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Escargot
