Eg-dVMfWAfYf13uH5-FyHQ.text: I come here every time I am in town..and the food is always fantastic.  One of the best steak houses in town!  A little pricey, but always top quality.

BZZ7cyMGUHpO_saBIE-alQ.text: Dinner was on an early Friday evening at 730.  We arrived right around that time and were seated immediately.  The hostess was polite and courteous.  Soon after, our servers Manuel and Tham introduced themselves.  Water and bread with the pesto Parmesan cheese in olive oil was delicious.  The menu has more than enough items to satisfy a steak and seafood eater.  Anyhow, we had the heirloom tomatoes with the side of bacon-the tomatoes were fresh, light, and surprisingly tasty.  The bacon added a savory element to the lightness of the tomatoes.  Our entrees consisted of the 8oz filet and the sea bass.  Sides were potatoes au gratin and asparagus.  We did actually have enough room left over for dessert and we had the bananas foster bread pudding; it was very good.  In summary, I really enjoyed dinner at Tender.  The wait staff was attentive without being annoying.  The atmosphere is typical of the old style steak house; dimly light with darker tones.  I do like that there was no obnoxiously loud music playing in the background... my pet peeve is having to yell to hear one another.  The food portions were perfect for me.  That being said, they will probably too small for you lol... The prices to me were reasonable for what you get.  We did have the MyVegas comp, and I think that made this meal even more enjoyable.  I've paid more for less at other high profile celebrity chef restaurants and I've paid less for comparable quality of food and service at other steak houses.  This is Vegas and it is what it is.  All in all this was a positive experience and one that ensures that the gf and I will be returning to Tender when we can.

JrZUyr9z2mRSDRYOH8MtJA.text: I came here on a Thursday night and was very happy with my decision.  The atmosphere is classy, and the tables are comfortable.  To start I had 6 oysters on the half shell.  The sauces that come with really complemented the oysters!  Delicious! For my meal I had the Maine sea scallops.  It was 3 jumbo scallops with duck bacon on roasted bell pepper and edamame quinoa salad with avocado lobster blue crab puree.  It was AMAZING!  For dessert I had some type of blonde brownie that came in a skillet  and it was yummy as well.  My server was super nice and very social.  I am really glad I came here!

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters on the half-shell.  Look at all those delicious toppings they give you.  Was delicious!

nq8pfraM1CVN9NBVi5oXzg.text: Tender was surprisingly good. Used a $75 credit for spending $150. (MyVegas reward). Service was good: friendly and attentive. Ordered the Ribeye trio: you get 3 small cuts (4-6 oz) of Australian wagyu, New Zealand, and bison. All three were distinctively different. Wagyu was best as expected: flavorful, buttery, and succulent. New Zealand was second, and Bison third (gamey taste).  Wife ordered top sirloin which she enjoyed.  Recommend Tender especially if you have a MyVegas reward!

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Top sirloin
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye trio (left to right): New Zealand, Bison, Australian Wagyu.

Lfwtp78kgievWmWc-OtBoA.text: This review is for their Fall Las Vegas Restaurant Week 2014 menu.   Yelp Confession #265: I've never had an actual sit-down meal at a steakhouse, but Restaurant Week changed all that and Tender introduced me to the world of steakhouse dining. With that being said, bear with my newbie-ness to steakhouses.   Appetizer - Maine Lobster Bisque: A thick and creamy soup with several pieces of soft lobster meat. A good starter soup to warm you up for the next course.   Entree - Organic Free-Range Jidori Half Chicken: Sooo, I didn't order steak. Yeah, yeah, I know that I should've, but I ate steak the the day before and wasn't expecting to dine here the following evening. But hey, wouldn't you expect their other carnivorous offerings to be exceptional? The chicken breast and leg were perfectly cooked; no dryness at all. What I didn't like was the filmy chicken skin. I just can't stomach the idea of eating thin, fatty skin....of course, unless the skin was battered and fried or roasted -- hey, it's a preference.  Entree - Certified Angus Beef 10oz Rib-eye Steak: Tender, just like the name of the steakhouse it was prepared in. Soft to bite into, and juicy, no gnawing required. On the other hand, my boyfriend, who ordered the steak, didn't like its smokey flavor. Maybe my taste buds were out-of-whack that evening, but I wasn't able to detect any smokiness. Perhaps this might not be the best entree to order if you like your steak prepared as is, or with minimal seasoning.   Dessert Tasting Trio: The desserts were chocolate souffle, New York-style cheesecake, and creme brulee. All the desserts were delightful in their own way, but my favorites were the cheesecake and creme brulee.   Foie Gras - I couldn't resist ordering a side of foie gras, which was served on a small bed of fried rice -- yes, fried rice, and being Asian I squealed with excitement in my mind. On top of the seared foie gras was a heaping spoonful of blueberry compote. The combination of fried rice, foie gras, and blueberries was divine; I loved every. single. bite! Plus, you can't beat the portion size and the $19 cost. Other restaurants would easily charge 26 bucks for all that.  Service - Fine.   Other - The complimentary slices of bread were cold. Really?! Come on, Tender! Even the Grand Lux way down the street serves warm bread.    Overall - Not bad for my first steakhouse dining experience. Obvious tip: Stick with ordering the steak, or something other than the jidori chicken. Bon Appetit!

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foie gras
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert Tasting Trio
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Organic Free-Range Jidori Half Chicken

de2JnKM-tpxHgajTAFPYsg.text: This place is amazing! I wanted to make a reservation for a nice steak house for my husbands birthday and after my first choice was booked up, I looked around and found this place. I was a bit nervous because the reviews were mixed but decided to at least make a reservation and if something else came up then we could always cancel. I am so glad I didn't as this was one of the best places I have ever eaten!   My party of five arrived a few minutes late because we had trouble getting a cab from our hotel to the Luxor. It was not a problem and we were seated immediately. Our waiters were attentive and gave us suggestions on the menu. They assisted my table with cocktail and wine choices and were able to answer all our questions on the menu honestly, which I appreciate.   I ordered the tomahawk steak to split with my husband and our other guests ordered the porterhouse and New York strip. Every steak was cooked to perfection. All of us ordered different "sauces" to try with the steaks and although they tasted delicious, I don't even know why they are offered as every steak was insanely tender and amazing. Our tomahawk steak was probably the best thing I have ever eaten, the fat melted like butter and I hardly needed my knife at all to cut it. My table ordered the asparagus, gratin potatoes and mushrooms for sides and they were equally flavorful and a great suggestion from our waiters.   I made a comment that we were celebrating my husbands birthday, and to our surprise, the waiters remembered and brought my husband a cake with a candle Very sweet and I didn't even know they heard me talking to my table.   Overall I would highly recommend Tender and I am honestly very surprised that this steak house has received any review that is other than stellar. I dont see it...it's nothing other than amazing, delicious steaks!

LQmC86ef2JBPTXjPshQbug.text: Back to Tender for Restaurant Week, and another fine meal.    Excellent fresh Multigrain Bread with rich butter and good Sourdough dipped in fresh Pesto were nice complimentary openers.  Maine Lobster Bisque with Creamed Fresh Roasted Maine Lobster was silky smooth, with just a hint of a Sherry-like accent.  And a 10 oz. Certified Double R Ranch Angus Beef Ribeye Steak with Bell Pepper Sauce was perfectly medium rare as ordered.  The sauce,  a type I had never experienced before, tasted remarkably like Green Bell Pepper, and was very pleasant and complemented the beef quite well.  I just wished I had more of it to ladle over the melt-in-the-mouth meat.  But the Bearnaise Sauce ordered by Diane was so good it was drinkable, so my steak was not  suffering from any lack of sauce.  Baked Potato Wedges were soft but surprisingly tasty --like giant, full-figured French Fries.  After a long break between the completion of our entrees and service of dessert, the final course, a Dessert Tasting Trio of Vanilla Bean Creme Brulee, Chocolate Souffle Cake, and New York Style Cheesecake, included a rather bitter Chocolate Souffle with Mango Pearls and Mango, but excellent Cheesecake and a very fine Creme Brulee.  Two waiters served us very proficiently throughout our dinner.  Our water glasses were regularly refilled, and the restaurant manager even paid us a call to see that our party of four was being taken care of properly.  We were made to feel welcome, and each of us enjoyed a very satisfying dinner.    4-1/2 stars overall!

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert Tasting Trio
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom Soup II
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 10 oz. Certified Double R Ranch Angus Beef Ribeye Steak with Roasted Bell Pepper Sauce and Baked Potato Wedges

QgLFGSzBPBiJ2PrNYA1W8A.text: Excellent service paired with even better food! Awesome overall experience. I had the oysters on half shell for starters and then dove into the 20oz ribeye with 1lb of crab legs. It was hard to get up I was so full. May be a new contender for my personal favorites. Highly recommend.

2sDXPPwNCfjWjgxM07wCxg.text: There are a lot of steakhouses in Las Vegas, and in my opinion, this place could be better. The hostess was very sweet in greeting us and she was one of the highlights of the dinner, besides the wedge salad with bacon. The server was snooty and a bit awkward. The food is very overpriced for what you get. The sides are really only enough for one person, maybe 2 at the most if you aren't hungry- certainly not for table sharing.  The wedge salad with the bacon was delicious though- that was worth the $14 for sure.

ze-iG91WJG-N_ctWGO_DVw.text: 2nd time dining at Tender.....So here's my play by play experience. Dress code is not enforced, the people ahead of us looked like they just came from a 1980's Guns n Roses concert (no, the rock group was not in Vegas). We were seated quickly, the ambiance is nice and so was our waiter....who seemed to be working as a busser too. The wine list is meh, mainly a lot of cheap big name wines ie Kendal Jackson, Mondavi, etc. Nothing really unique. The bread (rolls) came out and I'm pretty sure they were bought at the local grocery aisle. Onto the main course, I got the ribeye and the wife got the filet with crab. Both were very good and cooked correctly. But overall, too many little things knocked this steakhouse restaurant down to 3 stars for me, I had/used a $75 comp from the MyVegas app and that was probably the only reason we had eaten here. Otherwise, Tender is not any cheaper than other Las Vegas steak houses but it lacks the "wow factor" of a high end steak house.

x6i01aLHsNvCkDgsnkd6Ew.text: Girlfriend and I went here back on February 13, 2019. Staff was very nice and accommodating. We read many reviews about a waiter that goes by the name Dewey. It was just our luck we were sat down in one of his tables. He was super busy but he was by far one of the best waiters we have ever had. Even though he was busy, he didn't lack service at all.  His knowledge of the menu and his recommendations were perfect. The manager even came out and asked how things were going which shows how important the customer is. We both had the filet mignon topped with lump crab meat and asparagus on the side. The meat was cooked to perfection per how we asked. When Dewey had time he stopped and chatted with us which showed he also a very personable person which I think is very important to the experience and how important the customer feels to the restaurant. To sum it up, staff was great, food was great and the ambiance was romantic if that's what you're going for. Bad reviews are from grumpy, entitled people with expectations that aren't achievable. Haha! Go there. It's worth it and I hope you get Dewey as a server. He's the best!!!!

r76oTh8-hyk7l0xsQYKO_A.text: Beautiful place. But service and food only worth half the price. Purchased bottle of wine. Gave me wrong year, opened it, poured and disappeared!   Had to hunt another sever for refill.  Spent over $250 for a barely $125 experience. Won't return

j3VPnkoHvv29IF2zMnxkdw.text: We both shared a wonderful bottle of Conn Creek wine. I had a mushroom soup-very good.  We both ordered Angus Rib Eye medium rare. Pretty bad meat, must have been the most active steer on the range. Could not cut the meat, was tasteless. Really subpar meat.  Service was excellent

ihFpngCsznRoWozLuxsCsQ.text: I completely agree with Harry S.'s  review!  Ridiculous!!  Please get some training to these servers!   Whenever I have steak I always like to bring my own bottle of wine, when I made the reservation I asked what the corkage fee would be and was perfectly fine paying it. When we are sat the first thing the waiter says is "you know you're going to pay for me to open that right?!" ...um what the heck???????? Obviously! A nice steak house with that kind of service? Give me a break! I felt very offended at his condescending demeanor and disrespect! Our server knew nothing about steaks or fine service for that matter! He could see I was annoyed and essentially said the bare minimum to me the rest of the evening.   His original comment totally set the stage for the actual dinner, our cuts of meat where all ok, perhaps I was just annoyed from my greeting that everything just seemed blah. My wife's filet mignon was overcooked, my ribeye was actually very tasty but not the best I've had.   The highlight of our evening was the dessert. Wow! Banana foster plus bread pudding and banana rum sauce made and absolutely amazing delicious banana bread pudding experience! Absolutely the best.   When you visit a steak house or any type of better dining establishment you expect a certain level of service to complement your experience, unfortunately this restaurant completely failed.

ZXOkR_il53xpH4pUz-n2HA.text: The venue is very nice.  Food is very expensive considering the venue is in the location in the Luxor.  There were so many unusual menu items, that I had a hard time finding a traditional meal selection.  I thought the food (all of it) was over priced.   As in most fine dining establishments, everything was ala carte, but I find it a little hard to pay $9 for a bowl of so-so mashed potatoes. I decided on the fresh fish sampler ($44) and it consisted of three pieces of fish 2" x 2" squares on a variety of lentils and other legumes and all three pieces were salty.  The fourth item was a prawn on some other spoonful of lentils?  The prawn was good, but I would have preferred sauteed spinach or creamed corn or mashed potatoes as the base instead of what was used in this dish.

ZNw0ztkBqvd6cijGhgzAzA.text: I went to Tender last Sunday, and it was a wonderful meal! First off, this is a very typical steakhouse. They have filet mignon.. and lyonnaise potatoes.. the usual stuff. The decor is typical of a steakhouse.   To start I had one of the special a caprese salad, with heirloom tomatoes it was delicious. Absolutely perfect tomatoes and the cheese was perfectly seasoned. Loved it. My mom had a Caesar salad, she also enjoyed it. For dinner I had the small filet, it was good, I've had better, but nothing to really complain about, cooked to my liking of medium rare. The lyonnaise potatoes were ok, the wild mushrooms were delicious! We both loved those! My mom had a lobster tail, which they gladly removed from the shell for her. She said it was a little bit bland though.   We had a MyVegas comp, so $150 certificate. Our meal came to $149 before tax. So really not bad price wise. I would have paid full price for my meal no problem. In comparison, we did go to Stripsteak at Mandalay the next night, our prix fix meal was more than this... a full meal off the menu at Stripsteak would of probably been close to $300 so it was a great value at Tender!  Overall a great meal, great ambiance, great service. We had 2 or 3 servers waiting on us, all very attentive. I would suggest sitting in the back room, we sat there it was nice, away from the casino. I would say if you are staying at Luxor or nearby it's a great steakhouse and worth the money. I probably wouldn't go out of my way to eat here though.

cEqBJ4Fp7s_GghyLN9hLFw.text: We ordered the cheese plate to start out with. The cheese's were good but there was only 2 small pieces of each cheese. The steaks were juicy and cooked perfectly. The server helped us pick a yummy bottle of wine. We were very impressed with the service from our server and the restaurant manager.

gbgdLGRmiZNGMQPxX5lhYw.text: Fresh bread with pesto and olive oil for dipping just getting started. Heirloom tomatoes with Buffalo mozzarella cheese micro greens and pink Himalayan sea salt brilliant! Grilled asparagus and the perfectly seared fillet Mignon. Coffee was good too!

JgKKOPMeb1mVGtaQuFqmWg.text: WOW! Great steaks and sides are extremely tasty and expensive..but totally worth it. My friends steak wasn't done the way he ordered it but he decided he would just deal with it and ate about a 1/4 of it. His girlfriend mentioned this to the waiter who quickly rectified the situation..new steak ASAP!!  Very good customer service here...  Best part of the Luxor hotel.

XyRglYjCa886Fdhbm_xHKg.text: I have been to Vegas many times but finally stumbled upon Tender quite by accident. Admittedly, I am always somewhat skeptical of places such as this because I have been disappointed before- NOT the case here.  First off the ambiance and staff are phenomenal, despite being connected to a casino. The waiting staff is well versed on all of their options as well as proper items to accompany with. I tried many things and not one was below par in the slightest, but the star of the show (surprisingly enough) was a burger...  Definitely not any normal burger though, I wont ruin any secrets but all of the ingredients of the "surf, turf, and air" burger are of the highest quality and it can be tasted. Without a doubt the best meal I have ever had anywhere.

PCnzAd5ynD1E1OY-Si22PA.text: One of the bright spots during our stay at the Luxor.  5 star restaurant all the way.  Tip -  Try the strawberry shortcake for dessert and the espresso martini as an after dinner drink.   YUM O!

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Osso Buco. YUM!
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Espresso martini!
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry shortcake

Ph232-7P8TWgbxrFccrPOw.text: This is the only positive thing I can attribute to the Luxor  Food was great. Prices ok.

Sxpy7OVNdJ1ms2fYxHVwqA.text: Dined here with my husband.  First, the quality of the food was good.  The cheese plate was amazing.  As a vegetarian I asked what the chef could prepare for me (I know it is a steakhouse, but most places are accommodating) They said they might be able to make a pasta dish, not really what I was looking for so I just ordered some sides.    One of the biggest complaints I have is with the waitstaff.  Overheard one complaining to another about a tip they just received.  Our waiter ended up overcharging us for what we ordered.   Probably will not eat here again, unless all I'm getting is the cheese plate.

2-i6KS752isRjrd-tOsgJw.text: This review focuses on 4 letters: K-O-B-E and can be summed up in 4 words - prices don't match quality. I guess that's what happens when you don't have time to go to Japan, Hong Kong, or Macau to have authentic KOBE beef. You think you can get by with American KOBE to satisfy your taste curiosity. But keep that box on your bucket list unchecked.   It was Thanksgiving weekend. We ordered the following dishes at Tender. Filet Mignon: wagyu Kobe-style beef, Dixon Ranch, North Dakota (boneless 8 oz) ($80) Filet Mignon: black angus Omaha beef  (boneless 12 oz) ($49) Top Sirloin: wagyu Kobe-style beef, Snake River Farms, Idaho  (10 oz) ($35) Grilled asparagus ($9)  Visuals and Tastes Sizes shouldn't matter in this case as long as good things come in small packages.   In retrospect, although we should have toned down our expectations, we couldn't help but feel a bit disappointed when the waiter showed us the portions. It's a piece of small steak, accompanied by a few drips of sauce and a tiny bit of onions. The dishes all look quite "lonely". By that, I don't mean exquisite like some French cuisine. I mean the chef who prepared our food probably didn't bother to showcase any traces of his vision of food arts.   The steak looked overcooked despite it was easy to cut through. It's tender enough and juicy on first bite. But the flavor was rather bland and uninspiring. I had better KOBE-style beef before and honestly think some sub-thirty-dollar steaks from certain steakhouse franchises can top this.   The overall quality of KOBE beef at Tender doesn't warrant their price tags.  Since I'm giving 3-stars, I should leave this review with something positive. The ambience. it is great for couples who enjoy dining under dim lights as part of their romantic getaway.

V0iV4IVwUpxql4zmM5ZSbQ.text: Four of us dined this past Sunday. Bar tender was pleasant as well as the hostess. Found our waiter to be a bit abrupt. After we scanned the menu for a few minutes our waiter approached to take our orders. When my husband ordered a filet and lobster our waiter abruptly told him they were out of lobster. Hmmm... 7pm dinner and your already out of something? I would have accepted that answer if they were slammed with patrons or if he had advised us prior to ordering. Waiter also cleared our wine glasses even though my husband had every intention of ordering a glass of wine with his meal. Food was ok, although we've had better for the price. Bread was served cold, would have been nice warm. Also would have liked to have salt and pepper, not displayed on the table and not offered to us freshly ground table side. Doubt we'd return next time in LV

BjiwO8IOeLBQC5BAsZkw-g.text: This restaurant salvaged my Las Vegas trip!  I was at a seemingly never-ending business trip a few weeks ago in which I stayed at NYNY Hotel.  On my last night and after having seen an advertisement on tv in the morning, I decided to go see the musical "Menopause" at the Luxor and eat dinner at Tender, also in the Luxor.    After the show, I walked through the casino and found Tender.  With no reservation, I asked if I could dine at the bar and the hostess staff were very pleasant and seated me right away.  My bartender brought me an awesome glass of Cabernet,  and let me unwind while I perused the menu.  Very lovely choices of beef, and some unusual big game kind of entrees for the more daring palate - I saw several items that I'd like to try.  On that night, though I selected a wedge salad and a classic filet - It was perfection!  I would highly recommend this restaurant and plan on going again on my next LV visit!

qjEIRC9waloUm8nbCcwNeA.text: Food was great. Had multiple bar tenders. First bar tender was good. Second one inserted himself into a conversation he shouldn't have. Didn't seem like a big deal at the time.. But the more I think about it the more irritated I become. Living in California and traveling to Las Vegas could become a habit. I will probably never eat at this place again because of this bartender.

jlLo3br5D202T12Wj93xvQ.text: I really enjoyed my experience here. As other reviewers have said, typical steakhouse. But it was pretty good! Service was great too.  I got a cosmo (Meh... I've had better) and a filet. Mmm, delicious. My party also split the cheese plate as an appetizer - OMG, FANTASTIC. The goat cheddar was to die for.   We stayed in Excalibur right next door so it was a short walk. Good excuse to browse around Luxor too.

WJEku2PsdGcaYYNrJyHs_g.text: At first, I was going to rate this place one star, but the decor really is something to admire. Rest assure, that's where the compliments end.  I came to the Luxor to see Criss Angel with my sister and our men. we had called to book tickets for dinner as well. Tender was recommended. They gave us a list of options for a meal with a few exquisite options and based on those choices we agreed to fine there.  Upon arrival we receive an entirely different menu than what was described to us. When we notified the manager, he explained that we were told the wrong menu, that the box office has an outdated list. (Not our problem, we booked this place based on THAT description) After our expressed disappointment that we would not be getting the Filet Mignon that we were promised, he told us he would talk to the chef an see if he can have that made for us. (I'm confused...why he would have to talk to the chef since that's something that's on their full length menu) He returned and told us that the chef was able and will make us what we asked for. (This whole ordeal took 30 minutes! Keep in mind we had a show to get to)  Once the meal arrived we noticed immediately how large our filet's were. Cutting into them, we were sure this was NOT anywhere near a Filet Mignon! I'm sure they dressed up a chuck steak and tried to pass it off for what we ordered. They took us as fools! This meal alone was $100 a head! And even without great expectations, they fell wayyyy too short.  Tired of complaining with the little time they had left us to race to our show we ate in peace, and by peace I mean the waiter was absent almost the entire time. My sister had to get up and chase him down at one point! And no...it was no where near busy.  At the end of the meal, the manager promised to comp one of the bottles of wine we ordered, and only reduced the price by 25%. This was incredibly bad service. And to treat us like that, was incredibly disrespectful. I wouldn't advice going to this place....not unless you want to feel drained and insulted.

sDHfcY_lTP8VzyoEpi8n4A.text: This restaurant is consistent excellent. From the food to the service. I haven't been in almost a year yet the waitress remembers me. Aide is the epitome of what a waitress should be. Very pleasant, not pushy, great at recommending what's good and what goes with what. You are given the time to enjoy your food and drink but when needed she is right there. And the food. Oh my goodness. My filet mignon was cooked so perfectly. I barely needed a knife to cut it. The sauteed exotic mushrooms where a perfect match. I don't see how they could have done it any better!

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YWFBCz-PV2h_QqP-CIEAnQ.text: Everything here was wonderful!  Steaks were tender and perfectly cooked.  We were celebrating our anniversary and the waited brought a complimentary dessert sampler.  The

tJH1wfDzBVSACM0onV8cUA.text: We went for dinner, the food was good. Service was ok. A long time in between courses.

BlDpDQA-mS_2FMrBftpPzg.text: Was served a bread basket with refrigerated bread.  Had to ask the waiter for bread that was room temperature.  Ordered the lobster bisque, worst lobster bisque ever.  Tasted as I imagine dirty dish water with fish heads would taste.  Management took the cost of the bisque off the ticket.  I had the lamb and it was bland and severely over salted.  The cauliflower was charred beyond recognition.  We decided to cut our losses and did not order dessert.  Wait staff was not attentive.  Be wise and spend your money elsewhere!

x_a87ivEKiDK0rhykvhlHA.text: Just ok. Had ribeye and salmon with salads. Steak was undercooked and salmon did not seem that fresh. Would not go back.

3hoBVAKRRZAtSm2PWjdSrg.text: Best tuna I have ever had, however I have had better service at Chili's.  Our server was too caught up in everyone's wine and mixed drinks order and flat walked away without confirming whether I wanted a drink or not.  Then I ordered the tuna and a salad and his response was "you don't want a side?"  I said no I want the green salad.  20 minutes later after everyone has their salad and meals still no salad for me.  Someone at the table called the server on it and indignantly he asks "you wanted a salad?"  They did bring a complimentary dessert for the wife's birthday but I had to beg for a beer and never got a salad or an apology.  The wife had a steak along with several others at the table and most everyone stated the steaks were tough.  I tried a bite of my wife's and it was marginal at best.  If you go and I wouldn't stick to the seafood.

zXpXNt8ewZ5vinGwsleHvw.text: Tonight we went here for the first time only to use some comps...... it still cost us about $80 or so.  Service was good.  Bread came right away and they were on top of the water glasses.  Our server Alan was very good and checked on us enough and not too often to be annoying, he was a nice guy.  I had the Kansas City Strip steak, it was actually pretty good, we shared asparagus and french fries, not the best fries in the world, I have had better but they were okay.......     The steak was soft and pretty tasty, my husband had the porterhouse and that was good as well.   This was much better than Camelot at Excalibur...... don't waste your time going there, we went there for Mother's day and will not return to Camelot.  Mescalin salad was good, I requested cherry tomatoes instead of sun dried tomatoes which they did...... it was good.  They ask you if you want steak sauce but they don't tell you there is a fee which I found a bit amusing.  He named three or so, so I picked the Bearnaise and we were charged $3 for it. I don't really care but it would have been nice to know before hand.  OH, if you check in on 4 square, there is a special, buy one glass of one, get one free, so that is an added plus :)   We will probably go back here again.  This is no Del Frisco's steak house but it is decent for the price.

O5-Pors2tTArXAdBhVvRKA.text: Just at there, fancy place, fancy prices, regular food...I have had better steaks at Black Angus. Was told the $50 rib eye was better than the $32 bison, we got both. The 14 ounce rib eye, was in 2 pieces,  and over cooked. If you say you have a 14 ounce you should serve a 14 ounce, not pueces....just saying....

Ph2d62ofpnGeziz9E_qIZQ.text: The atmosphere is phenomenal, a rat pack atmosphere. Perfect music, wonderful decor and seating. The menu is delicious! We ordered oysters, which were phenomenal, cioppino and the Maine scallops. We're both seafood fans and we haven't tasted better!! The whole experience was wonderful.

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters were fresh, plump and a pure taste of the sea.
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful cioppino
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops

Xlxxs76INaesgxlb0skI2A.text: Not a great place to eat, Vegas has better places to offer.  My girlfriend and I had booked a table for NYE 2013/2014 and we had been looking forward to eating in Luxor as that was where we were staying. Unfortunately Tender is almost as bad as the hotel.  We had entrees, and before we were finished eating them, steaks came in. They realized that we were not finished eating and quickly took them back to the kitchen, hoping we had not noticed. As a result, the steaks were pretty cold when they came in 10 minutes later.  I had ordered a medium rare steak and it was a lot more rare than medium rare. The bearnaise sauce lacked taste, they must have forgotten to add tarragon.  They also managed to try to take my plate two times, before I was finished eating. I thought it was well know that unless you put the cutlery in the "I'm finished eating here"-position, it means that they're not supposed to touch it. Not at Tender. We pretty much only tipped because it was New Year's Eve, as they were terrible at their job.

DxJ7GBh5KNpzZk8lqCSj4g.text: Beautiful restaurant .I had a steak , cooked perfectly for me , medium. The sides came family style, we had cream corn and truffled mashed potatoes ( the best).  A photographer goes around to the different tables and takes pictures  , can buy the photos if you choose to.

H5BVTtj2jGezLBaHFt_TGg.text: Visited on May 30, 2016  In my many, many years of restaurant dining, this is only the second occasion in which I have not given any tip whatsoever, this time for two reasons:  1. From the moment my wife and I entered this restaurant at the Luxor Hotel this evening, the service was disappointing. I won't list all the shortcomings but suffice it to say that it was very unsatisfactory. And in my discussion with the manager after the meal, she agreed with me.  2. Viewing their menu and prices, prior to selecting this restaurant, is difficult. The restaurant does not have its own website. The easiest way to access their menu is through the Luxor Hotel website. But when you do find it, no prices are listed for any of their menu items. Hmmmm, why not? (I later found that I could find their menu prices through a Google search but the prices listed there are already out of date.)  "Fine dining" offerings at the Luxor are limited to only Tender Steak & Seafood. Given the shortcomings we experienced, this might explain why, on a holiday evening, the restaurant was almost empty of diners.   For my next steak dinner in Las Vegas I'll take my beautiful wife to Ruth's Chris Steak House at Harrah's. Yes, the prices will be about the same but the restaurant is more straightforward about listing them, the food quality will probably be slightly better, and there is little doubt that their service will be far superior.

uWBfXMmR0Wlw21zCFqH-Rw.text: To cut to the chase, the truffled mashed potatoes were so amazing that I googled the recipe in the car on the way home. I'm soooo making it this week! The rest of the meal was OK (but not as exceptional as the mashed potatoes). The oysters were scrawny and on the dry side.  The arugula in the salad was not de-stemmed which made it nearly impossible to eat. ......but the mashed potatoes....dreamy.....

2G6FQ4qgDzONUFEVuxZ6eg.text: My wife, sister and I visited Tender two weeks ago.  We used the free redemption from the MyVegas game ($150).  The decor was very manly man sort of like a cigar/oak room, which was awesome.  The steaks came out perfect!  Since we had the free $150 voucher, I indulged and ordered the seafood platter, which came with lobster. (I then got a stink eye from my wife because we went over the voucher...but hey at least I ate some lobster!).   We would definitely go back when visiting Vegas again.  Order the Porterhouse and Ribeye!

VPDrpaZe0HAlxnVOeiETUw.text: I was thoroughly surprised and happy to find that this fine dining steakhouse that may have been posing as a fine dining steakhouse within the myriad of shit restaurants all around, was indeed, a proper fine dining steakhouse.  Loved it. The plush booths, the dim lighting, the interior overall set the perfect mood. Service was spot on with presentation, attitude and timing. Bear and I split a big ribeye and some sides, everything was as delicious as I wanted it to be. Boggles my mind that TENDER exists in the same casino as Rice & Company. I guess these are two great polar comparisons in terms of what served food should be like. After the initial shock that this met my (normal) expectations, I found no other surprises here-- in a good way.

ZOIsQNETIsAe1nXt9tcj5w.text: I have been here twice , and this place is really good! This time I ordered the filet and lobster bisque soup, both were delicious.

J6WPKEd9ejg9a7LF7bJ_3A.text: Service was terrible!  It took forever to get our drink order taken.  I will say it improved as time went on.  Food was ok. My tuna tartare was pretty good , salad was ok. Chocolate coconut souffle was delicious.

OgefNFoL3lBlk2NVTHHlqw.text: We visited Tender during CES in January. It wasn't our first choice, but we wanted to take a client out for steaks and we were able to get a reservation at the last minute. This should have been a sign that perhaps there was a reason this restaurant wasn't booked during the busiest week in Vegas. The reviews online were very mixed though so we crossed our fingers and hoped for the best. Unfortunately, what we experienced was far from excellent. Calling it mediocre would be being generous.  The absolute best thing about the meal was the mushroom soup that I ordered. I read many reviews saying to try the soup and it did not disappoint. In hindsight, I should have just ordered 2 bowls of the soup and nothing else. Everything else was a disappointment.  I ordered something on the "special menu" with daily features. It was a filet mignon (Omaha) that said was served with lobster tail. I was expecting a delicious filet and a lobster tail with drawn butter. For $95, that is what one would expect. Instead, I was served a mediocre filet and my lobster tail was cut up and mixed with rubbery shrimp. This tasted horrible. No drawn butter. The shrimp weren't even deveined. Yuck. Major disappointment.  Service was lacking. I wasn't even given a steak knife and had to use a butter knife. My fork was dirty and when they brought me a replacement, it too had dried food on it. Not sure how the server didn't notice this before he sat it down on my napkin.  Overall, Tender was a total disappointment. The soup was amazing. Everything else sucked. You might as well go to Logan's or Outback Steakhouse -- and even there you'd probably get better service.  Sorry, Tender. I won't be back.

XS9AmaxwRfF-36zs4X_Mrw.text: O M G. I think I died and went to Wagyu Beef heaven... Steak is amazing, service is awesome, food portions make it worth the price!! I'm coming back!!!

MMId33TcDIAj15ImtQK-mw.text: We decided to go out on a nice date with another couple and were disappointed in the place overall...Guess I was expecting something more classy.  Don't get me wrong the steaks were good but not WOW by any means.  We got sold on one of the specials which was a 37ounce steak which they suggested we could split...Well when it came it was about 10 ounces of steak and 27ounces of bone.  So bad that the bone was twice as long as the plate.  Not to mention that it was way more expensive...  Sorry guess Im not use to the old bait and switch at  a high end steak house...  Should have stuck with the regular menu.... Needless to say we left a little hungry and this should never happen at a SteakHouse...

hpFPXcmP2o0nS76qjk2hVg.text: Tender is hands down one of the best steak house's on the strip . The wife and i go ever time we're in town. The food is always exactly what you ordered and how you ordered it. The best lobster bisque in Vegas. The chief's are amazing and the staff are professionals.

Zk5HHt142-wdEn2jTqgvdA.text: After reading mixed reviews I was not sure what to expect, but what we got was great... and to us at an extremely reasonable price for a several course meal in a typically nice steak house atmosphere, with very good service and knowledgeable wait staff.    We started with a bottle of Casiller Del Diablo... a nice medium bodied Cabernet recommend by the manager as they were out of our first 2 choices, by the way which they were extremely apologetic about and offered several alternate suggestions at the same price range. Paired with the cheese tasting... 3 or 5 samples of artisan cheese with 6 baguettes, dates, jams, candied walnuts and a fresh honeycomb (would have made a nice dessert as well), it went very well. Our fav was the Purple Moon Cheddar soaked in wine and it was delicious. Other reviewers complained about the size of the cheese samples, but we thought they were the right size for a tasting. The bread basket was awesome with bread with feta and a pumpkin bread that were both wonderful and served with olive oil infused pesto.  We split a 24 ounce Porterhouse, which was seasoned and prepared perfectly with great flavor and had sides of braised brussel sprouts and fries with house made ketchup and mustard aoili, More then enough for two! We finished with a dessert for each and coffee and the bill came in at $150,

qjlBAW3C8wjaTQvKv9lBkA.text: im sorry zagat, but you got this one wrong!  Such a dissappointment. My husband and I stayed in vegas for a few days and decided to save this place for last. our flight left at 10, so we came here around 5 to enjoy what we thought would be a great meal.  they open at 5 for dinner. we were seated promptly. our server (cant remember his name but he was cool) greated us, asked for water service, and cocktails. i ordered one of the house drinks and my husband ordered beer. we started with a cheese plate, the tuna three ways (tar tar, seared and sushi roll) while the tuna was very fresh, it was bland. not alot of flavor. the cheese was good, cant go wrong with cutting cheese.  next course were salads. my husband ordered the ceasar and i had the wedge. the ceasar was very fishy, and my salad was boring. no flavor at all. extremely dissapointing.  Now for the entrees. i ordered the small ribeye, medium rare plus, and my husband ordered the strip medium rare. we ordered the red wine sauce and the ghost pepper sauce on the side and a side of the potato au gratin. my steak was cold, my husbands was over cooked and the potatoes were gross. they made my husband a new steak, but at that point he was so turned off he just wanted to leave.  the manager came over to see what was up, and had no idea there was even an issue. pathetic. maybe because i work in the service industry, I'm aware of how situations should be handled. but this place was just bad.   def better places to check out in vegas if your going to spend $300+ on dinner.

qEQtztMRRqAfIwHHVCxM9g.text: My wife and I stayed at the Luxor for an extended weekend getaway and were planning a steakhouse visit on our last night in Vegas.  I realize there are many great options for steak and thought we'd give Tender a try.  We were certainly not disappointed.  We had the Mediterranean Vegetarian Mezza for an appetizer and it was delightful.  She opted for the Wild Arugula and Watercress salad and I chose the Garden Bay Greens.  Both were fresh and tasty.  For dinner, I chose the 20 oz. bone-in Rib Eye and she had the Northwest Salmon.  We shared a dish of the Yukon Gold potato puree Both dishes were prepared perfectly.  My steak did not have the "char" some of the great Midwest steakhouses have, but the rib eye was generous and lived up to it's namesake, "tender"!  For desert, it was recommended by our wait staff to try the Banana Foster's Bread Pudding and, again, a home run!  There is not a more delicious and decadent way to get your daily requirement of potassium!   And speaking of the wait staff, from the hostess to the waiter to the server, everyone was attentive, friendly and accommodating.  They even have a house photographer who can take a picture at your table for your special evening, if you so desire.  We couldn't have asked for a better end to our Las Vegas getaway!

Mz2lr59SgCBO0TjUezr-0w.text: Best steak I have ever eaten period. 10 oz filet w/ there Yukon gold mashed potatoes.... so good!! This place is a great deal.

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meal of my life

GjeqmjSakzMStxUrZEtbSQ.text: I had the bison ribeye and it was the best steak I've ever had. It just melted in my mouth and had the best taste ever. Very attentive and quick service. A bit on the expensive side but the quality made up for it in my opinion.

oSAVUUzqmnweN05UJeuWuQ.text: OUTSTANDING!! My wife and I experienced an exceptional evening of fine food, wine and service as we celebrated our 33rd anniversary at Tender. Joe, Raul, and Thomas were very attentive and professional as they ensured we were well taken care of. Great job team!! The 3-cheese board, wedge salad, 10oz filet, baked potatoe, and carrots were enough for us to share. The filet was perfectly prepared and melted on the pallet. The staff comped us dessert for our special day. Overall, a memorable event. We'll be back!!

zKR9MhDpjlbNkY3Dz3l4pw.text: A group of us were in town for a conference last week and we decided to go for a nice steak dinner.  TENDER was close so we gave it a shot after reading the Yelp reviews.  After seeing multiple comments about the server named Dewey, we were surprised when he introduced himself as the server for the night!  We all had steaks and shared some sides.  Everything was delicious and Dewey did a great job taking care of us and ensuring we had a fun visit.

uoRa9J4JVU1EnTHWhhJU3g.text: Amazing!! This was my first trip to Vegas for my friend's bachelorette party and they took good care of us. The bride loved the experience and we had the friendliest and best service. Manuel was was our server and our hostess was Milli. Thank you both for an amazing time. Also the food was spectacular!

Q4YkbMkkmXR0bU8WHExRog.text: Made a reservation, suggest it because even if it doesn't seem like you have to - you do. All sorts of people come here, and it is alacarte think Ruth's Chris or Flemings. Delicious, and just like the name definitely tender! Talk about cooked to perfection too- no extra sauces needed seriously taste better than STK! Plenty of natural flavor, we had two Organic New Zealand Ribeye grass fed ! Had the Brussels sprouts suggest if you're a healthy buff- cooked in organic chicken broth. Yummy! Our waiters were all awesome and attentive , receptionists were friendly also- all around a nice intimate setting for a special occasion or a sensual moment.

frt49t1xXnbFaeM6ACBSvA.text: What a experience?   Front desk tells me no tables available have your dinner with your wife at bar.  Wow.  WhT a insult.  We waited. Got a table  .    The medium filet was dry sitting on plate .   It turned out over cooked.    With courage I ate.   No complains.  Waiter did not come till end to drop billl.   No pass from me.

q5UuYBa9TN2Arwnz8ylbWg.text: Beyond words. Superb service; Joe, Tong, and Raul made our night something to remember and enjoy. Mr. Savage added such a personal touch to the whole experience. We will make all effort to return here each time we visit the Luxor. Make sure to save room for the deserts and coffee to close out the experience!

Ls1jERV9O1eKfe9soLp-rQ.text: Okay, so, the service was A+, creme  brulee, and salted caramel chocolate chip ice cream were fabulous, but the rest of this review is very honest and not pleasant.  Will not be back, not worth what we paid.   They provided a bread basket of cold, sliced, sandwich type bread.  The steak tasted just like the porterhouse from Norms but cost almost 4 times as much. The steak burger was mediocre.  The chicken was just plain wrong, boiled, lacking flavor, with overcooked, mushy, soggy, basmati and what tasted like canned corn.  Way over priced even with their awesome customer service.

aWsivahApYEUEjUYh7PWvw.text: Tender steakhouse was a nice meal. It wasn't knock your socks off great. It nice. We had 75$ coupon and still spent about 140$ additionally. Bread was very good. We started with the soup trio. It can out warm but not hot like I enjoy soup. I doubled the lobster bisque and had a mushroom soup. All was good but not super memorable. I had a flat iron steak @32$ that was very gristly and had to be sent back. This angered me to no end because I'm literally sawing into this supposed tender piece of meat like I have a hacksaw cutting metal. Saw saw grind grind. Literally can't cut it. The waiter (big guy with trouble tucking his shirt into his pants reminded me a bit do Dan Connor from Rosanne but not funny) makes a snide comment about it being a knife and a steak and you have to cut it. Really? Seriously? I'm 52. I've cut a few steaks in my life. Jeeesh. I finally had to ask for a manager by the assistant to our waiter. Manager came over and was very apologetic and took it away. Finally waiter came by and said "looks like you got that one in a 100 bad ones huh?" By the time the new steak came out our lobster risotto was now cold and still had some undercooked rice. Just an annoying crunch here and there. My husband had a bone in ribeye which he enjoyed and a baked potato that was fine. We started with a salad that had bacon. I can't remember the. Are but was very good and we split it. For dessert we had a trio. This was probably the thing most disappointing. We had asked our waiter what was good. He said well you don't get chocolate souffle at many places. Ya ok but is it GOOD?  Not really. It went in like this and finally got trio. Usually on a trio you get smaller sizes but still generous. This was ridiculous. One bite snacks. The only thing we could get more than a bite of was cream brulee. The cheesecake was tasteless.   Our server was lackluster heavy set man who did not seem at attentive. His assistant was better. The ambience was very nice dark woods and comfortable tables that are a fair space between each other. Food 21/2 stars. Ambience 5. Service 2. Of this hadn't been a 200$ plus tip meal,  things could have been forgiven easier but at that price point with no alcohol, it should have been STELLAR.

GtoEulT3X5o5mMBYlZIU5g.text: Came here on Valentine's Day for a nice dinner. With the price of the food we expected an amazing dinner. We both ordered ribeyes and we both said they are the worst steaks we've ever had. It was tough, over cooked, and had absolutely no seasoning. Extremely disappointed in the price we had to pay for this meal, considering it was so bad. Kudos to our waiter and the service though, that was the only good thing!

cPhy1oDGeRNVoA-hDIwZdA.text: Absolutely horrible. Our waiter was amazing and did a great job. I'm a ribeye guy all the way and I've had a lot. This is absolutely the worst ribeye I've had in my life. No taste, way over cooked, tough and bland. Over priced and terrible steak. I would recommend the lobster bisque. It had flavor at least.

BZCVrJ72UZ0UzzbCLewodg.text: Poor looking plates. WAITERS AND FOOD ARE TERRIBLE. Waiter got offended when I asked if he spoke spanish when he clearly did. Super expensive plates that look like they were cheaply made. Get away  Waiters throw the plates at you and want to get you out as soon as possible to get their tips.   Waiter was manual and raul and the chinese dude. Bad bad bad just bad. Go screw some other tourists  I had to ask the waiter 4 times for bread and it was super cold when given as well  Manuel got offended that we asked for something in spanish and responded back in english and ignored us and never brought the plate. English is our 2nd language and not one of them offered to even help us out communicating

iuS2JBeyF5t53C8G0RdVVA.text: One has to wonder where people's head are at in their reviews.  I can only assume they cannot tell the difference between standard quality dishes and elite dishes.  I've eaten here many times and I tell everyone who visits Las Vegas that Tender is the 2nd best steakhouse in the city.  I understand people are skeptical because it is after all in the Luxor who have about the worse places to eat on MLife properties after Excalibur.  Do not let it being in the Luxor fool you.  I will start off with my waiter - the man, the myth, the DEWEY.    DEWEY knows the entire menu, wine list and can give you a history lesson on Tender menu history.  He is like Dean Martin in charge of the roast, he is in charge at all times and commands the floor of Tender like a Field Marshall in battle.  I've pretty much had everything on the menu which sadly has been cut in half within the past year (HINT TO MANAGER, bring back a few more dishes).  The best steakhouse in LV is Jean Georges at Aria.  Tender is better than Stripsteak, Gordon Ramsey, Prime, Gallaghers etc, all places I like and eat at regularly.  Salads at Tender are all quite good.  The sides are above average. They cook baked potatoes properly, their mushrooms are excellent, asparagus has a nice lemon twist to it and pretty much all sides are solid.  Steaks and game dishes are ELITE.  Tender has one of the best fillets in the USA.  The Center Cut is a touch better than the standard cut.  Their Porterhouse and Prime Rib are also 8 to 9 out of 10 in taste/quality. Strangely though their bone-in cowboy style Rib-Eye can be a slight miss once in awhile.  If you are eating there and want steak, start with the fillet and you will thank me.  Their desserts are all quite good.  Ambience is laid back, no high roller snobs here.   Manager here is also ace.  Cocktails are excellent to boot.  I will eat here again and again for a long time.

sZ22BsZ_YEHHOwcQzh-sJA.text: I recommended TENDER to friends who were recently visiting. They couldn't say enough great things about the food and staff at TENDER! Thank you for taking care of my friends!

tErbhrx5QlUGNZuUqjORWg.text: First time that I've been there. Was in the mood for a steak and boy did I have a steak. Shares the tomahawk steak with my bf and had the crab cake. We devoured the food. It was great. The service was amazing. Everyone so nice and attentive. Will defiantly return on our next trip to Vegas.

BEOcTrmI3BINoZ_Mt3uRYw.text: Review #500  "For those who believe, no proof is necessary.  For those who don't, no proof is possible".  Stuart Chase.  Personal Musings - What makes a restaurant great?  Cutting edge, imaginative food?  Michelin quality service?  Magical ambiance?  Dare I say, as a foodie, they all contribute, but Michelin stars, James Beard awards, even yelp stars mean jack $hit.  Great dining experiences are based on the company one chooses to share the meal.  Everything else just plays a supporting role.  To some, it's the neighborhood deli down the street or the okazuya of their childhood.  To me, simply the place that I have celebrated more evenings with friends, old and new, forged more new relationships in a new city than anywhere else...  170 visits.  Solid food.  Outstanding service (especially at the bar).  Comfortable ambiance.   When a rare problem arises, it's corrected with no fuss or excess intrusion.   Nothing get's in the way of a great time.  New management is currently updating the menu and the wine list.  Many old time favorites are gone, replaced by simpler dishes and seasonal specials.  For starters, the seasonal heirloom tomato plate (over a dozen different types of tomatoes dressed in EVOO, topped with pink Himalayan sea salt and micro basil) is a must.  Colorful and playful for the palate.  The contrast in sweetness and acidity between the different types of tomatoes is very pronounced.  The exotic mushroom soup is also outstanding.  Mushroomy flavor in a broth seemingly including bone marrow in consistency and flavor.   Fresh oysters and a classic shrimp cocktail round also make for good eats.  This is a steakhouse and the beef shines.  The A5 Kobe is the real deal.  Ask for the certificate if you don't believe it.  Offered in both a filet and boneless rib eye, absolutely delicious and the lowest price anywhere on the Strip.   Very tender, sweet, with a clean beef flavor.  Very buttery.  Order it simply seared (below rare) for the best experience.   A good selection of cuts from different producers including an outstanding bison rib eye.  All are perfectly seared, cooked to temperature, simply seasoned with salt and pepper.  Other standout mains include the always delicious wild game trio (venison osso bucco, elk medallions, and wild boar rack chop) and the full size, perfectly braised and sauced venison osso bucco.    Solid sides including a very fairly priced bone marrow ($6).  Great albeit huge desserts, try the souffles.  Very good selection of wines by the glass; massive pours.  Well chosen wine list with reasonable Vegas resort pricing.  Experiences ready for the making.  Bravo.

YhJl76XtMBNdKQJy9_C6Jg.text: Our dinner at Tender was amazing. Dewey was a fantastic waiter. He made the dinner absolutely fantastic. We ordered the steak Philadelphia style, and it was cooked perfectly. I would definitely recommend!!

V1Ljtb58OKQEXecgpieYwg.text: Stood at the Luxor for EDC2018.. friend and I wanted a nice dinner on our calm Thursday before the storm that is EDC.. unfortunately we showed up late for our reservation but the service was great and not rushed! Hostess, server and the ambiance was everything we hoped for considering its a Vegas casino restaurant (sometimes known for quick and sloppy service because of the fast paced environment).  10/10 recommend the tomahawk for 2 rare! Mashed potatoes, asparagus and the mouth watering Mac n cheese!

-2LOomjNbsmvn29zOGWBOA.text: Me and my Husband were in Vegas celebrating our 2 year anniversary.  We were staying at the Luxor and decided to have a nice dinner and chose Tender since we walked right by it each time we went to our room.  We made reservations and were seated after about 10 minutes, we waited in the lounge area and met a nice older couple visiting from London.   Our server Chuck was fantastic! We started off with 1/2 oz Caviar ($35) - first time trying it for both of us, and it was rather tasty! My husband ordered the Beef Angust Flat Iron Steak($25) with a slow roasted russet potatoe($7) - i didn't sample anything of what he ate, but he couldn't say enough good things about his meal. I ordered the Omaha Beef Filet Mignon ($40) --and OMG!! was it to die for...it melted in my mouth, and i'm still having dreams about it.   All in all though I rated 5 stars, don't think i'd revisit simply because there are about 500 other restaurants i've yet to try in Las Vegas!

FtiY9dgy4aa9ffnff3zq9w.text: This past weekend was my inaugural trip to Vegas, and wouldn't have been complete without completely extravagant meals.  Tender was no exception.  On Saturday we walked the strip all day, completely forgetting that it was Saturday and we should probably make reservations for dinner at some point.  We got back to the room around 7, and the BF called the concierge (we were staying at Mandalay Bay) to look for reservations within the hour, since we were starving.  After trying several options, Tender had the earliest opening.  We were seated right away, in a round lovey-dovey booth, and ordered a bottle of Ruffino Chianti, one of my favorites.  For appetizers, we enjoyed half a dozen Virginia oysters and carpaccio.  Entrees were the hanging tender and bone-in ribeye, both medium rare, which we shared, and a side of the sweet potato puree, which we also shared.  Both steaks were delicious and perfectly cooked, it worked out well that I liked the ribeye better and he enjoyed the hanging tender better.  Either that, or he was just trying to make me happy.  I was.  The only thing that makes me sad is I didn't get around to eating my leftovers.  Service, decor, and food, all outstanding.  Tender is not one of the places I had heard of or remember seeing in my research before heading for Vegas, but definitely a hidden gem to check out!

TaslpCq6h7LbJ-ckb1ZDkg.text: We received a comp for Tender so we tried it last night. Apparently, we had two waiters but you wouldn't have ever known because the service was painfully slow. They weren't busy so there really wasn't any excuse for the inattentive service. Also, the two waiters didn't seem to be communicating so after one offered us dessert and we declined, the other came by 10 minutes later to offer the dessert menu. The biggest issue with this place is that it's not cheap yet it has the crowd of an Outback. If I'm paying $200+ for dinner and wine, I'd also appreciate they at least TRY to enforce a dress code. It definitely drags down the ambiance to watch the people who brought their 5 year old and allow him to run around the tables, seeing men in shorts and baseball hats, and women in clothes that look like they're typically used for yard work in the same restaurant. I dressed business casual and felt severely over-dressed.  Even the waiters though (who wear shirts and ties) have their shirts unbuttoned and their ties are sloppy.  The food was good however. I had the wild game and my boyfriend had the filet. The food was good... not great. Comps or not, I wouldn't ever return and I would not recommend it. If you do go, just know that you can wear sweatpants.  ;)

FM026kDEJi62D7QkN1lxyg.text: 1 star for the phenomenal service. 1 star for the wonderful atmosphere. 1 star for the excellent appetizers. Minus 1 star because it was so darn hot in the restaurant, it made me sick. Minus 1 star because the main course was just meh.  Leaving a total of...3 stars. Good thing I can do math.  I was roped into making a reservation here after the Criss Angel show when speaking with a hotel rep on the phone. She claimed it was only $30 per person per entree. What a lie.   I like how they have two servers who wait on you to maximize the quality of service. That was really impressive. We never had a lull in service the entire time we were there.  We started out with a complimentary amuse-bouche of kobe beef in sour cream and chives. Delicious. I was really excited about the rest of the food after that.  I ordered the pumpkin and fuji apple soup which was wonderful and the Scottish Salmon with pilaf and roasted red peppers. The portions here are pretty small...so I was comfortably full afterwards and not stuffed beyond belief. The pumpkin and fuji apple soup came with some kind of pumpkin spice bread and apple butter. The butter was incredible...it was sweet and dissolved in your mouth.   I was less impressed with the salmon. Granted, it's not salmon season and I should have thought about that...but I thought that because it was Scottish, maybe it would be better. It was just mediocre. Nothing I would ever order again.  The problem with this restaurant is that it was EXTREMELY hot. As in EXTREMELY hot. I was SO overheated that I couldn't enjoy my meal and almost had to leave. By dessert time, I ran out of there and hopped into the bar Minus 5 to cool off.   I would come back here, but I'd order steak, as it is a steakhouse. The bf ordered an awesome looking steak which was very tender and delicious. I'd definitely do that. But just be forewarned that after 2 appetizers and 2 entrees (on the lower side of pricing) it still came out to over $130. Bummer.

cxoJhsGsB3CvD_kY0MbNkg.text: Okay steak. Fabulous lobster bisque. Awful air freshener. Luxor masks smokers by pumping tank full's of air freshener. (The other guests at my table deleted the rest of my review as it became too intense).

ywP4tSog434EimHie5pISQ.text: Worst service EVER. I would have slapped the manager in the face but you couldn't find her . Wine list is great but ask for it...it's not in stock ( 3times). Food was room temperature when I complained the blonde human calling herself a manager never even came to the table but wait....half priced the steaks JESUS our show better be good because if we weren't trying to make the theater I would have thrown the 8 ounces of 9 ounce filet on my plate at her useless self. Watch your ticket times - your the manager - act like one

P6N9aCKMIUsL6UF7U0vN8Q.text: My waygu style ribeye was full of fat and gristle. Disgusting. Didn't even finish it. Go to Ruth's Chris instead were you get what you pay for.

5JzLjx1glBSLmss4W2QdSA.text: This place was amazing.. the steak was wonderful, I ordered black Angus Omaha steak. what i loved about the menu that it tells you where the beef came from.  I ordered my steak medium raw and it was really medium raw.  it was tender and juice.  We also had mac and cheese and it was creamy, asparagus where cooked just right. We had a pitcher of sangria, I'm not a Sangria fan but i enjoyed it because it wasn't that sweet.  the over all flavors were just enough simple and just one flavor at a time.

POXgUf0pCgHxuKzism8pjg.text: We try to dine here every time we are in Vegas. We are in Vegas 4 times a  year and are often recognized by our servers. The staff is wonderful! On our most recent visit we had the pleasure of being served by Emilio and Thom. They were so helpful and funny. We were using a couple of coupons and they helped us reach the required minimum amount by suggesting dishes for us to try. The treated us like royalty, which doesn't always happen when you are using a coupon! The food, as always, was perfect. The four of us had the filet, sea bass, halibut and wild game tasting menu. All were fantastic! The side dishes and desserts were also wonderful. Their staff make the experience so much fun and well worth every penny. The General Manager, James stopped by our table to make sure that our experience and the food was perfect. Can't wait to return on our next visit to Vegas.

etXQ-q4spyceHKojsfAnFA.text: The food was very good however service left something to be desired.  It was our 36th anniversary and my birthday.  They didn't seem to care when we told them.  There were also two boys around 12 years old when we first walked in that were right in front of our table and were talking loud, looked like grandpa had them out.  At another table there were 3 small child but very well behaved. This was at 10 at night. We won't go back for the price expected to be treated a little better then we were. We spent about $150.

QTYs_OI_VFE7GJvW9d8dhw.text: Tender gets 1 star only because I cant leave 0 stars. I ordered a med rare ribeye and I got a chunk of shoe leather that was burnt to hell. I sent it back while my wifes food and the sides got cold. The manager came by to let me know she adjusted the price of my steak. Thanks for the 15 bucks! She did not come by after they brought me my new steak. I could only get 3 bites off of the edge of the new steak because the rest of it was raw. There were spots where the fat was still hard. I was too mad to even approach the managment that night. Go put your $180 in dollar slot machine instead.

yJ2SChvCffb-afK1_3Ra0A.text: We came when they were just opening. The service was extremely slow. Apparently there were two people that was helping our table, but only one ever showed up. We orders the Prix Fixe. I didn't like the mushroom soup at all. The steak at first was okay, but the after taste made me want to vomit. The service was so slow that we ended up leaving before we could get the dessert since we had a show to watch. We had come 2.5 hours early to eat before the show, but the service was so slow we just had to leave. Never again. I do not recommend.

Jr-gISKhLuD1BTnb3PCtrA.text: We came here for the daily Cheese and Wine Tasting.   The service and atmosphere were excellent. Top notch.   However, the wine we tasted wasn't good. The bottles had been open a few days prior. The cheese was good,  it portions were tiny. Each portion was about the size of two half-dollars.  Not a great value.

O8X6pQpELunVlPmwsQxuzA.text: This is one of the better steaks I've eaten. I ordered the filet mignon, and the meat was so tender that the name is really appropriate. Also a plus that you can mix what kind of sauce and vegetables you want yourself. The downside was the price on the restaurant which was kinda expensive. Also we had to wait some time to get our food, but this was accepted since we were a party of 17!

pjoTE-Bf8v9KFEK5ocX3SQ.text: The steak here is awful for a steakhouse. Granted I came here because it was part of a package we got and it was a prix fixe for five-top but it was still awful. For a place called "Tender", their medium filet mignon was anything but tender.  I felt like was eating rubber. The salad was nothing special and the dessert flourless chocolate cake was not good at all.

Wy2Ssp4kug7sNpXYdVeYNg.text: I would avoid this one for food, service, and price.  We came here for their Thanksgiving prix fixe since we were in town that day. The experience started with a 10-minute wait to be seated in a mostly-empty restaurant (despite having a reservation), and then another 20 minutes before anyone even came by and asked about drinks. Then another 20 minutes before anyone brought the drinks and bread. About an hour after we arrived on time for our reservation, we finally ordered our food. The rest of the evening went comparably.  Nothing that we had was passable for a restaurant at this price point. The escargot appetizer was completely chewy. The soup was bland, literally a broth with some apple flakes. The white meat was dry and the dark meat was full of veins and cartilage. Etc etc. I understand that this is primarily a steak house, but I would a expect a restaurant charging these kinds of prices to be at least somewhat competent with a range of basic cooking techniques.  The only positive thing I can say about the place is that the drinks were decent, but they weren't spectacular. I was frankly expecting more for $15.

3WyTF_LB3iw5grbcABHeGQ.text: We visit Tender Steak every time we are in Vegas; typically twice a year.  It's usually our anniversary in May or my birthday in October.  Food is excellent.  Never had a bad meal or bad experience.  Our favorite waiters are Manuel and John just to name a couple.  Always very helpful and knowledgeable.  John knows his wine and how to pair it.  He helped us pick out cheeses for the cheese plate we ordered!  When they found out we were celebrating our anniversary, dessert was on the house!  Staff very attentive.  It's our go to romantic, fine dining place!

Mj11LMWtmgNECzl1dD2NEA.text: The reason why I'm updating this review is because I just came across our receipt !! I ordered 2 Green tea's (cocktails) @ 9$ each, fine. BUT they charged us $3 x's 2 for premium when I did not call a premium LIQ...WTF. PLUS when I made reservation they ask " is this a special occasion?"  "Yes, Its my Hubby's B-day"  ........ So like normal  at the end of our dinner  Gary  kindly brought over a delicious slice of chocolate cake. Very nice BUT they charged us $8 for the cake. WTF I did not order this so why was I CHARGED! For real!! NEVER AGAIN!

fE1Ermr0Ue02iccvQOtTrA.text: This place has gone downhill in the past year. Went to Tender last night for Mother's Day. They forgot to make their wine order so the bottle of wine I wanted, they didn't have. Fine. Ordered the cheese board ($35). Had 6 slices of cheese. 7 pieces of sliced meats (venison, smoked something and rabbit??) Awful. We used to come to this restaurant just for the board, now we will never return because of it. Ordered shrimp cocktail ($20) 4 shrimp...smh. Finally we ordered three side dishes. Creamed spinach (Mom said it had soured), Augratin potatoes (they we served in a skillet, guy says careful they are hot...they were warm at best. The dollop of sour cream they placed on top stayed the entire time. If sour cream isn't melting, something isn't remotely hot.) and finally the mushrooms. Out of everything we ordered the side dish of mushrooms was the best part. The service sucked royally. They didn't ask us once how we were doing.  I don't usually write about bad experiences, but I figured with Las Vegas being a vast place with 1000s of places to eat. Be warned about dining here. *Manager took off the side dishes, but by that point the entire experience was already ruined. He made no effort to make it right. We asked for the check with the table full of food and left. Tisk tisk.

MhnsGKdJaEob2gx0vNB69w.text: Just okay. Service was friendly, but stacked and rushed. After we asked for a leisurely evening, dinner came out while appetizers were still on table. I expect that from TGI Fridays, or some other such $$-$$$ restaurant, I definitely don't expect it from a $$$$ restaurant.   Food was tasty, as expected, but not amazing or above expectations.  Decor was classy - traditional dark grain leather steak house look.   Music was totally not fitting - soft pop and top 40. Which I might like at the lounge but seemed weird and out of place here.

0vBO7kqHPZ113eSxWZsc5g.text: We've been here before and the food has always been pretty good. This time  - not so much. We started with the soup trio and the foie gras. The soup was fine but the foie gras still had bits of membrane attached. It was also unevenly cooked to the point of being cold in places.   For mains my daughter had the game tasting and I ordered a medium rare filet. For sides she ordered the mushrooms and I ordered Brussels sprouts for us to share. And so the problems really began.   Each table has a team of 3 servers. Our main server, Joe, was great. The rest of his team was seriously lacking. To start with, no one cleared the plates from our appetizers. When the gentleman arrived with our mains he actually left them cooling on the stand and made us wait while he cleared plates. Might have been smarter to move the plates, give us our mainz and sides and then take the other plates as he left.  But that's not the worst of it. As he set our sides on the table I noted to my daughter the discrepancy between the menu description of roasted Brussels sprouts and the braised/stewed ones we were being served. The server became quite rude and condescending , literally telling me that I was wrong. He said they were roasted and it was only the addition of sauce that made it appear otherwise. I was appalled at the way he spoke to us.   Once he left and we started in on the meal I discovered that my filet was rare instead of medium rare. Not a huge issue as they were quick to bring another that was properly done.  Would I eat here again? Possibly. In multiple visits this is the only time we've had less than stellar service. It's also the first time they've undercooked a filet for me. Having read lots of reviews noting undercooked steaks as an issue, next time I'll order it a little more done.

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Game tasting
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushrooms and Brussels sprouts
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Undercooked filet

SXCu6Tj_YTFLp1GLwcu2tA.text: I was thoroughly disappointed in the food and service. I ordered the bison 10 oz and it came out overcooked and tasted like cardboard. My wife ordered the Chilean Sea Bass and it had no flavor whatsoever. The servers seemed to ignore our table since we were in the corner booth. It was an overall terrible experience. I would never go back!  SW, STK and others are a much better option!

fVBxbXbrQgwHUY6j_HlReg.text: Great food. Came here for thanksgiving. My kids enjoyed the thanksgiving meal. My husband and I got the filets. Amazing. Staff was nice and professional.

89BFCJp_3IwtexgjQTf9pQ.text: Was thinking seafood and steak until I checked out the prices on the menu then realized I was thinking appetizer.   The server was very short with me because we used a hotel coupon.   One of the few reasonable things was the lobster risotto which was only twenty bucks. But probably worth about half that. It wasn't what I expected from Its description was thinking it would be filled with lobster. It was ok though for what it was. basically cheesy rice with barely any lobster in it, just a few lobster pieces. Really more like lobster flavoring.   The drinks here were more expensive than the bar just a few feet across the casino so I say buy them there. The menu did sound delicious so if you win big I say check it out. If not then just keep walking by.

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Mac and cheese
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster risotto

HWEfV3JMjDBJhbN9Y4Ki8A.text: Tender is amazing! The service was incredible! Our waiters, Joe and Dewey, were so personable, knowledgeable, and helpful! We went to Vegas to celebrate our anniversary and they even comped our dessert! The steaks were perfect, I got a filet and my husband a ribeye. We also got potatoes au gratin, they were delicious! So far, this was our favorite restaurant in Vegas.

J-uAOOfCrlwz62MlMXL85A.text: Very nice place. Great atmosphere, trendy but pricy. Inside the Luxor by the entrance to Mandalay Bay. We had strip steaks, mushrooms, wedge salad and au gratin potatoes. All very good, with great service. Would highly recommend this place for a nice night out. Dress well and take your time to relax.

oocEWh5jV03e7fUjEvygVw.text: Beyond impressed with the quality of ingredients and preparation here. They don't drown every dish in salt and fat to make it appeal to base senses. The subtle flavors of the food itself is allowed to take center stage. The service was lackluster. I would even eat here without a comp which can't be said for many places in Vegas.

IkG_tiejHSIATiYsGtQTWg.text: I won't be suggesting Tender to anyone anymore. I use to but between the horrible scent that Luxor sprays in their place and the C rated food, even having a $75 off of $150 did not help.   There was nothing shining about my meal. I started with foie gras. It was so thin, and chewy, way overcooked!! I should have sent it back!   The $75 steak tasting was awful. Fatty pieces of meat (not in a good way, I love Ribeye fat but I swear they cut off the fatty parts they could not sell as a full steak and put this on this taster) and I ordered it medium-rare, as suggested by the waiter (I usually get rare). This steak was so rare, it was not good. I can't believe a steak house could not get med-rare. I felt like walking back and giving them a lecture about the doneness of meat and how to tell by touch. I can cook and serve four people four different doneness of steak, so I don't know why Tender could not get these three fatty, full of gristle, cooked to medium-rare is beyond my understanding.   Why not one star? We have very good service and tipped accordingly.

Yoql7n1f_gueSc2iGIWSIw.text: Amazing. Bread with pesto dipping sauce was yummy. Cesar salad was great and the filet mignon was amazing. The creme brulee was the best I ever had and the staff were extremely nice and attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best creme brûlée ever!
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet mignon and roasted bone marrow

9lStlLJ7M_2cuBC69fnIog.text: Thomas and crew were amazing.  I ordered the waygu flat iron and to be honest ( I've been to selanne's steak house in Orange County, outback, ruth chris and even gallaghers in New York New York) and this was the best steak and service I've ever had.  My drink never made it past half empty, I took recommendations that blew my mind.  For the price you absolutely cannot beat the service and quality of food, if you're in this corner of the strip you NEED to come here where  you will not be disappointed.

kgLTcILiLrtQ3J2TveHnVA.text: Came for dinner before the Jabbawockee Show! SO good.. they were pretty busy for the dinner rush so we sat at the lounge. Chairs were very comfortable and the tables were a decent size, especially with how much food we ordered lol Steak Salad came with a FULL SIZED steak!!!
