So, canceled reservations at Nobu (1st mistake) so we could hit the show which wouldn't let out until about 10:30pm and left us with dining at the hotel if we still wanted something decent for our buddy's night...steaks sounded like a no-brainer (2nd mistake).  As expected, the show let out late and we had to book it to make it down to Tender where it seemed like we were one of the last tables to be sat.  Did I mention we were a group of 8 guys celebrating a bachelor party??  Oh, because I did when I made the reservation yet we were still sat at a round table that should have sat 6 girls, at most, at an organic salad bar.  I digress...  It's cool, we're gonna have some amazing service and delicious steaks...oh no you're not!  Our main server came out and did his thing where he tries to confuse you into buying the expensive water by giving  regular water a tricky name.  He then introduced us to some of the other grommets that would be helping him out.  Keep in mind that we had been drinking all day at the tables but had definitely sobered up at this point thanks to Carrot Top...so if you're picturing a boisterous crew, we were not they...yet.  A few of us ordered a beer because we knew that wine would be the night killer after a large meal.  After that, things went downhill as we barely ever saw the service again.  Beside the fact that we were seated so close together that we looked like we were in a rugby scrum, there was no sign of a bread basket or anyone to even request one from.  So, that left the few of us that didn't order apps and/or salads longingly watching the other dudes once those were delivered.    Once steaks were delivered, I was near boiling point but so hungry I didn't have the energy to complain.  Everyone at the table ordered a different cut of meat for the most part and I had the boneless strip...major potential.  HURT-ING.  Strip had no flavor whatsoever and I had to steal some of my buddy's horseradish just to put it down.  The sides we ordered (au gratin potatoes, mashed potatoes, asparagus, and mac n cheese), which we were told would be more than enough, were more like the sample you get at Costco by the time they hit all 8 of us around the table.  Did I mention we were sitting at the same table that little kids get stuck at on Thanksgiving??  Bottom line was that the whole experience was horrible, service was weak, food was lacking, and we felt very rushed to get out of there since we were one of the last tables.  Whole tab was a bit over $600 and I didn't even stay long enough to see it come out.  Couple of guys stayed back, one of which is a very successful restaurateur, to complain to the manager and he acted like he could care less (3rd and final mistake, but not ours).  Called the hotel that next morning and complained about the abysmal experience at Tender and they asked us how they could make it right.  The answer from 8 guys???  BUFFET.  That was the best service, ambiance, and elbow room the whole weekend and the prime rib was exquisite...muah!    Don't waste your money at Tender folks.  I've already read a few reviews that sounded identical to our experience.  Criss Angel needs to make this place disappear.  BELIEVE that!

iNgyNWPs03E0euR2e0UzDg.text: The food here is very good.  The bread starter was very good with pesto oil.  I got the veal osso buco which was cooked excellently with polenta.  The sides here are awesome too.  The spinach and potato au gratin are so rich and delicious.  Also, the wait service is attentive and accommodating.

37ayP9hWryBYE9nl_fj5-A.text: We ate here twice in the night.  First (preshow) in the bar for bloody mary's and oysters, then (after show) for our dinner.  Both were very good but costly.  My New Zealand ribeye was one of the better cuts of beef I ever had.  Very good service classy but not stuffy and they treated us like we mattered.

457R-7cEyRuLzw3CsVPhLw.text: We were running late for the Criss Angel Show in the Luxor and ended up having dinner here b/c of it's location.  Not having had time to read any reviews, I was skeptical and at first suggested we order only apps.  But the gentleman at the Luxor front desk was so convincing in his recommendation, and the staff was so nice when we walked in, that we decided to go for it.  We were pleasantly surprised!    We sat at the bar and ordered the bartender's recommendation:  13oz Bison steak and a wild game sampler (with antelope, wild boar and venison).  The day's special had a side of mushroom risotto that the bartender informed us was also available ala carte.  All were incredible!  Service was great... not impeccable... but great!  Again, super friendly, responsive and attentive.  We got out of there with two delicious meals, a half bottle of Chateauneuf-du-pape, and two shots of espresso for under $200.  Perfect in our book!  Side note:  Stop at Tenders. Do not proceed to Criss Angel.

nZ5WCz2gbQUJHBgMm88agQ.text: Eat here all the time! The steaks are awesome, the sides are very good also. The mushroom soup is so good that once when I went with a friend and my girlfriend had me bring some home on ice so she could have it, THAT good! The drinks are exact as ordered and the bartenders are very good! Will keep going every time we are in Luxor!

GYdItgKZphvWUvjJZJknhg.text: I would have to say TENDER is one of the best steakhouses in Vegas. They've an awesome selection of Kobe beefs from the US, Japan, NZ and AU. We've been to TENDER 4x in the past two years. The wine selection is also great. We usually start out with a Willamette Valley Pinot then to a Sonoma Cab, and end the evening with a Port. If you don't like steak, their lobster is a good alternative. Give them a try!

flWxWWmN47_JWUuM540LeQ.text: The food and service here are always amazing.  Like others. I used the $75 reward from myVegas and there was no hassle. Both of us had the 8oz filet and they were cooked to perfection.  Definitely would go back again a fb highly recommend it.

MGr3Ro1581bj4eT6heLSYw.text: This is a very nice upscale steak house in the Luxor Hotel & Casino.  My coworkers and I had dinner there and it was quite excellent.  Service was great and the food was delicious.  I would eat there again in a heartbeat.

h90IAsVWgjKJdXjVmcHV6g.text: Went in here for a steak.  Got the New Zealand rib-eye rare.  The cook that day didn't get it to the proper temp, so it was mostly steak tartare slightly grilled.  Bleh.  We were in a hurry, so I ate what I could.   Mashed potatoes were very good.  Service was fine.  There are other fantastic steak joints in town.  If you have the time, I would check thoe out first.

atr6oF1G2vvltZUp3IuyYA.text: Let me start by saying the food was WONDERFUL, I absolutely LOVED my salad and steak. However, we had 2 waiters and neither of them was anywhere to be seen for up to 10-15 minutes at a time throughout the meal. They were not particularly busy as over half of the restaurant was completely empty. When we were ready for our check we waited 10-15 minutes for it. I would give this place another chance as long as I got a different pair of servers.

kziMom-PQYGTqPBA0i9VpA.text: Great steakhouse. I think it's the best value in Vegas for a steakhouse. Traditional steakhouse feel with big leather booths and lots of wood. Steaks and seafood with nice soups and salads. Our waiters Juan and Manuel, who have served us often, are a great fun team.

--jF3dgAWXqbzuhwMhWmmg.text: The salmon & spinach entree was pretty tasty. I tasted a bit of the lamb shank &  that was also pretty good. Nice spot for a romantic, fancy,pricey dinner if you're staying on the strip specifically at  the luxor.

uvfVvisDHwKtfkLUAI4jzg.text: First time I went I had the ribeye, second time porterhouse. Both were amazing and paired with excellent wine selected by my server. Definetly worth checking out if you're at the Luxor.

DbsVm-qbGonKRHOT0T7nBA.text: Atmosphere: romantic, dark setting, quiet, candles on tables. We were seated at this nice booth.  Food: pizza pan dish- this was actually good for 2 people and filling. Very flavorful and cheesy with a lil bit of bread. 2 orders of the meatloaf stroganoff dish- meat was tender, but not a fan of meat. The mushrooms and pasta were soft too. creamed spinach- a lil too salty and creamy. spinach was nice and soft. shrimp appetizer- didn't try  Service: friendly, attentive, fast, refilled water right away  Bill was $110 for 4 people. Price wasn't bad.

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. creamed spinach
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. meatloaf stroganoff
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. pan pizza and shrimp appetizer

ruQ42mzx-gBxMY-e7Jgdsg.text: The only reason I am giving this restaurant two stars is because the food is good.  Otherwise, I am repulsed by how bad the service is.  In such an upscale restaurant,  I expect more from the wait staff.  We waited for approximately 10 minutes before bread (4 slices) was brought to our table.  When we asked for more, we didn't get it until after our food arrived.  Once the food arrived, we cut into the steak and the waiter asked if we needed anything else. We never saw him again until 15 minutes after we were done eating.  We had dirty dishes on the table until we got our check, and the pen that they wanted me to sign the check with was covered in oil that was given to the table to dip the bread in....  HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE!

yLpEJhNhN7p-CgGyn5ZECQ.text: Sadly, the worst meal I had on vacation was at Tender.  It was shockingly bad.  I had the scallops.  This is how it was described on the menu: seared diver-caught day-boat jumbo scallops, roasted corn quinoa & lobster, blue crab salad.  That is definitely not what I was served.  I received scallops on a bed of PLAIN quinoa that was the dryest, most tasteless quinoa I've ever had.  It was topped with the most tasteless guacamole that seemed to be prepared with edamame.  It was topped with very thin, overcooked, hard bacon bits that tasted like pieces of wood.  It also had some edamame tossed on top of it.  There was no crab salad, no lobster and no corn.  It was terrible.  The service was mediocre and the restaurant was expensive.  It was probably the biggest dining disappointment I've had in 5 years.  Truly sad that my fast food burger from In-N-Out was better than the meal I had here.

tXvgG6ru8PvIpIDK6ngbvw.text: Service was ok.  Don't know what it was.   Food wasn't that good.  Everything seemed prepared ahead.  The wagyu beef was stuck to the plate like it was in the fridge for a while.  Soups were salty.  Actually everything was a bit on the salty side.  Some of the meats were overlooked.  Tuna tartare was actually tuna sashimi.  I don't mind spending a chunk of money but I do expect something good.  Presentation was really good so it fooled you.

fhZ7iOOIy4wYLJ9gt3qqUw.text: We came here for our 5 year anniversary.  I also got a $75 MyVegas credit, so it made it even better.  I got the 12oz Omaha Filet Mignon, which was perfectly cooked and tasted amazing.  My husband got the 2.25 pound lobster and we both thought it was the best lobster we have ever tasted.  We also shared a side of Au Gratin potatoes with cheddar.  I'm not usually a fan of these types of potatoes, but these were not too rich, it was delicious.  Everything from the service to the food was superb.  Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Asparagus and Potatoes Au Gratin
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2.25 pound lobster
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 12 oz Omaha Filet Mignon

jXx7Td0SfPRSL0WXkGW1vA.text: My boyfriend and I were in Las Vegas and we were staying the the Luxor Hotel. We were trying to think of a nice place to have dinner and were walking around our hotel before going up and getting dressed for a night out. We came across TENDER Steak & Seafood and figured, it's right in our hotel and the selection looked good. We went up to the room, changed our clothes, and came back down for dinner.  We started with the Trio of Soup which included tastings of the Lobster Bisque, Kobe Beef Chili, and Mushroom Soup. I ordered the Kobe Beef and Foie Gras Stroganoff and my boyfriend ordered the Bone-in Rib Eye with Mushrooms sauce. When the soups came out, OMG... these soups were amazing!! If we knew how good this was, we would've ordered two and stuck with one entree to share. My entree had a slice of kobe beef and foie gras meatloaf with slices of black truffles baked inside over pasta in a creamy stroganoff sauce with roasted whole vidallia onions. So rich and savory. My boyfriend's rib-eye was huge. The mushroom sauce that came with it was absolutely delicious. We also ordered a side of Onions Rings to have with our meal, which was nothing too special. Heavily battered and a little soggy. =(  At the end of our meal, we ordered Creme Brulee for dessert. So yummy. Creamy custard, burnt sugar, caramelized bananas, and a shortbread cookie. It was so good that we almost ordered another one, but we were so full.  Ambience is dimly lit, but nice and quiet. Service was attentive. There was a photographer there that took people's pictures. Not sure what that was about, but my boyfriend ended up buying a set which costed us $80 on top of our bill. Two picture books of two 8 x 5 photos inside. They were nice, but I don't think it should've cost what we paid for. I guess that's what you should expect in Las Vegas. Never again...

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme Brulee with Caramelized Bananas
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone-in Ribeye with Mushroom Sauce
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kobe Beef and Foie Gras Meatloaf Stroganoff

PKd6x_miJpjdKpoc4sTzmQ.text: In Vegas as a general rule I try to eat at the steakhouse located in the place I am staying in. I love a good steak dinner so this is not a hard one to follow. So with that being said I found myself here at Tender and here is my experience.   Service: I thought the service was good. My water was constantly refilled and my food was given to me promptly. I always had what I needed and when I asked for steak sauce they brought it to me quickly. Even though I was a party of one I still got treated well which has not always happened in fancier places like this.   Ambiance: The restaurant was dark and quiet and it was exactly what I like. I sat in a big booth and it was comfortable. I was nice to have a quiet dinner in peace.   Food: Ok now for the part that matter most right, the food. I ordered the 8 oz Black Angus Omaha Beef Filet Mignon and the Lobster Bisque. I like mine on the rare side. I noticed when I go to a steakhouse that specializes in steak I can order it medium rare and have it be the way I like it. Anywhere else I have to go rare. Here I ordered mine medium rare and it was perfect. The steak was melt in your mouth tender. I enjoyed eery bite. The Lobster Bisque was amazing too. It was hot and creamy and had plenty of lobster in it. I really enjoyed my dinner alot. I ordered steak and soup only for dinner so I could save room for a little dessert. For dessert I ordered a scoop of the blueberry patch icecream. They had a great dessert menu so believe me it was hard to choose. The icecream was great. A generous scoop of icecream with plenty of blueberries in it. The one thing about the food that I did not like was the bread. It was cold and hard and the olive oil and pesto they gave you to dip it in left something to be desired as well. That was the only bad thing.   Overall I really enjoyed the food and service here and next time I am at Luxor I will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blueberry patch icecream. Scoop looks small in pic but there&#39;s a lot more icecream there than it looks!
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster bisque soup. Soooo good!!!!
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 8 oz Black Angus Omaha Beef filet

Sms-fh9mqc22WH62z6sE3Q.text: I was disappointed here. There is SO much great food in Vegas that this place just didn't make the mark. I went cause my hotel gave me some dinner credit here, and I was craving scallops so I ordered scallops with quinoa along with a side of asparagus..The asparagus came out dry with too much blackened charring on the outside, to the point where they were wilting.  The scallops came out a bit cold, but I was too tired and hungry to ask them to be reheated.   It wasn't bad here, but I would say, seek out memorable meals that will knock your socks off.

XRosjZ5ICffyK4v1grOgmA.text: Here for our anniversary dinner...beautiful ambience perfect for celebrating 23 years of togetherness. Wait staff attentive,  food was delicious! Having the 14 Oz ribeye and hubby having seafood platter sampler. Mushroom soup was delicious!  Sides of asparagus and lobster risotto...we deserve it!

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

f8sG4VLl3P4wm4dN0zMBwQ.text: The best meal I've ever had. Medium rare 8pz Kobe steak, side of bone marrow and a side of lavender heirloom carrots.  The service was sort of weird though, a team of servers... I believe the busboys may have been working more efficiently than the servers. But all in all, superb meal.

8cuxvVIREykoO4xuS3eQZA.text: Celebrating my friends first wedding Anniversary ... Food was delicious and service was great... Prices wasnt two bad either...

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The angus beef iron steak with garlic potatoes... Meat was tender seasoned well....

wvffuBvHPPU_QRfSxqXu1A.text: I had the opportunity to eat at TENDER steak and Seafood on a recent business trip to Las Vegas.  I love bison.  I cannot find it at too many places, but Tenders had it on the menu.  I ordered the Bison Ribeye.    As an appetizer they brought us a sampling of different breads and edible oils.  The Rye was way better than I was expecting, and the sourdough was great.  Then the Ribeye showed up.  I also ordered the green peppercorn sauce to add a little bit of kick to the Bison.  Normally I slather horseradish on my steaks, but they didn't have it as an option.  The bison ribeye was great.  My taste buds loved it.  So why did I rate the place as A-OK.  Quite simple - for $30 there should have been some veggies and mashed potatoes on my plate in addition to the single solitary piece of meat.  This would have been a 4-5 star rating if the meal included these two items in the meal.  For dessert I had the Banana Bread Pudding.  I love Bananas, Cinnamon and Bread Pudding so combining them in one dish was awesome.  During my trip I kept thinking of sneaking back some evening just to have this awesome dessert again, but sadly I didn't make it back.

3dr8ruuIZA8jVchSLAGAqA.text: Just returned from my trade show in Las Vegas and had a wonderful experience at the restaurant "Tender" in the Luxor Resort.  The food was fantastic, especially the desserts, however nothing compared to the amazing service received from Adie. Our group ate (and drank :) in the lounge, and were treated like celebrities. I was so impressed when Adie and the restaurant manager both remembered me from my last visit 2 years ago. It felt like I was dining with family.  That is what I call True customer service!!!  Although there are many restaurants in Las Vegas, I highly recommend you visit "Tender" and when you do, please say hello to Adie for me!!

EMItfQxRLk6RFyHq-ASryA.text: Really disappointed in the quality and preparation of the steaks. Tough and bland, deserved far better for the price.  Scallops were cooked well, nice server.  I've never written a bad review before, but this place deserves one. Sorry.

yIeroZ5fp2kfb_oYwNKz9g.text: Went back to Tender again on my last Vegas trip.  The Steaks, food and service at Tender are all still great.  On this trip I was able to dine at a restaurant from a famous chef that cost three times more.  And honestly the Steaks at Tender were better!  I still try to stop in every time I go to Vegas.  I highly recommend the Bison Ribeye and Lobster Risotto!!!

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bananas Foster Bread Pudding!!!
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bison Ribeye is the best!!!
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Risotto is so good!!!

tK2vhsSNkRsx0NhMGcmjow.text: the food is delicious! The drinks smooth! I love the Bison! Dewey, our server this night, was the best. Good humor, personality, down to earth, and an all around good guy. If you are lucky to have him, or can request him....do it!

dvU_yAugsPGcqsVCRY1Mgw.text: This last dining experience was THEE BEST we've had here! We have been to Tender several times over the years, and the whole meal and service was FANTASTIC! Thomas was our main server and he was GREAT! My daughter and I shared the Tomahawk Ribeye and it was flavorful and cooked perfectly! ( Only recommendation here, since it was a steak for 2...after presentation it would've been nice for them to have cut it)  Husband had the buffalo ribeye and that was fantastic as well and my daughters friend had the filet! All steaks were cooked  perfect and were flavorful as well as the asparagus and lobster risotto we all shared as sides! Yummy!! Very much enjoyed ourselves! Will be back!!  UPDATE **** February 2019 Well......hmmmm not sure what happened here..... Was looking so forward to returning here after our beyond fabulous meal back in June 2018, unfortunately I can't say the same this time :( I am not sure why so much change to the dining experience, from the menu (which is every meh and lacking of luster and considerably smaller) to the quality of the products served for such a higher "fine dining" price. I am a Rib Eye gal, and my rib eye, which cost $59  a la cart, was probably one of the most tasteless and tough steaks I've ever had. Definitely not worth the price. My husband had the Halibut, which was served over pasta, $38, and my husband said it had so much oil from the pasta or preparation that the taste was not enjoyable at all.   We again ordered the Lobster Risotto, which was alright, but a much smaller portion from before, $18, and the dish presentation was completely new. As the the pictures from before, nice serving plates, the risotto this time was served in a small cast iron pan. Again, not "fine dining" in my opinion. Neither of us finished our meals, nor did we partake in dessert.  We go to Vegas several times a year, and always stay at the MGM properties, so we visit Tender almost every time in town. It, unfortunately, will be quite a while before we try again. Hoping consistency and quality returns soon.

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomahawk Ribeye
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry  Shortcake

VaStrMM8167Eoo1I2RcLzg.text: Stopped by for dinner prior to catching a show at the Lux.  The bar tender who hails from Missouri is one of the BEST in the business of bar tending.  Needless to say, the service he provided was excellent.  The filet mignon and crab cakes I ordered were well prepared and simply delicious.  I will certainly be back next time I'm in town.

5DQZii1cDcmiz67KbCDswA.text: Professional service and bustling, dark atmosphere with too loud jazz-techno music, I wouldn't choose Tender again.  My BLT Wedge salad was good, and my husband enjoyed his half chicken, pawns dish but we didn't love this place and its high price tag with food that didn't match our expectations.  The sides were off--the Brussels sprouts reminded both of us of our most feared childhood vegetable because they were grayish-green and slimy in a watery, oily sauce.  I tasted one, and it was less scary tasting--kind of smoky with too much salt and just on the verge of mushy.  It was, we concluded, our parents' generation Brussels sprouts, not even close the the crispy, flavorful morsels I've been obsessed with for the last 10 years.  Pity.   The mushrooms had potential but were over salted by a lot.  The mashed potatoes were creamy but also over salted. The mashed potatoes were the best of the three sides.  As I write this several hours later, I'm still drinking water to recover from all that salt.  Ugh.  We were full and skipped on dessert.

v-ME-AuwHN-AB0JPPYeLvQ.text: This was our best and MOST expensive meal here in Las Vegas. Be prepared to spend $100 minimum per person but I had the Oscar Filet mignon & my husband had the New York strip and the meat was mouth watering and as the name says "tender" They will treat you like royalty & our waiter John and his personal helper Juan treated us with the most care and excellent customer service. If you want a romantic evening with your special someone, you won't go wrong here

MYXf5wtNrmyTNAHjBNszoQ.text: This steak house was horrible. The steak was not hot. The meat is not prime very tough probably select cut. I have no idea how they stay in business. Their bread was sweet horrible. The cheesecake was salty and had no cream cheese flavor. This place is just bad.  Lamb chops were good. No need to ever go back. Way over priced.

FXHUH-r64PepkLlDA_EAOA.text: Bombbbbb fillet Mignon very good Mac n cheese and lobster risotto ! Good service good food

-T6EQ6tyiPhACWjnD6rThw.text: Excellent service from dewey, we make our reservation here because of him, he's amazing,

W8FYkDfX6TWjGTGMeHknfg.text: I stayed at the Luxor for 3 nights for my birthday. I was not counting dollars, I was just having fun. My family and I were super hungry and was not too excited about the buffet (That's in another review)...we were seated and met by our waiter, Dewey. The food was really good! The service was prompt and pleasant. I won't go out of my way to go there again. That's only because of the price. $260 USD for 3 of us...300 with the tip. Maybe if I stay there again for my next birthday.

ZT2bGe9li9_rsoEaf_g6kA.text: First, if this rating was for service, it would be a solid 5 stars! Very personal and outstanding service. Now onto the food. The dinner rolls were the worst I have ever had. Not fresh and tasted store bought. Ceaser salad was outstanding, that's why I bumped up a star. On to the main course, we both had the Top Sirloin, they both were cooked to taste, but for the price, I have had better cuts for a fraction of the cost.  The baked potato was tough, I had the garlic mash, good flavor but not sure if instant. A 200 dinner tasted more like a cheap steak house meal! Won't be back.

j3JNfDoupVFBAoe336y72w.text: We had a wonderful dinner last night to celebrate my husbands birthday. Service was exceptional and the food was really good. We had the crab/lobster cakes and lobster tails for our entree. The lobster was presented nicely but from first look I knew they had overcooked it. We didn't cause a problem and ask for  replacement, although now I kind of wished we had.....a little disappointing. I have included a picture of it.

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KMqbwxCf1F_MMKaSC8q3Lw.text: We went here for a family celebration with 14 people.  The restaurant is beautiful and we were seated in a semi private room which seemed perfect.  Unfortunately, we had a less than perfect experience here.  Our dinner should have lasted 1.5-2 hours but we felt like hostages in this steakhouse for over 3  hours waiting and waiting and waiting for everything with almost no contact from anyone, not even a waiter with a water pitcher!  It took forever to take our orders, forever to bring the food and even longer to bring the check.  When the checks arrived the waiter was so confused and he went back to re-do them several times. Even after correcting one check THREE TIMES it was still incorrect and he told the guest "Oh yes, I know it is still incorrect.  I will change it when I get to the register".  He took the credit cards and disappeared for another eternal wait.  I believe the bills were still incorrect when we paid them but everyone was so frustrated we just paid so we could finally leave.    Overall the service was seriously lacking.  Even when the food came none of the servers knew where the plates should go and they seemed confused about what the item was on the plate to even ask whose it was. The food was completely mediocre and yet highly priced.  We were told that the side dishes were good for 2 people but that was incorrect also, luckily we ordered more than one.  Honestly I have had better steaks at Outback steakhouse.  We ordered several desserts for the table-the cheesecake was good, just like a store bought cheesecake-the warm chocolate sphere was a neat show as they melted the chocolate but the taste was actually bad, no one would eat it-the elevated chocolate pyramid was beautiful and tasted fine but not memorable.  Tender steakhouse was a HUGE disappointment.  We had a good experience here in the past, which is what brought us back for this family celebration.  Unfortunately that will be our last visit.

Kg0IS3KQSUOzyFBhcmklQg.text: This place was fantastic. The service was top notch and everything about dinner was wonderful including presentation. I would recommend this place. We also showed up half an hour late (we misread our reservation time) and they were polite about it.

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

D6GPwjLMOfnq08JmaaJqmA.text: My brother and sister in law were in town for some work seminars, so I met them for some drinks and dinner here at Tender. Very easy to get a table with no reservations on a Monday night. This place is surprisingly very large, with several "rooms" of tables.  It's a bit pricey, like any steak house on the Strip. My sister in law went with the Filet Mignon 10 oz size Oscar style, I think that was around $68. My brother and I went with the Ribeye sampler which featured Australian Waygu, Australian Angus, and Bison ribeye in 6 oz portions ($75). The Waygu was fantastic, tender and flavorful, and the Bison had a nice strong flavor as well...both easily outshined the Angus. No sauces were mentioned, and of course sides are individual. I also had the lobster bisque which was very good, but not the best I've had (The Palm still has that title).   Service was prompt and on point. The steaks came out pretty quickly too probably because it wasn't that busy. Steaks were cooked right and seasoned well, not overdone in either category.   Its not the best steakhouse in town, but I was happy with everything.

Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 ribeye steak sampler

fkAWtv-lAMcO74OQPrWfcA.text: My wife and I went to Tender 4/20/19. As we were deciding what to order for our entrees, we decided on a few appetizers. The first was tempura fried prawns (it's not on the menu so ask your sever). These were wonderful! Perfectly cooked and a really neat presentation. We also had the crab cakes and the house salad. Both were good. For our entrees my wife had the filet Oscar style with crab. I had the Kobe filet. Best testing filet I ever had! Our sides were creamed spinach and garlic mashed potatoes. The only issue with the potatoes is that we wished we had more. The services as great. John and team did a great job.

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WKE175aYFr8Drzi0kbQE1Q.text: had a birthday party for my son in law at tender steakhouse in the luxor.  thos place is top notch.  dean baxter took care of every need we had and made it a party we will never forget.  he was amazing!  the food was great, great service and attention to detail.  you have to visit this place

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. SON IN LAWS 30TH BDAY!!

qd6VK1Cs5ChvKrZW-UUvTw.text: We had an excellent meal at Tender. My steak was perfectly cooked and very tender, our daughter's Mac & cheese was very cheesy and I loved the creamed spinach. Our waiter was great!! He made a connection with our daughter, he was informative and fun. He also got us our check quickly so we wouldn't be late to our show. We really enjoyed our dinner here & would definitely come again. It's expensive but it was a very good meal.

BfPazAGy8vH_X_QUpn7-Tw.text: Excellent little restaurant inside the Luxor Hotel.  We needed something quick to eat before we headed out for the evening but were a little too dressed up for the quick food stops or buffet line at the hotel.  We popped into this place after peaking at the menu outside and decided to grab a drink and a few hefty appetizers at the bar so we wouldn't be delayed.  This restaurant is right next to the casino with an open seating bar area as well as a private room for large parties in the back and a regular seating styled restaurant hidden behind the bar.  It was a nice little stop.  We ordered the charcuterie board which had a nice selection of artisan cheeses and meats, the wedge salad with big sweet flavored slices of bacon on top and the mushroom soup.  Everything was delicious but the mushroom soup was the star of the show.  We enjoyed a nice glass of wine and were not rushed at all.

-Lgfqdv-3xKJh5UXlLFkIQ.text: This place was perfection. Started with the cheese board (don't even really like "cheeses" unless they're on top of a burrito but omg it was to die for. Even the dates and walnuts on the board were superb.The bread basket and wine was excellent as well, the level of service was great too. I got the salmon..BEST salmon I have ever tasted. Cooked to perfection. This place is worth the money.

EH09-olflUHxJDvJZOmJsw.text: Great food. It was our wedding day, we chose to see Criss Angel and since we would be at the Luxor we chose to also eat dinner here after the show. The food was so good. We actually shared an 8oz steak, they did charge for a plate as we decided to share. I do not recall the fee. We also had the gratin potatoes and the mac and cheese. It was so delish. We took the leftovers with us and when we got home Sunday we reheated and they were just as good. They knew we had just married and provided us a small delish plate of deserts. Thank you Tender for making our wedding day even more special with delicious food.

ECEa_FS0uVgXGfTy3xk1eg.text: The wait staff was very attentive! We were a little disappointed in the jumbo shrimp. It wasn't altogether jumbo. The steak was very tender and flavorful. However, we had asked for it medium rare and it came out rare. Overall, it was a good experience. Extremely pricey. Be prepared to spend well over $150.

hxE90I6T7HshNNdqPJqdVw.text: Best filet I've ever ordered, amazing service. I loved the asparagus with the hollandaise sauce. Yummmmmmmm

IfskS1BbjkowejsSzoQazA.text: If I based my experience on the food alone, the chef deserves a 4.  The buffalo ribye was served perfect.  Overall, the ambience was warm.  The service was satisfactory.  We had dinner reservations for a party of 5 on Christmas night.  I had trouble finding parking at the Luxor, but the rest of party made the reservation on time.  I came 30 minutes later after parking the car.  The rest of my party was seated.  Here's why I give my experience a low rating based on customer service (this is for the restaurant management):  1)  The young Asian female hostess at the entrance was NOT HELPFUL and very UNPROFESSIONAL.  As I entered the restaurant, I gave her my party name (Eliza G) that was seated already.  Her stoic reply was, "I guess that they're back toward the left."  She didn't bother looking at her monitor to tell me the table.  I walked toward the dining area with no success for 2 minutes.  I finally found a very helpful blond female staff member who wore a red sport coat.  She walked with me back to the Asian not-so helpful to me female hostess who promptly gave the blonde employee the table number where my party was at.  DON'T PISS ME OFF when I'm spending $300+ for dinner that night!  2)  When the very helpful blonde female staff member (KUDOS) took me to the party table.  I was met by a Hispanic male waiter who sarcastically told me, "You're the one who's late."  I gave him a stoic look and took a seat.  I was already frustrated from trying to find parking and dealing with a lethargic hostess.  To the management, please take into consideration your customers.  I don't care for obsequious staff, just friendly service with a positive attitude.

E_t-_g0M1Kngh_jcNOmJvQ.text: This place is the worst. We had NY steaks that were shriveled and tasted terrible. We had the Ahi Tuna appetizer that was old fish and smelled so bad we couldn't eat it. We had salad that was wilted and tasted terrible so we couldn't eat it. The wine was OK, but they didn't have to make it, so no help there. The ambience feels a bit like the rest of the Luxor; tired and lame.   I honestly was shocked at how bad this place was. They charge prices equivalent to nice steak houses but the food is grade D but (barely) edible. Yuck.

nt_FxJlwfOrCBDrbuvQAoQ.text: This visit to the steak house was our anniversary and the ribeye was undercooked the first time, undercooked the second time and over cooked the third time. The waiter Raul was great but manager asked us if he could buy us a drink, which we do not drink. It was my wife that they screwed up on and after all that time she was not pleased. Unpleasant experience with the food

7YdNjXMVZHEqaK9Fcoe-hg.text: Food was great I asked for a medium ribeye and that's exactly what I got!!! The food sides and soups and salads where on point!! The service was pretty good.  Did have to ask for some drink refills but otherwise on point.  The portion size were also fantastic u won't go home hungry.

U3PmVETbboJhBDrdnCvaCg.text: Best meal and customer service I have ever experienced!  I would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a fancy dinner.  My husband and I ordered the Alaskan king crab warm with butter for our appetizer which was fabulous. For the the main course we got the 8oz. Black Angus filet mignon with Yukon garlic mashed potatoes and asparagus. The filet mignon was cooked to perfection and melted in my mouth. We also got a red wine sauce with it which was amazing. I wish I could have gotten the recipe for the potatoes. Best mashed potatoes I've ever eaten they were heavenly. The service was amazing the waiters were so polite and professional. They treated us like royalty. I will definitely be coming back here.

nRAlHrcBEeojFg_Fz2FF-Q.text: Really good food and service was good too. If you are looking for a place to eat that serves a great steak this is it. My boo and I ordered the Tomahawk Ribeye for 2. The steak was absolutely fantastic. It was tender, flavorful and big. Arugula salad was killer too. Its a traditional steak house in the sense of high leather seats, dark decor and everything big and bold. The only thing is they come over and take pics of you and in the end they try to sell it to you, but in vegas its everywhere. Go here if you want a quality meal without having to drop $400 in vegas. I been to kraft by tom collichio and this is wayyyy better.

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomahawk Ribeye Steak 36oz for 2! Side of mashed and side of creamed spinach.

INAgiczv8KMCnblec6hzaA.text: My man gave the Wagyu Flat Iron Steak a 4.8 (rounded off to 5). That's not easy to do so Great Job, Tender!  Service and ambience were amazing!

sGIReliPXz0E2j5DC3XaMg.text: So, my husband & I ate here in 2009 & it was one of the best meals I've ever eaten. We ate here again just this past week in 2017 & it was not good. Let me be clear, hosts, bartenders, servers were all great. This was clearly a management issue. We ordered soup & salad before the meal. The salad was literally rancid. I NEVER return food but there was something very wrong & I wanted the kitchen to know before they served anyone else ate the corrupted food. The server was very nice, took away the salad, took the salad off the bill & gave us a free drink. The manager actively avoided coming to our table for the duration of our meal. The rest of the meal was okay, but after having the taste of the spoiled food, it just all tasted bad from that point on. I've worked in the restaurant industry for years and this behavior was truly baffling. Especially compared to the amazing food and service we experienced throughout the rest of the Mandalay & Delano properties. I totally recommend eating everywhere else within the property but we will not return to Tender.

zOm_buFYMh4a_XVLYrYm7g.text: We made a reservation for 5, table was ready for us on time. Service was very good, food was delicious, steaks cooked as requested and the lamb was flavourful but the salmon was dry and overcooked.

tzDFZasRZ_5LprAhc0DCyg.text: I ate here one night with my wife and my mom on our most recent trip to Vegas.  All of the major hotels in Vegas have a steakhouse, and Tender is the one located in the Luxor.  When I think steakhouses, Tender isn't one that would usually jump to the front of my mind, but we had a $75 comp and were certainly willing to give it a shot.  It definitely had a steakhouse feel to it.  Lots of dark woods and dim lighting.  I thought it had a really nice ambiance.  We were given one of those circular booths, which are nice and cozy.  The prices here are pretty standard for a Vegas steakhouse, though not as steep as you might pay at Wynn or the Bellagio.  You can get a filet from anywhere between $40 to double that, depending on the type/grade of beef you want.  As with most steakhouses, all of the sides are a la carte.  They give you a bread basket that has a really nice selection of various breads.  It was quite good.  For our meals, we split a caesar salad, as well as the tomato mozzarella salad.  Each of us ordered the standard filet for our meal.  We added one side of potatoes for the table.  All of this was more than plenty to fill us up.  We didn't even have room for dessert.  The food was great, and the service was excellent throughout the meal.  I must say that I was pleasantly surprised by the whole experience.  I honestly had no idea what to expect from this place.  Overall, everything was very good, and I can't find anything to complain about.  We'll be back here if we ever stay at the Luxor.

nzSM4t9b3Pa5QFgqlMIUjg.text: Honestly our experience have been a 5 star one as we had a 75$ coupon (on a minimum order of 150$ without taxes and tips), but the place is definitely overpriced just like any other steakhouse in Vegas.  The meat was incredible, very tasty and very well cooked. The fact that a 70$+ sampler of 3 filets (nor any other entree) doesn't even include a side though is little too much even for Vegas.  But again, the quality is there so if you want to taste some great meat and especially if you want to know where every single cut comes from... Tender is a place you should definitely visit.  Service was top notch and deserved a 20% tip without any doubt.  Out of our budget without an offer like this so it's quite unlikely we'd go back in the near future, but reccomended is steak is your way of life! :)

j0ZBNxRhzVxRLpCLV6beLA.text: Very average.  The big eye app was not fresh.  The Kobe beef carpaccio was flavorless and seemed like it might have been seared.  I left it at that before diving into a very overpriced steak

kzW2XleL8w_bqyzqumVoGg.text: Came here with a $75 credit from MyVegas.  We ordered a couple of filets and some side dishes and some wine.  The steaks were very good.  Both came out medium and tender as ordered.  Two of the side dishes were very good.  The truffle mac n cheese was outstanding and the garlic mashed potatoes were quite good.  The lobster risotto was a disappointment.  The flavor was lacking, the rice was too al dente, and the dish was pretty much cold on arrival.  The wagyu beef chili was outstanding, and had great kick.  The service was on point, and friendly.  Their bread and pesto were outstanding.  We would eat here again, but the meal for two, with one glass of wine was $230.

_O0IiK7EzKIzcpB72fp5UQ.text: This place was only ok... The prices were really high, but pretty standard for a steakhouse on the strip.  My issue was that the food was pretty bland.  My lobster bisque was actually delicious. But the scallops I ordered for my main dish were pretty flavorless.  Both the quinoa and the guacamole that come with the scallops had absolutely no flavor at all.  Just kinda disappointing.  Probably won't go back

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Charcuterie plate... pretty good with lots of exotic meats
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster bisque... very good
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops... very bland

MoxqaeDVi0OE6896HgYDDA.text: Went here with another couple as part of a compromise - I really wanted a sushi/sashimi plate, the men of the group wanted some kobe style beef. I saw that they had a tuna sashimi appetizer and thought, eh, I'm not that hungry anyways, and we all get what we want....  The food came out pretty quickly, but it turns out only one of us actually liked what we got. On top of it, the quality of my sashimi was sub par to say the least. Very disappointing. They literally just took the scraps from the tuna they serve as an entree and clump it together three different ways.  The stars are for our waiter - he was very attentive and went out of his way to see that we could bring our unfinished bottle of wine home =)

g1Bz4wa_Kw86aiO-ii9UZg.text: From the get go, our server seemed annoyed after our drink order.  After drinking all day at the pool, our party of five ordered waters to start off with.  He noticeably was irritated by that and said waters will be there shortly.  He arrived back within a few minutes and we still weren't ready to order.  This seemed to further upset him.  My wife did order a beer at that point.  It took almost ten minutes for him to return to take out order.  Nobody in our party likes seafood, so the appetizer selection didn't appeal to us.  We ordered a couple of salads to start, which were delicious.  When our meals came, two of us ordered the filet mignons.  Mine was surprisingly all fat, which is truly odd for a filet.  We both ordered the filet, butterflied medium rare.  My sisters was well done and mine was more towards medium well.  They re-did my sisters steak first while I tried to eat mine.  When my sisters returned it was cooked perfectly.  It did take 15 minutes for that steak to return.  I then had asked that mine be re-done.  It took almost 20 minutes, only to come back out close to being well done, again.  By this point, everyone was done eating and I couldn't eat my steak.  The manager seemed not to really care.  At the end of the meal, I asked to speak with the manager.  The server said it was not necessary because he removed my steak from bill.  I thanked him for that.  I was still bothered by the lack of concern from the manager.  For being a fine dining restaurant, and also that I am a manager at a upperscale  restaurant; I expected more from this dining experience.

6hmnr6-313VypG5dy9YisQ.text: So many steakhouses in Vegas. Chose this one and did not regret it. One of the best steak dinners I've had in years. Started with warm bread that they bring to all the tables with whipped butter.  Caesar salad was fresh and crisp with thin pieces of toasted bread and toasted parmesan cheese. Clean crunch in every bite and not too much dressing.  New York steak was tender, flavorful and superb. Had the mushrooms and onions with it, complemented each other really well. Staff was nice, sat me at a table instead of at the bar.  Will be back when in Vegas! P.s. was so good, forgot to take pictures.

dpzfjeqj2AfMukFFvYkYuA.text: The food was good, but be forewarned--this place is *EXTREMELY* expensive. It's inside the Luxor on the main level, inside the casino area. Everything on the menu is a la carte. The side was big enough for my niece and myself. The halibut was okay, but not mind-blowing. The wedge salad was better.   I love the Luxor hotel, but I won't be dining here again. I don't mind spending money on a good meal, but I can't fathom this much money for no more than what you get and it wasn't even perfect.

QAGicDiZ0IyOSB3swoOacw.text: Run away from this restaurant, Not worth the money of $115/person, we dined at this "upscale" steakhouse named "Tender". What do you expect? Tender meat for your orders of steak right? Instead you got medium cooked 40 oz. ($135) tomahawk steak as chewy as you can possibly imaging. When telling waiter, he did not even apologize or comment on it, we each ate less than 1/3 of the steak, and think the salad were actually the highlight of the meal. Looking at neighboring tables, pretty much the same thing, steak were not even half way finished....

-Vb4kQ1wH1ziqDXk3UXV7Q.text: In a city full of choices to eat we came to Tender, mostly because we were staying at the Luxor and I had heard good things about it. The food was good, but for the price and for being in Vegas with so many other choices for folks to go to, it needs to be stellar...it wasn't! My sister's steak was undercooked which is easy to fix but shouldn't have to be. My steak was good but I've had better! Everyone else's meals were good but the reason for my low review is they charged us for water!!! Granted it was only 3 dollars which is nothing except that THEY CHARGED US FOR WATER!!! Which by the way, no one ordered. For as much as we spent (Party of 6), we shouldn't have to pay for water. Sorry Tender I won't be coming back, I can get good steak anywhere!!!

xp2EIVw3t_ECjVlnyKP_XA.text: We went to TENDER because of MyVEGAS, I had a $75 credit on $150 or more. This place is fantastic. I've been to Hell's Kitchen in Vegas, and this is better and more affordable. 8oz filet and 24oz porterhouse cooked to perfection! Garlic mash was smooth and delicious. Lobster risotto has just the right amount of lobster!  To finish, New York cheesecake was so yummy!  Service was excellent. No complaints at all!

IHXcGgpiHNSaAtbrXsfmcg.text: LIKED TENDER, BUT DIDN'T LOVE IT.  Came here for a birthday celebration on a recent trip to Vegas.  Everything you'd expect from a steakhouse: a clean and classy decor, dim lighting, older men with escorts aplenty, a faint scent of cigarettes mixed with Febreeze.    Our service was excellent as Dewey was attentive and kind.  As a group, we ordered the 24oz Porterhouse prime rib, Mac and cheese, Yukon mash potatoes, steak burger with duck bacon, tomato bisque soup.  Have to say our food was good, but not as good as other steakhouses I've been to.  Mac n cheese was a bit dry for my liking.  Steak lacked flavor and I wish they would have recommended a sauce to put on it.  We left with empty wallets and empty stomachs as the sides were quite small for 2-3 people.    All in all, I left unenthused and kinda wished I went somewhere else.  This place wasn't bad, just didn't give you the bang for your buck you'd expect.  I guess its my bad for even eating inside Luxor, but what can I say, I'm an optimist.

947tro8u_RwnBSoIC1axHg.text: Came here to celebrate my birthday.  First off it was $160 plus tax for 2. I got the filet mignon and it was over cooked sent back 2nd one was good. My boyfriend had the halibut and it was a little overcooked.  Did not send back. Sides come separately and were great. Mashed potatoes and another potato dish. We had crab cake app and you got 3 per order the size of a 50cent piece. Barely warm but good. Gave a birthday dessert. Not worth the money. Would not return

UwmfhQcqPQWDlGpiXgNkKw.text: I normally do not go to places that are less than 4 stars on Yelp but this one completely took me by surprise.  Went here for a company dinner and had amazing food and quick service.  The interior is dark, intimate, and classy.  The winner of my dinner was the Japanese wagyu NY strip.  This was the BEST steak I've ever had in my life.  Perfectly cooked, melt in your mouth tender, not over seasoned, and bursting with flavor.  Took a while to get our orders but afterwards food was promptly brought out and service was friendly.  The best meal I've had in Vegas.

2Q9sAasN5txk6jzArIhnfw.text: 5 star service and steaks! I was dining alone and felt very comfortable. Good wine selection. Very nice atmosphere without being too upscale. Great steakhouse for Luxor.

mScBS6MCJzL_X3ukRnaLdQ.text: Best steak dinner I ever had. Service was great. Great way to celebrate our wedding day

ltiKa5UDV5pCrJbs4MaqBg.text: The Sherry Sophisticated at Tender in Luxor is a delicious aperitif. A perfect way to start any meal! The service was impeccable. Normally when eating by myself, I sit at the bar because I don't want to bother the busy servers by sitting at a table of 1. However, the place wasn't busy so I decided to sit in the dining room. I was still tested to the same level of service that is provided to larger tables. Everything I ordered was delicious. Steak was cooked perfectly.

Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lXiIaPWPBKaqrcculATauA.text: Started with the seafood tower and it didn't disappoint!  Then on to a caprese salad and I think being from Michigan's are spoiled with a better understanding of how it should be prepared.  The filet was done perfectly.  What a fun experience

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood tower
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The pork chop

DM_YpLVSmbBRDgrImO9BKQ.text: Outstanding Steakhouse all around!! Excellent Service, aps like crab cakes, meat cuts cooked to perfection and awesome side dishes!! Potatoes Au gratin  easily as good as Flemings!!! If you are in Vegas this Steakhouse is a must  esp if you are staying at Luxor or gaming next door at Hyper X.. PS Get  the Chocolate cake and NY Cheesecake!

egiYr84VgrhqqvYbGHP3nA.text: This was our first experience, we wanted a nice place to eat before the show we were seeing. I think I forgot what nice dining was like till our dinner her. Service was above and beyond. Prices were very reasonable for fine dining. I ordered a soup that was amazing, but was worried if I ate it all I would be stuffed for dinner. The waiter showed much concern if it was ok and If maybe something was wrong why I didn't finish it. Most places would never ask if something was wrong. Food was amazing. Place had low lighting making it very soothing for a nice evening dinner. A must try place

BVOWeeXVHOzQYyQ2PO6Nqg.text: The food was amazing. The prices were high especially for food you can get at any steak and seafood house. I will admit that the king crab legs were the best I have had anywhere and were plentiful. My picture didn't do it justice. The price of one NY strip was 54.00 not including sides.

64WRZiO80smc-yLm0umCeA.text: Had a wonderful birthday dinner here with friends, all of us ordered the filet and we ordered the lobster risotto and the potato au gratin. All were very good. The risotto was not my favorite a little bland.

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fillet
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fillet Oscar
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. potato au gratin and lobster risotto

wcT6XalWVmXMAWwEZI9A2g.text: I was pretty excited to come to Tenders and try it out!!  We called and made reservations and we arrived at 5:40 for 5:45 reservations. We had to wait about ten minutes after arriving to a restaurant on a Saturday evening that wasn't hardly busy. The hostesses were very short and rude to us.   Okay so we sit and are given the menus.   The steak is outrageously expensive for the poor quality of food.  Nothing was extra ordinarily spectacular.  I was expecting a fantastic flavorful steak for $90. On top of the steak the side are a la carte at $9 for each side. We got fries, mashed potatoes and asparagus.  Nothing special about the sides and the asparagus was a little to crunchy for my taste.    The waiters were very nice, treated us respectfully and was on top of keeping our drinks full!!  The lady that takes pictures was Friendly and outgoing but one photo at a dinner table was $65 and she wouldn't take a photo of us with our phones even after we purchased one of her photos.   We didn't use the bathrooms not sure they even had one or if you have to use the bathrooms in the casino like most restaurants in casinos.  The facility was actually quite dirty, which again was surprising for the cost of the food.   If you come here good luck, I'd much rather find a buffet to eat at over Tenders.

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

c_dA6hnF6VPGgVjuYKhV0g.text: Service was great, however, I was served lemon concentrate with my oysters. I figured a place this nice and expensive would serve fresh lemon juice so I put it on all of them, ruining the taste completely. This severely makes wonder about the quality of the food here. I was going to come back to try the exotic meats... not anymore.

X37DFCO_c06QggfO9xz3UA.text: I had the filet mignon with diver scallops. Both scallop and the filet (medium) were cooked nicely. However I didn't think the filet was the best cut as it had a little gristle. For the robust price they charge I would have expected it to be flawless, hence the 3 stars.

RGL4PTPVB2ggBMJKw6nSQQ.text: Third time eating here and third time I was satisfied with the meal.     Good quality meal.  Steak was cooked perfect and the sides were also very good.    This a great place to enjoy a meal with friends and family and take a break from the casino.     I always enjoy the food here and the service is always top notch.   The oysters were very good!   Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ID0LeOUwFwAQiHebOrc4cA.text: The American Kobe Filet was great. The other steaks we ordered were disappointing. We had two types of rib eyes and top sirloin. Tough and flavorless. Service was great and the wine list was a great value which is why I gave them 3 stars. Dessert was pretty good too. There are just too many great steak places in Vegas to be this mediocre.

jzaH1HY_4_fw2M_B4HWWSQ.text: Looking at the price tag and other yelp reviews, I figure this place would be decent.  I went here because of my dining vouchers from a time share presentation.  First, when I made the reservation, they made it a big deal that I was dressed business casual. I show up and everyone is in shorts and t-shirts.  Second, there is a prix fixe menu and they didn't bother to show it to me (since it has the special discount early prices). Third, I had a reservation, but when we sat down, they told us there were no booths available.  After I sat down, we looked around the room and there were 6 booths with no one there. I saw the reservation book and there no other reservations.  Fourth, food was so so. All the sides were drowned in olive oil (mushrooms and potatoes).  Steak was so so. Go to ruth chris, much better. Fifth, we got our bill before we even got desert.  I expect that from mcdonalds, but a 4 dollar sign fancy restaurNt???  If I could, I would have tender owe me stars.  We did get two waiters and a bus boy. I waiter and bus boy were good... Other waiter sucked.  Only go to this place if you have free dining vouchers..and even if you did, ask for new vouchers and go elsewhere.

FoK68g3G_Y4bmsoNCCUE6Q.text: Came here with a group of 4 to kick off a Vegas vacation.  Bill came out $280 - which is fine if the food and service actually warrant it.  I ordered the Kobe meatloaf with "foie gras and truffle" which were either in minute quantities are not in the dish because I didn't notice either.  The portion was small and food was ok, but not great. One of the members of our group found rocks in his food and they tried to claim it off as uncooked rice.  As Indians who probably eat rice for 2 meals a day quite frequently, this felt like an insult to our intelligence.  The waiter was brash and didn't bother to apologize for it either.  The food is way overpriced and the service is average at best. Go somewhere else if you want a good dining experience.

IOuMQmcrBHtL55hDaP-KSA.text: My husband says that it was the best steak that he has ever eaten and he eats a lot of steak.  Mashed potatoes and creamed spinach were good and large enough to share.  Loved the ambiance, very dark, cigar room like.  Great wine list and great service!

sV1Dqkepoh-eU_kIdQ2hQQ.text: my friend highly recommended this place. we had a group of 6 people. everyone ordered different cuts of steak but i ordered scallops! the service was excellent but for the price i was not impressed with the steaks

NGXzSDyjiq5fSd7Ti0zt9Q.text: Decent selection but a bit over priced for their steaks. Great service and relaxing ambience.

bwl38FQNR8pi5JyddO1aNg.text: Ordered some scotch and found that the glass had a chip on the Tim. My lip was not cut but it did get a bit of an abrasion. I mentioned it to a staff member and he apologized and got me another drink. That's it?  I don't want anything free, but the staff should know to take these things more seriously. Won't come back here again. You can always make a bad situation better, but nothing good happens from just dismissing an incident and not telling the manager to at least stop by and say a few words. Take these things seriously.

ZQiMqDSrKXfku3wfi2ju_A.text: My wife and I went there last Saturday and we're really glad we did. The food and the atmosphere of the restaurant were great. We split the 36 ounce Tomahawk Ribeye and the Lobster Risotto and the Wild Game Trio and Asparagus and Garlic Mashed Potatoes.   The complimentary pre-dinner bread accompanied by olive oil and chef made pesto was really good.  We used the $75 myVegas discount but even without it the price and quality of the food we got was reasonable.  I'd highly recommend the Tender Steakhouse at the Luxor if you are looking for a great Steakhouse with good food and a reasonably priced good quality steak.  I have posted some photos of the food we ate at the restaurant and I promise you won't be disappointed if you eat here.

oOcTpfbeukBQf6_u0O3RIQ.text: My husband and I failed to make a dinner reservation for NYE. We just happened to be in the Luxor Casino heading back to our room in Mandalay Bay when we passed by this place. It was 6pm, New Years Eve, and they were able to accommodate us. Awesome! My first thought was...uh oh, does that mean the food isn't that great? We ordered our drinks: jack & coke, and I had the "Summer Delight" which was too sweet for me. My husband had the oysters which he said tasted fresh. For my main meal I ordered the "8oz organic & Range-Fed Filet Mignon". I asked for medium well and although there was some pink, it tasted great. Unfortunately the steak did not come with a side dish so thankfully I also ordered the "Baked Truffle Mac & Cheese" which was delicious. My husband ordered the "lamb tasting" plate and his came with a side of potatoes. He cleaned up his plate. We had a Maroon 5 concert to attend so we didn't have time to order dessert. :(  Overall, we're glad we serendipitously found this place.

jffh0ldTLMdc18ug4mxeiQ.text: This place had a great atmosphere, hidden gem inside the Luxor! We had a small window to get a good meal in and chose this place. Only three stars as my filet came medium rare and I ordered it rare. Epic mistake but I did not have time to get it fixed.

MLAgaTZeApx0Vb4F58tuFg.text: Steak was delicious. Had the 10 oz filet medium rare.  Was cooked perfect.  Get the cream corn and the potatoes probably the best two sides.  And the strawberry short cake is soooo good. The only dress code they have is men can't wear tank tops.

-gR1sDXptbEst9ayUpF3IQ.text: I decided to try this place for the convenience.  My customer was staying there and it was short notice.  We got right in.  They might have had 20% occupancy at 9pm which is pretty light for Vegas steakhouses.  My bone in Kansas Strip had a lot of gristle, especially for the price. Outback would have been a better choice.

EOlX026PzyzwPySouLPrMQ.text: Luxor is a bit old but this bar is classic ..I made some friends there and we shared red wine...wonderful night

N4fmS6AyJ_vOTpd5hZlWyA.text: This is one of the places where if you have to ask the price, you can't afford it. If you're not interested in throwing a Ben Franklin and then some at dinner, find somewhere else. Chances are you would have already known that, since if you don't make a reservation, the odds are pretty low you're getting in.   But all this is to know what you're in for. Vegas, despite being sort of a piece of crap in many ways, does have some very high end restaurants, where nothing is left to chance, all the way down to the decor which is rather dim and inviting and features heavy wood paneling quite heavily. The food is generally outstanding and if this isn't the highest end joint in the city, it's in the running. If you're with a large group, expect a fleet of staff, including one guy who does nothing but explain what's what and also how to eat it, if you need that. Expect the manager coming over to earnestly inquire as to your satisfaction. Expect to tell him everything is great because it will be.  This reminds me somewhat of Spencer's in Salt Lake, with their meticulous attention to detail. The actual menus are different (I somewhat prefer Spencer's overall), as far as sides and appetizers (Spencer's is much better) and exclusivity of cuts of meat (this one has more of those), but they are still of the same very high quality. It's hard to isolate anything I had as less than very good, as all of it was top notch, top shelf and trying to choose shortcomings is largely just nitpicking.   You can't go wrong with any of the steaks or anything red meat related, including surf and turf. Venture into the other meats at your own risk. I also highly recommend the creamed spinach. Thank me later. The menu is overall pretty well thought-out and designed and the chef at the helm executes as near-flawlessly as I've seen. Every one of the presentations was magnificent. If you want the "big night out" and are willing to pay for it, this should be a definite contender (no pun...well maybe).

omXn2wZWXgjzJUekwZc8tg.text: The 2 stars are for the decor, food, service, and everything else terrible. There are many other excellent options in Las Vegas. I don't know how they stay open!!!

M8tdtrM9gFwk1OGkdlRwWQ.text: Been here with my Love 2 times and both times we have enjoyed the service and most of all the food. Ymmy! When in Vegas this is a must try.

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love Lobster tail..
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and Drinks!
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious..

vd7qeCYtIO-0dEx7K9WS5g.text: I'm not a fan of pretentious people or restaurants. So the whole vibe was rubbing me the wrong way when they handed me the menu and I saw that the least expensive "real" steak was $45.  Our waiter was fantastic. He offered us the house specials, his recommendations, and giggled when we went against his advice. For desert we ordered a $10 slice of peanut butter pie (against his advice) and it was so tiny that it wouldn't even fill and elf. We asked if this was a sample and he said, "No, I'm sorry, tee hee, that's all you get! Tee hee!" (I warned you!)  The food was good but I've been spoiled with too many steaks done over charcoal. Pan fried meats turn me off.  Honestly, I'd rather have hamburger over mesquite charcoal than a filet mignon cooked on a pan.  All in all it was a great meal but when I know I could have had a better meal someplace else for less than the tip I feel like and idiot.

1WtA9QhKFvfuzxcOoYphrg.text: Tastes ok but doesn't worth the price.I don't recommend the wagyu beef.

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

g-ogO_34-nZgKN3EwqiiuA.text: Decided to splurge a bit at TENDER during a recent stay in Las Vegas.  We had early reservations for Tuesday evening, so we were among the first patrons to arrive.  The layout of TENDER is nicely done; there's a bar area in the front with the host/hostess station, and the interior is divided into separate rooms with open walkways between them.  The layout allows the restaurant staff to adapt the seating to the level of business; a room could be mostly seated and seem lively and bustling even if 3/4 of the restaurant were empty, or guests could be spread out effectively even if the place is slammed.  For guests, that means that you're unlikely to feel like the place is dead or like it's too busy no matter when you go (unless they are truly full to capacity with a long wait, which certainly didn't happen during our Tuesday visit).  The service was exemplary; we were treated as honored guests during our visit, from quick seating at our arrival, to unobtrusive but careful attention during our meal.  Our servers were very professional and polished; the effect was almost like having a personal footman for our table.  I ordered the heirloom tomato salad, and split the ribeye trio special with my wife: 6oz cuts of the range-fed bison, the New Zealand black angus, and the Texas wagyu, all medium rare.  My wife ordered a side of creamed spinach.  I also ordered a Chimay Blue with dinner; it was a pleasant surprise to see it available on the beer and wines list.  The heirloom tomato salad was good, similar to a caprese salad (but without basil).  We were excited to try and directly compare the three different ribeyes, so when they arrived we sampled each in turn right away.  To my surprise, we both liked the bison the best; it seemed to have the most marbling and was both very tender and tasty, though it did also have the highest ratio of fat to trim off.  Conversely, I was underwhelmed by the Texas wagyu; there was absolutely nothing wrong with it, but I had expected it to be my favorite with superior tenderness and taste, and I found it to be similar to other cheaper ribeyes I've eaten.  It was still very good, but I couldn't find anything exceptional about the texture or flavor.  The creamed spinach was excellent as well (if you like creamed spinach).  Overall, the experience was very positive, and the food was very good.  We enjoyed our evening and would certainly go back.  If I had to pick something that would set this place apart from a Ruth's Chris, it would be the service, which I found to be every bit as attentive and a bit friendlier (though of course service can vary from server to server).  As a disclaimer, we did not try any seafood dishes during our visit, so I can't speak to the seafood quality.  If it's in line with the steak, I doubt you'd be disappointed.  I have seen many other reviews refer to the prices as unusually high or exorbitant, but overall they are really in line with equivalent prime steakhouses.  The prices at TENDER are almost exactly what you'd pay at the Ruth's Chris up the strip.  The menu is posted online, so you can form your own opinion before deciding to go.  Definitely recommended if you're near Luxor and looking to visit a prime steakhouse!

O2M3OTwK48KZTrdj4NYzSA.text: Very good dishes. Enjoy our dinner at this restaurant. Knowledgeable staffs and great service. We only stayed at Luxor for a few days and we would come back again. We had a good time.

Oo_12znbFG_5bLf_zn40DQ.text: Tables had like an hour wait even though I could see empty tables either way sat at the bar with some loud heavily drinking people but that was the worst of it. I had the truffle mac and cheese and lobster risotto. Not much lobster in the risotto but the truffle mac and cheese, changed my life!!!! Hands down the best I've ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle mac and cheese
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster risotto

DABSTyMC3UdixQgA4R2pog.text: We came here armed with $75 off of $150 food voucher from MyVegas. Service was excellent. Ambience= Classic Steakhouse, old wood/leather dark Music = weird vibe, 70s, 80s, 90s music. Just find it off from a steakhouse with music of Michael Jackson's Beat It or Katy Perry's or NSync's. Hilariously weird. Food: Steak = portion's huge, split the steak with BF 20 oz  ribeye. They split it already. Perfectly cooked, but the taste is a bit off, maybe because of aged 28 days. But then Gallagher's aged theirs but still have a very nice taste to it. Scallops = BF said its a bit overcooked to his liking, a bit more chewy Lobster Mac N Cheese = OK, not too many lobster bits on it. Sweet Corn = Good, but prefer Envy's wayyyy better.  All in all, I will dine here again only if I have another food voucher, otherwise.... NEXT!!!
