6LvQ46zTQR0Q5dIjcfBb2A.text: Last night was one of the worst dining experiences I have ever had at a nice place like this.   Steak and lobster.  Fillet rare when ordered medium.  Lobster was barely warm and bland.  The service was less than expected too.   When I asked for some assistance with my undercooked food the server said it was rare not even med-rare let alone the medium I ordered and took it back.   They brought back the same cut up piece of meat that we dissected together at the table to confirm it was undercooked before we sent it back to the kitchen.   Where am I at Sizzler or a fine dining restaurant?   It gets better. After complaining about serving me scraps the manager asked if I would like a whole new steak. I told her yes, the first time maybe but not after 20 minutes of this!   At this point the lobster is gone the sides are almost gone and I didn't come here and order steak and lobster to be forced to eat one item at a time.   Bring a new plate all together the way I ordered it. Remember this wasn't even close. Two stages off on your cooking temperatures. The center was slightly warm or even room temperature you blew it!  I opted to just cancel the steak. My son was done eating and as mentioned most of my other dishes were finished also.   Then the bill came and they charged me for the sauce that I was not able to eat because I had no steak! Now this morning I noticed they have charged me full price for a lobster dinner vs. the add on price of 39.00 for lobster to be added to any meal as the menu clearly states.  Hence steak AND lobster.   My wife and I enjoyed this place several years ago and enjoyed it so much we dined their two nights in a row.   Obviously chef Kenneth Fazel was either not running this place at that time or if he was in fact the chef during our previous visits he must have recently taken up Smoking crack because it was a night and day difference from previous experiences.  Either this guy doesn't deserve to be at these type's of establishments or he needs to clean house and start over!!!!  I'm not talking about just blowing it on a steak. You guys blew it on several levels.   A very disappointed local!!!!

NY4uHpK8q2s2Tan7l8uT1w.text: Poor service. $50 FOR A $16 Outback steak, boiled flavorless Brussels sprouts, under cooked bland asparagus, low rate cheese board. Seriously, the best part of the meal was the bread.  The only way anyone can give this place a good review is if they have never been to a high and steakhouse before.

m5W3TlhpnKrZ-Pbd-qIR2g.text: The worst ever don't eat here! I got food poisoning - from over cooked mushrooms  It was gross  Wait staff was terrible too! We had dinner and show ticket with pre fix meal and even the desserts sucked ! Ugh !

iCAS63EYWThWxWjopVa5yQ.text: Always stay at the Luxor and finally decided to try this place.  Excellent food, service, ambiance, and wine.  Girlfriend and I both got the filet medium rare, broccoli, asparagus, garlic mashed potatoes, and lobster bisque with pinot grigio to drink.  Steaks were juicy and well cooked.  I added the A1-style homemade sauce (bomb!) and a crab medallion (make your own surf and turf for half the price.  Total bill with tip was under $200 for 2 people.  There is a $20 off coupon in all the rooms if you stay at the hotel.     Only thing stopping this place from getting 5 stars is that it lacks windows or a view.  For this reason, I still prefer the Range at Harrah's for Vegas steak.

WJF5bcReN1Y-iLKMptUxSQ.text: My boyfriend and I came here for our anniversary. It is a really nice setting. We play myVEGAS for free rewards and had a $75 credit when you spend $150. This was the best reward that we used. Their food is amazing, but a little pricey. It was nice though because we had the credit. They have a wide variety of wines, but we decided to get cocktails. I got their elite margarita which was good. Also a lemon drop, also good. We then got a hummus, peppers, and olives trio with pita bread and crackers for an appetizer. That was also really good. For dinner, we both got a skirt steak with a side of Garlic mashed potatoes. We also got a side of these chopped baked potatoes with cheese and sour cream. All of it was amazing. For dessert, we got their sampler which came with a cheesecake, a triple chocolate cake, and a vanilla creme brule. The brule was a favorite. It came with a sugar cookie also. During our dinner they also came by to take a couple pictures of us. Although they aren't complimentary with your pricey dinner, you do have the option of purchasing them at the end of your meal. Overall, the food is pricey but you get what you pay for. It was all amazing! I definitely recommend.

WY5a7zgfgk9UF53WOsw3_Q.text: the food was amazing. I'm a vegetarian and my husband is not and the selection was great for both of us. I'd definitely go here for the food again, but...the service sucked. maybe it was timing, we had reservations at 9:30 on a Saturday. it was not busy, but I did not see many servers either. it was like our waiter forgot about us, we waited about 10 minutes for him to take our drink order, and he wanted us to order our food then also. it felt like he was rushing us. our appetizers and food came quickly. after he brought us our meal he stopped by once to check on us and that was the last we saw of him. we finished our meal and waited at least 15 minutes before anyone came by. I wanted another glass of wine and dessert but it took so long for anyone to come by I just gave up. I feel like if we're spending $200 on dinner for 2 people the service should be great. or at the very least average. great food, disappointing service.

UTQk7azmeNP545AexXEhcg.text: It's an expensive Vegas steakhouse in the Luxor Hotel.  If you're fine with Ponderosa or lost your life's savings at the roulette table, don't come here.  That aside, I never eat red meat, but this place is the exception! Honestly, if all steaks were this good, I would be an incorrigible carnivore.   My husband always orders the exotic plates--wild game and the like. He advocates for this. I love my husband and usually value his opinion, but I would suggest that if you order anything except the filet, you are crazy.  They have an organic grass-fed filet option, but I went with the Kobe beef.  I plan to dream about it again tonight.  Side dishes are excellent and include the standard steakhouse fare like potatoes, sauteed mushrooms and asparagus.  Dessert list includes the necessary chocolate options like chocolate souffle.  I am still not convinced that this isn't what Meg Ryan ordered during the famous "When Harry Met Sally" scene.  Very pricey, but totally. Worth. It. Do yourself a favor and opt for the cheese plate as an appetizer. It's the best thing ever.  And make sure to visit whenever you're in Vegas!

bVPElM3Q_b6DIpBU6VodGQ.text: This place is bomb... I couldn't be happier. I went there for my best friend's 21st birthday dinner when we were in Vegas and I had the BEST experience! My dinner was amazing, to say the least, and our waiter was quite possibly the best server I have ever had. The restaurant is so elegant and did I mention that the food is amazing?! Their drinks are top notch as well... and the best part was that I got to TAKE my cocktail with me even though I didn't finish it at dinner. Tender IS pricey, however, if you are looking for a restaurant that won't disappoint the next time you are in Vegas, this is where it's at!   **Excellent for small groups and dates/relaxed dining.   **Expensive, but definitely worth it.

13reIbuRLlWzHv6Su0pqRQ.text: Great service. Overpriced food. We went here for dinner while in Vegas. I had the cioppino and my girlfriend had the New Zealand filet mignon. The sides are a la carte but they are huge, enough for 4 people. However, the entree portions are not big at all. My cioppino was overpriced for the portion size, and you don't get salads included. The wine prices were also very high. In all, the service was great but the food does not justify the price in my opinion. Eat here only if you have a coupon or discount and it would probably be worth it.

SEK3GQIXHajEYCTnkOtV5w.text: Been looking at this place awhile. The yelp reviews are mixed so me and the wife have hesitated. After being tempted by the steak menu (which looks amazing) finally i decided to make a reservation for the wife's birthday. On the website it clearly states locals get a 15% discount. Clearly. So i called the week before to make a reservation for Monday Aug 10th-not a holiday that i know of. I made my reservation then asked about the discount only to be told they don't honor that anymore! ITS ON THE WEBSITE! I emailed the Luxor to explain why i canceled my reservation-and they told me they honor whats on there website(-holidays and weekends i believe) So the hostess has 3 jobs. To take reservations, seat people & know the offers the restaurant has! If she/they cant get that simple communication right-this place isn't worth the phone call i made. I think based on this basic screw up i would not feel comfortable blowing $150-200 for a dinner. To many options in town

ekMu4RdvgL9Ul44ZdyDThg.text: I won a small Poker tournament and with my winnings my buddy and I headed to the Luxor Steakhouse.  Earlier we looked at the menu and saw a piece of Japanese Kobe 6oz for $140.    We were in shorts and flip flops, but they let us in.  It wasn't crowded at all, the service staff was very nice and the food was delicious.  We both ordered the Bone in Rib Eye 22 oz medium with corn and garlic mashed potatoes.  The sides were kind of on the small side, but they were good.  Also ordered a reasonable price bottle of Syrah ($32) that was very smooth.  The food was on par if not better then some of the more known local steak houses such as Ruth Chris and Morton's.  The interior atmosphere was more along the lines of Morton's, with the dark wood, cigar bar feel to it.    It almost seems out of place at the Luxor, as the Luxor isn't known for being high end, but it is close to the mandalay bay connection point.  For a good steak I would recommend Luxor's Steakhouse anyday.

2mCZbcmZW44pS2w9OEvcpA.text: A bit pricey, but as expected by the decor and menu. The bathroom has real towels, not paper! Try the wild game sampler, very yummy

3szz0F_N2B0aeRJTPKCHog.text: I'm staying at the Luxor and made reservations to try this place at the hotel as recommended by a manager at guest services.  When we got there, the hostess greeted us and told us they needed to set up the table and it'll be about 10 minutes.  Well the place had about 10 empty tables and booths(I didn't expect this bc I made reservations), so they told us to sit by the lounge area.    A waitress came by to see if we wanted cocktails, but we're not big drinkers and told her we'll order at dinner.    the atmosphere was very elegant and walls and ceilings were dark wood with dim lighting.  the booths were nice and looked good, but it's never fun to slide into the seats.  At Lawry's steakhouse, the waiter pulls out the table so you can get in easy........maybe they should do the same here.  we were sitted in the booth and our waiter Chuck was very nice and patience with us..........as we took forever to order.    I ordered the prix fix menu for $39. and you get to pick either mushroom soup or salad with a balsamic dressing.  Entree choices were salmon; chicken breast or beef filet.  Dessert was creme brulee; cheesecake or flourless chocolate cake.  I choose salad, beef filet and chocolate cake.   Also, ordered a glass of cabernet savignon red wine for $19. which was very good with my dinner.  the salad came out, but no one offered fresh pepper on it.  I waited a few minutes and asked Chuck for pepper and he went to bring over a salt and pepper shaker for our table.  This was a surprise bc I would think of this as a high end restaurant and they should grind fresh black pepper on my salad when they served it.  The salad was very good, but was lacking fresh walnuts or some kind of nut.  the beef filet was just as I ordered it medicum rare and was tender, melt in you mouth yummy good.  the carmelized onions was yummy too.  I ordered extra red wine sauce to go with my beef, but it didn't need it.  They offer you several choice of sauces for your entree for an extra $3., but this dish didn't need it as it had very good flavor by itself.    The flourless chocolate cake with a dab of whip cream was okay.  I'm not use to eating a chocolate cake with no flour, but it wasn't bad.  I just don't understand what's so great about a chocolate cake w/o flour.  This was the least fattening of the 3 choices.  My dining partner order the short rib ($25.) and ala carte yukon mashed pototoes ($7.)  It came out tender and melt in your mouth good and the mashed potatoes were perfect with it.  Chuck, our waiter who's been there for 17 years explained about their dishes and how they were cooked.  We enjoyed hearing the behind the scene of the restaurant.     Overall,  the restaurant appears be high end . there are several other dining room areas and the bathrooms were elegant with cloth hand towels.  Our experience of the food was good, but we were surprised at:  ie. they didn't offer fresh ground pepper when they served the salad,   The staff was not snobby and that was nice, but  Chuck was a friendly waiter, the others were very professional I thought and helpful.  I would recommend this restaurant.  It's pricey, but if you want a nice treat...........it's a good decent restaurant.

UVJ9F0mTMMruxWubTlcy-w.text: We chose TENDER over the pricier steakhouses at the other end of the strip.  We were glad we did.  I went with hubby and my dad.  We're all 3 picky steak lovers. It was very quiet considering we were right off the casino floor.  Nice Morton's type atmosphere with very attentive wait staff. Started out with a round of drinks.  Loved the Manhattan and my dad said it was the best Long Island Iced Tea he'd had in awhile.  Hubby had some firewater kind of cocktail that was very spicy.  I had the baby lettuce salad, which was their twist on the standard wedge salad.  It was fantastic and much easier to eat than a wedge! Pops had a standard tossed salad that was a nice size. Hubby had hangar steak ($27) with a humongous baked potato.  Pops and I had the Omaha fillet ($40) and it melted in my mouth.  OMG best steak ever! We were too full for dessert.  Note that everything is ala carte, but they have prix fixe menus that were very reasonable for 3-4 courses.

xopHGEhUmkJrXnGMaJ4cQQ.text: We were there on 4/12/15 at 5 pm.  We had a party of 4.  Succinctly, it was awesome.  The oysters were great and certainly fresh, the sauces with them were very nice.  Ribeye, filet, and scallops were all among the best any of us has had.  The sides were all delicious as well.  The ambience is nice and the service was impeccable.

Upq-RmFJT7AHiCXsNilLOA.text: Beautiful food, great atmosphere.  The steaks are perfect and tender.  I got the Alaskan King Crab Legs, which were worth every penny.  I appreciated how they pre-cracked the shell for me, as King Crag legs tend to be spiney and painful to open.  Their garlic mashed potatoes are to die for, and their drinks are good if a little weak.  I give the place four stars because it took a good 10 minutes for anyone to help us.  The person that was supposed to be our server never showed.  However, we didn't have a reservation and it was close to closing, so I can't complain too much.  Considering the food we got, the price really wasn't so bad.  The Kobe beef can run you over $100 a steak, but my crab legs were $40 and my boyfriend's filet mignon was $40.  The deliciousness was worth every penny.

hw0YP6F_H3AeQcSb5xAKjQ.text: My husband and I came in for a quick bite and ordered the Chilled Beef plate consisting of Japanese Kobe carpaccio, American Kobe beef tartare and marinated bison tenderloin.  For $18 it is the probably one of the best deals in Vegas!  The portions were perfect and all of the flavors were amazing and we enjoyed every bite.  We didn't eat  anything else at this restaurant and our waitress was a little ditzy and slow; my rating is based on the Chilled Beef plate alone.

ecTz8SFnlo5JpiilsB1-yQ.text: We had to come back here on our last Vegas trip. Apryl had been craving the Surf 'n Turf burger for months.   I ordered a fillet Mignon and my gorgeous woman chose the burger she had dreamed about, literally, a thousand times since last spring.   The food was awesome, just as we expected. Presentation, flavor and temperature were all on point. I was not as impressed with our service as I was the last time. However, the food more than makes up for it.

6I2-rFIzAbJLGDnqVaJtWg.text: We can always count on Tenders Steakhouse for a hearty meal. Eating here is not an inexpensive experience as the sides are ala carte but you walk away satisfied.   We enjoyed our New Year's Eve dinner here. My husband and I split the Winter Garden Greens Salad. Greens were fresh and not wilted. The vinaigrette was very tasty. Interestingly we were not offered fresh cracked pepper.  My husband ordered the black angus beef hanger tender (10 oz) with a side of grilled asparagus and Yukon mashed potatoes. The beef was very tender and not overly seasoned. The vegetables were also well prepared.  I ordered my favorite the veal osso buco over a creamy polenta. Wow, it was rich and savory. It comes on a bed of polenta along with onions, potatoes and celery. I'll have another please...  A bit disappointed in desert.  Knowing how long a souffle takes to cook I let the server know that I would be having the dark chocolate souffle when we ordered our entree. He was a bit surprised by my request and said it would be fine to order it after my meal. So I did and low and behold it came to the table under cooked. Geeee what a surprise. So we asked that another be brought to the table cooked. 15 minutes later another souffle appeared slightly better then the first. I ate a little of it and left the rest. Long story short, the server did not charge us for the souffle. Kudo's to him.  We will return!

f9xjlFKB8b4pXrYaR8vwQg.text: For the money, the steak is mediocre.  Served supposedly medium rare, it was cold. Disgusting.  Trffleld mashed was good. Good wine. Won't go back.

7Ir7kKePnFl5JHaZri1HEw.text: Service was ok, but my steak was overcooked and the potatoes gratin undercooked.  I asked them to redo my steak, the waiter unhappily took it to the kitchen and brought it back per the chef's request to show me that part of it was cooked as I asked.  As if I was going to eat just the third that was cooked as i requested. Rude and unprofessional. Steak lesson: the steak has to have the same thickness to cook properly! They gave me a piece of filet that was shaped like an uneven pyramid (clearly not pretty either).  Kudos to a lady (likely a manager) that tried to address the issue, but the chef must have been clearly upset because he then sent me a piece of cold meat that wasn't even seasoned (not even salt was added to it).  Never going back, never recommending to anyone.

nNoxaAkgC8IVfUzOyXABoA.text: Excellent!   My friends and I stayed at The Luxor and decided to try Tender, we were happily surprised at the quality and service we received.   Drinks were AWESOME, the cocktail waitress shook our cocktails for us table side... THANK YOU.  The cheese plate we shared was delicious, although it always amazes me why places give so few slices of bread for the cheese... there were like 6 slices and 4 girls.   My friend got her kobe beef burger and skinny fries... she likes her meat very well done but when I tried it it was still juicy. I had the meatloaf sliders which were pretty good, although the artichoke/seaweed spread it came with just tasted odd to me. Wasn't crazy about the crab sliders, the consistency was a little rubbery and I'm happy I didn't order it.   Decor is sexy, dark and comfortable... there's a lot of dark wood paneling, antler chandeliers, and very nice bathrooms that remind me of the Member's Only clubs in London.   Although I was originally hesitant about trying Tender's I'm happy we went here and do recommend if you're looking for a better meal but don't want to deal the the hassle of those other trendy spots.

CL4VlEn5Eo0aPosUUVJQMQ.text: I had dinner here in November of 2011, and was thoroughly impressed. The ambiance was great and the menu was impressive. I had the New Zealand Filet Mignon w/ sweet potatoes for a side (I wish I could have sweet potatoes w/ every meal). My filet was prepared perfectly, and my friends enjoyed their Ribeye &Pork Tenderloin. The wine selection was great and surprisingly affordable. I had a Malbec that paired great w/ my Filet. We had to skip on dessert, but the Creme Brulee looked amazing.

7HAaDoTFc7McYrsncr0kiA.text: By far one of the best meals I have ever had. My husband and I went with my brother and a friend for our 1 year Anniversary.  It was by far the best choice we could have picked. It's pricey but not any worse than another fancy like steak house. It was phenomenal. Definitely worth the price.

z0Eo2YlWHIwVhjNwMuupRg.text: This was one of the best steaks I've had. Service was great- but highlight was the cheeses! The platter was well accompanied with honeycomb that was simply exquisite. We had the cheese for desert as well! Highly recommend

1HLxIB8oG1oHMdNgn3_N_g.text: We came here first night at the luxor to celebrate my wife's bday weekend and we were not disappointed. The place and decorations look beautiful very elegant and classy.  I ordered the chicked and my wife the steakhouse and we both enjoyed our meals greatly. The potatoes on the side were also very yummy. Waiter was very helpful we had a very positive experience thank you.

y-eZh0AUfdCJooRgz40Keg.text: I must say i was extremely impressed with not only the food an the ambiance but most importantly the service.  John was truly amazing and made our experience that much better.  All of his recommendations were spot on.  I should say that John's co-waiter was equally as amazing but unfortunately i cannot recall his name.   Kudos to John and the staff!   Great food and great service.

ObKfgaMqz9hQjVaCPIu3Hg.text: This place was amazing. I went with my girlfriend for our 1 year anniversary and everything was perfect. From sitting in the cozy lounge with a drink while they got a table ready to the steak, potatoes, and chocolate cake for desert. The staff was VERY accommodating, the scenery was gorgeous, and for a steak restaurant in Vegas the prices were very reasonable. I HIGHLY recommend checking it out!

sOAiKIsdtxcdHaM0zBMdyA.text: I know I probably deserve some hate for rating this place so low for ordering a salmon in an exotic red meat joint; but still, why even offer fish if the same level of attention won't be devoted to it?  The appetizer was the special heirloom tomatoes with buffalo mozzarella. Coupled with the pesto-pumpkin seed-olive oil from the bread, this dish was awesome. These were the fruitiest, juiciest tomatoes I have ever tasted. Buffalo mozzarella was top notch too; melted in your mouth.  We actually smelled the fishy smell right as the waiter placed the salmon dish on the table. It must have been sitting in that freezer for a good while before they cooked it. The dish was totally sub par, I didn't even finish it. The garlic mash it came with was good but I've had better for the price.  So yeah, stick with the antelope.

tf2SdjtCb8bThFzLffQ0Vw.text: We had a bison steak and mushroom risotto here. The bison was good, but I've definitely had better. The presentation is kind of drab for what you're paying. The steak was literally a slab of meat on a plate.... no garnish, nada.   The mushroom risotto, on the other hand, was probably one of the best I've ever had. The menu is not particularly vegetarian friendly, so I was left with fish dishes or sides... I chose the side.   This is a restaurant you come to if you are staying at the Luxor and don't want to walk anywhere. For ambience, interaction, something else, you're better off walking to Mandalay Bay since there are much more fine dining options.

gpy32ZYifYzEhxPXIRpueg.text: One of the best steaks I've had in Vegas.... and anywhere for that matter. Their price fix menu is a great deal! Sun-Thurs $39.99 3-courses includes your choice of meat; I recommend the rib-eye med/rare.

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1OgezaeAAe3sIorgpzJL1A.text: We were part of a 16 person bachelor party on Memorial Day weekend. With working with Darrilyn we were able to make a custom menu for the party to choose from.  The service was incredible, we had a great waiter. Our drinks were always full, and he kept complimentary bread on the table at all times.   Our food came in a very timely manner and everyones steaks were cooked perfectly--all 16 meals arrived at the same time and were all hot. The general concensus was "this is the best steak I've ever eaten". We all agreed it was worth every penny (of their very reasonable menu prices).   I would definitely recommend TENDER to anyone looking for a great steak at a nice restaurant while in Vegas.

PfjWROFhkFAFoUhTZTg7Sg.text: Wanting to eat at the best restaurant in the Luxor prior to a show, I picked Tender although I was less than excited about its (and other Luxor restaurants) reviews. Those less than stellar reviews are justified.  My filet was ordered medium rare and arrived medium/medium well. It was sent back and I recieved a replacement that was closer to rare, but acceptable. The red wine sauce that was brought out with the first steak was left instead of being replaced or reheated for the new steak. The meat (and sauce for that matter) was lacking in flavor.   The wife's seafood sampler of crab, salmon, a whitefish and something else was well presented but also lacking in flavor.  The sides of truffled mashed potatoes and mac and cheese (I have a carbohydrate deficiency if you must know) were above average, but certainly not nearly as good as those at other steakhouses like Bellagio's Prime.  Next time, if this is the best restaurant at the Luxor I would eat elsewhere instead.

bX4V9w1H5NnGwpJ3DIl5JQ.text: If I could give negative stars, I would. I've never been treated with such disrespect as I was at this restaurant.  Food was mediocre at best. Steak over cooked and tough, potatoes not cooked enough. Our Server ( the main waiter, he had 2 assistants) was rude to my boyfriend and myself. Hostess was very unfriendly as well. I wouldn't eat here again even if it was free.

IWSzQOaTJQzevHpMbkWIxg.text: Very disappointed with the quality of the food. This is Vegas .. You expect more than sub par rubbery unseasoned filet ... Lobster risotto tasted like it came out of a bag, and the service left something to be highly desired . With all of the excellent food choices, do yourself a favor and go elsewhere. Came here on the myvegas comp first and last time.

LxGfyHHoJjJ98oVKxJy1WQ.text: Service was good. Sat in the loungy area and got drinks pretty quickly. The steak salad and surf & turf burger were great! Was a nice little spot all in all.

OLimXdt1OVpmi7VYdf2UuQ.text: This was a fantistic restaurant in the Luxor.  I was a little leary about eating here.  We were seated right away.  Both waiters made us feel welcome.  They pointed out everything we needed to know.  The meal was fantastic.  The wild game plate was outstanding.  I wanted a big steak but I didn't make a mistake with my choice.  Will definately come back.

R6H_c135s1UiPFNZc8sguA.text: My wife and I went in with high expectations, knowing that we'd be dropping close to $200 for an appetizer, dinner and drinks. Our tomato and mozzarella salad was very good, although a bit pricey at $18. The steaks (which should have been the main attraction) were the big let down...  My wife ordered a filet cooked medium, and it was medium rare / rare. I ordered a medium rare bone-in ribeye, which had two problems: First, it was medium / medium well, and IT HAD NO BONE.  I brought this to the food runner's attention, and he says, "Yes, it HAS a bone..." I jabbed my knife several times into various parts of the steak with vigor and feeling vindicated, I proudly say, "See? No bone!" He stares blankly and says, ".....Well, it HAD a bone," and walks away!   "Ok, don't panic," I tell myself, "the SERVER will make this right!" When I explain the whole bone-gate scandal, his response is, "Yes, it HAS a bone!" At this point, I gave up. When the manager comes around to ask if everything is wonderful, I explain to her that my wife and I have traded steaks, and her response was that she'd tell the chef to watch those steaks in the future. Shouldn't he have been watching them all night? Why were we "Patient Zero?"   Anywho, we won't be returning. For that much money, they should be able to nail a steak temperature way better than you or I can at home on the grill, and their first test on hiring waitstaff should be "Bone Recogniton 101!"

deTkH2wZgRY6tDX5Lxh9rw.text: First time to a spendy steakhouse and I was not disappointed here. The porterhouse was tender and flavorful.  My girlfriend and I shared it,  2 sides and 2 glasses of wine and it was $110! I knew it would be expensive but had we not shared the meal it works have been $200 before top and tax.  Too much in my opinion.

fFghwvGA1tGcd8XFtJY2rA.text: Before heading in to see Believe Nick and I decided to make a big night of it and eat a nice dinner. Every hotel has a steakhouse so it wasn't like we looked over all the menus or anything to pick this one. It was chosen sheerly by the virtue of being in the same place as the show we were seeing. With that said I felt it was a very, very good choice.  We started with a cheese plate that had 3 types of cheese and accoutrements for a mere $14, which I thought was very reasonable. I appreciated the fact that they had a good assortment to choose from, I think around 10 cheeses. I also had a glass of champagne and Nick had a Chimay. Both of these I still found to be a pretty good deal, considering where we were in terms of city and restaurant style.  After that we shared a salad with comice pears, smoked bacon and blue cheese, roasted fingerling potatoes with creme fraiche and chives, and grilled asparagus in a lemon citrus olive oil in addition to our main entrees. I had a black angus Niman beef strip steak and Nick had a Berkshire Heritage pork with apricot chutney, both of which were cooked exactly the way we ordered them and were priced in the mid to high 30s.  While, this was definitely an expensive meal it was also a meal worth the price. We had the dual servers so when one wasn't around to help us the other was no matter what we needed. There is something about this system that I really like because you have two familiar faces so you're never left without drink refills or other necessities, but they also aren't done by a stranger each time so you get a sense of familiarity throughout your meal.

Hb_D_5nKTUkZdEfJnSxlDQ.text: We went there with about 20 guys not one of our party complained about anything steaks were cooked to perfection appetizers were great best steak I have eaten in a long time definetly worth the trip we will be back. Great service and friendly waiters

eM2d2Gawb4HVMYZEN0Lvvw.text: There are many steakhouses in Vegas. A great meal at a top steakhouse will cost about $80.00 - $120.00 per person including 1-2 drinks + appetizers and dessert and coffee. But the dining experience at this high lebel should be exceptional ...in fact, every part of the meal should be exceptional:  the quality of the food, the service, the ambiance, etc.  My advice?  Select another restaurant or another steakhouse. This one is not a top steakhouse, but commanding $$$$ as if it was of that caliber. Should I have received a warm steak? Should I be required to wait for a steak knife after being serve the steak? Should I need to find the waiter for ground pepper? Should I need to remove pieces of muscle/tendons that cannot be chewed? Should I need to be grilled twice about these issues by the manager? Should the quality of the steak be of a high level so that I would not need to return it? Should I need to find the waiter to request coffee?  I cannot return here. There are other ways to lose money at a casino.

vw_i5lHS6yDpZQH0WHRiIQ.text: The good, the bad and the ugly  The good : the food. The salad was amazing. One of the best things I've eaten at a restaurant. The steaks were good but I cook them better on my charcoal BBQ. The side dishes are separate and if you don't order many you'll end up just with steak, a detail I didn't like.  The bad : the service. The maitre D was, well, I can't write it here. Fortunately she wasn't with us for a long time. The first waiter we got was all huffing and puffing, trying to impress us. When he saw we didn't respond to his machismo, he left us and a bored woman ended up servicing us for the rest of the evening, which made the tipping part confusing. That first waiter was point blank rude to drop us for other clients who were entertained by his sideshow antics (this is in Las Vegas after all).  Another bad was that it's overpriced. For example, if you order 4 different veggies separately (as mentioned above, like peas, carrots, asparagus and mushrooms) you end paying $40+ just for something to eat with your steak.  The ugly : the showy waiter stoked a group of 6 or 7 men nearby who were drunk, extremely rude and obnoxious, and not necessarily in that order. We could barely hear ourselves at our table. The loud waiter and the loud men at that table basically ruined our evening there which wasn't cheap. If it wasn't because of them, the meathead of a waiter who prompted the obnoxious customers all along and the b**** of a maitre D. this place would have gotten 4 stars.

bu_NUnb9kRoK2wZBxS9VbA.text: Completely disappointed by this experience!!! This place indicates that it is an upscale steak house...nothing could be further from the truth!   My husband and I picked this steak house to celebrate our wedding anniversary. What a complete let down. The food ($90 steak) was tasteless and mostly fat meat that should have been trimmed away. Service was cold and emotionless and the atmosphere was so far from upscale or romantic...their whole website was a complete misleading Falsehood!!!  In fact had we not made reservations and they immediately brought out bread, we would ABSOLUTELY have left!!!! $200 that I could have saved...and completely ruined my anniversary!!!  Never again.....

HAX04bjYBOFoEG5KfP_cEA.text: Well this is definitely a five-star restaurant I ordered the salmon everything is all a cart but oh so worth it I had the mashed potatoes that were made to perfection this is definitely a must try

1-WYPD3TymRj5WVesKwi1g.text: I so wanted to give this steakhouse more stars, however the two nights I ate there suggest otherwise. The first night they Overcooked my porterhouse; I was sitting in the bar and I actually had great service there. Including a very responsive manager. So I decided to come back another night and see if they could get my steak right.  I came back another night and had the porterhouse again, this time it was cooked right, but since my order the an alcoholic drink my server turned off. The porterhouse steak had a ton of gristle in it.  To top it off, they charged me more for my ice tea in the restaurant and they did at the bar which was five dollars, unacceptable. I won't be going back sadly.

uD-ykpeLZ7X277ofqx5cmQ.text: This is a solid steakhouse with a menu that has a large variety of choices--something for almost everyone. I had a reservation for 6:15 and I was greeted on arrival by two very pleasant ladies.  One of them showed me to my table and it was the first encounter with the friendly and attentive staff that work here.  I studied the menu online before I went and I had narrowed my decision to two choices, the Japanese Kobe wagyu A-5 filet or the wild game tasting of three game foods.  The waiter went through some special items that weren't on the menu and he threw a curve ball at me by telling me they had a bison tasting menu with 3 preparations of bison.  I knew they were having bison during July, and this sounded really good.  After some discussion with the server, I opted to order the Kobe filet as I have not tried real Japanese waygu before.   For starters, I ordered the soup tasting trio and got the lobster bisque, the heirloom tomato, and wild mushroom flavors.  The soup comes in a container with three small wells for the soups.  It gives you a chance to taste three of their four soups.  The lobster bisque was good and even this small portion had some lobster pieces in it.  The tomato was absolutely the best.  Very flavorful.  The weakest of the three was the wild mushroom soup.  I thought it was a bit thin and didn't have a strong mushroom flavor.  The runner ground some fresh pepper into each.  One small nit here was the soups sit on another flat plate.  Since the fit is not quite exact, the soup moved around some and on delivery, some of the tomato had mixed into the other too.  Points off for this on Chopped, I'm sure.  Then came the filet.  With it were 4 pearl onions.  I ordered a side of fries to accompany the steak.  They bring you a small dish with house made ketchup and mustard.  A note on the fries.  Some of the Yelp reviews state they're not crisp fries and they're correct.  The fries have a less than crispy texture and they are oily and pre-salted, just exactly what I like.  I didn't mind the lack of crispness nor the oil.  It's just the way they prepare them so if you don't like fries cooked that way, don't order them.  I very, very rarely use ketchup yet I was drawn to try the mustard and ketchup.  The mustard was OK, but the ketchup was actually better than I expected.  It was sweet, from some small raisins in the mixture.  I didn't dip many fries in it--just enough to try it out a few times--but I was intrigued by how they changed the flavor from the standard bottled kind.  The filet was very tasty and tender.  I had asked for it extra rare, and when my server suggested "blue" I responded affirmatively.  It was done a bit more than I like but it was OK.  The only thing here was that on one side of the filet, there was a section that was very sinewy and I was unable to cut it with my knife.  I tore it with the knife and fork into a couple of shreds.  I thought it odd that a cut of Kobe would not have had this trimmed or would even be like this.  Since I expected the steak to be above and beyond anything I'd ever tasted, I began to wonder if in fact I had been served A-5 wagyu but being a neophyte, there was no way I could accurately tell.  Suffice it to say that when I finished the steak, even thought it was very good, I was thinking I should have ordered the bison.    For dessert, I got the bananas Foster bread pudding.  Very tasty and very filling. It was a good ending to the meal.  Service was excellent.  I had Team 1.  I believe one was Raul but I cannot remember the other's name.  My iced tea was refilled regularly, one of the two checked on me throughout the meal, and two other people from the restaurant stopped by to see how everything was.  It was top notch service.  I'm sure I'll be back to Tender to try some of their game meat.  It's a fine restaurant.

z99HTFuypfVBJ_kzO_1ceA.text: This is a fine dining restaurant, perfect for a date night or just to enjoy an excellent meal. The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable about every entree on the menu. The appetizer, meal and dessert were perfectly timed and arrived promptly. All items ordered were delicious and presented like a piece of art.

SRXidE7ne8z3btgwoY_WiA.text: OMG this place is amazing  steak was perfect and cooked as requested  Staff are very attentive but not over bearing  Cocktails were great I had espresso Martini  or 2 or 3  It was totally worth the money for any steak lover Also the creme brulee is the greatest I have ever had

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roof

SU5q7k1KyEg7snM7bYOHxA.text: My BF and I celebrated our 1 year anniversary here on June 22nd. I had a MyVegas reward for $75 off $150 tab. Totally worth it. We planned a dressed up date night.   We started off with two shots of Remy chilled and a half order of oysters, we got try all the oyster selections. Ordered the steak trio which all the yelpers had recommended and side order of creamed spinach and bone marrow. The dinner was delish! The ambiance and decor of the steakhouse was dark but romantic. The servers and waiters was on point and attentive. We skipped dessert and ordered another two shots to end our dinner.  My BF has not stopped talking about this place. Looks like I have to plan another trip soon. Back to MyVegas slots.

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak trio, bone marrow &amp; cream of spinach
Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half order of raw oysters

6PBiN0uZl8LFgbifLHTDsg.text: Ok so I have mentioned in my reviews that I have a top 5 of dining experiences in a lifetime so far in my years and yes Top of the World is in my Top 5 !!! This dining experience was so fun ! We enjoyed cocktails appetizers as well as the best steak filet mignon as well as surf and turf their version I am not giving their name but you get the idea as well as my friend had lamb everything was so delicious we didn't leave a single bite left over on our plates ! In addition we had dessert!  The service was professional they were not pushy did not rush us brought our drinks out as we asked but were not over bearing and did not stand over us or try to rush us out the door ! I have to say it must be a Las Vegas 5 star standard to let the guests just enjoy their experiences as they wish ! I definitely made us go back again ! My family referred us here and my friends dine here often and invited me here ! Most definitely worth the money and the time !! I highly recommend making the trip to the Luxor !!!!!!

Yjw4l4AChHRbh1zAb22ztA.text: I have eaten at Tender several times.  I think it's time to write a review now that I've tried about everything on the menu.  I am an Mlife member and stay at the Luxor frequently with food comps.  I almost always use the food comp at Tender.  The service here is always great, and I have had several cuts of steak and fish and always been satisfied.  They have a great charcuterie and cheese selection, great happy hour, and nice atmosphere.  So, why a 3 star rating?  Just a couple small reasons.  The bar area is just a little too close to the gaming floor.  The other reason is I've never actually paid full price for a meal here.  The menu prices just aren't in line with other steak houses on the strip for the same price range.  I 100% recommend using your dining credits here.  You won't be disappointed... but if you are, the manager will make sure you feel like you are taken care of.

tTmftylYeYqlSFjDVlUelA.text: My husband and I went to Tender Steakhouse this past Friday for our wedding anniversary dinner. They went above and beyond to make this dinner absolutely the most amazing and special anniversary for us. The food was AMAZING, best steak we have ever had and the service was fantastic. I will not go back to Las Vegas without dining here again! Thank you to all of the hosts, servers and cooks for making this an anniversary dinner we will never forget! Sincerely, The Wilson's

8gMNTQSBKNtVCfiMVo0ORQ.text: Tenders quality is amazing and service is always great. After 5 years in Vegas, it's still my favorite date night/special occasion steak house. Be prepared to spend around 300$ plus tip here and if that seems like to much, remember your paying for quality not quantity.  You'll want to get a few sides if you have a steak and if your both wine drinkers getting a bottle is usually the better deal for 2.

2gEsO7KaGxVwdaA1gIQq0A.text: Entrees were very good. Sides were ok, the exotic mushrooms were very good. The salad looked like it came right out of a boxed salad from the grocery store, along with little pieces of rotten lettuce. The wine selection wasn't anything special. Service was okay. I have stayed at the Luxor about 6 times and had eaten at every place in the Luxor except Tender until this trip. With so many great places to eat I would probably go somewhere else.

JLAEsAvbG-A8dAX-tv5MXg.text: Tabletop bread with pesto/olive oil dipping sauce was excellent to start.  Soup Tasting Trio: Lobster bisque, Wild Mushroom soup and American Kobe beef chili.  Lobster bisque was mild and creamy, wild mushroom was earthy and flavorful, and the chili was spicy.  My favorite was the wild mushroom. $15.00  Caesar salad with anchovies. Delicious! $11.00  Washington Kobe-style 20 oz. ribeye. He loved it.  Cooked medium well, and still juicy and flavorful! $54.00 (Add ons: Mushroom sauce $4.00, caramelized onions $5.00)    Ribeye Trio: 6 oz. of each-New Zealand ribeye, Bison ribeye, and Washington Kobe-style ribeye.  Everything was cooked medium well, and the bison had the best flavor and texture.  For some reason, my piece of Washington Kobe-style ribeye was very dry. $75.00  (Add on: Mushroom sauce $4.00)    Side dish of kale and broccolini, topped with nutritional yeast and chopped cashew. Citrusy!  It was a great accompaniment to our very meat-heavy dinner!  $11.00  Prices = moderate to pricey. $191.88 with taxes.     Service = attentive and courteous.   Decor = awesome. Dark. We loved the light fixture with horns.  You'll know it. :)  We were there for dinner on a Friday evening and it wasn't too busy.  Reservations are available, but I'm not sure if it's necessary.

6f_rBrORoC4ibb0U6MxMZg.text: The atmosphere of the restaurant is great. Comfortable and spacious enough to not feel on top of other tables dining. However, our waitress took our drink then food orders and both times had to come back to verify the orders...usually about 10 min later. When she came back to verify our food order she was 100% wrong. Good thing she came back to verify!! We were never checked on once food was delivered so we had to go ask another staff member for a special request. Because of the idea of the restaurant, it's expected to be small portions and big prices. The sea bass was way over done and extremely dry. And the bison steak was cold. Cocktails were delicious. I would not go back to this place on account of the poorly cooked food and poor service.

qixNwBVK0RRrWa8wjziUfg.text: Came by to try the wild game plate, more for the novelty than anything. Will admit that I was starving, but nothing really blew me away or left me with a frown.

rvtLwn1raY-MjrTATz8Ogg.text: Worst service ever. Manager didnt care. Photographer was rude. Asked to be called back and never happened

CEVmO8Bb_GWOi-WUFas5sw.text: Located in Luxor with nearly three-hundred seats and the sort of pandering service that describes everything as 'beautiful' or 'amazing,' despite evidencing zero knowledge of the province or preparation technique involved in the cuisine, it was finally on Saturday that myself and two friends sat down at Tender - the combination of a gift certificate and one of the few menus in Las Vegas to offer wild game making up for everything service and the humid, stagnant space lacked.  Heralded by some as a hidden gem, while others find the entire Luxor property almost entirely irrelevant to Sin City's culinary landscape, it was just after 5:30 that our trio sat down in one of several dining rooms and with heavy wood speckled with rustic decor beneath low lighting the upsale specials were largely ignored, a focus on the cheese menu showing far less unique options than those suggested online (and described, oddly, as only available 'at the bar',) leading to a three course menu - one friend's Oysters Rockefeller completely forgotten when the waiter tried to push 'outstanding' tuna tartare while the rest of the order trickled out slowly with minimal description, but excellent execution from the men and women behind the grills.  Having reached out through social media in order to understand how the wild game menu had come to be in such an unexpected space it was not long after warm bread and aromatic pesto arrived that GM James Clare stopped by to say hello and subsequently fetching Chef K.C. Fazel, a gracious man with obvious passion for his products and preparation, the story of Tender's relationship with farmers up north as well as the Chef's Midwestern upbringing soon had me all the more interested in what was to come - not even the frequently empty water glasses, 80F+ temperature, or ongoing "beautiful," "wonderful," "excellent" verbiage being fed to each and every table around enough to bring me down.  With the aforementioned oysters forgotten, course one began with two appetizers, and as one friend was treated to a rich broth teaming with tender oxtail, caramelized onions, grilled bread, and cheese that ranks amongst the best I have ever tasted my $19 slice of duck liver a True first glimpse of things to come - the foie gras' sapor more intense than generally seen amongst steakhouse fare with the crispy rice cake providing a texture-rich base more than amicable to sopping up both the offal's residual oils and a drizzle of port wine and juicy red fruit.  Moving on to mains and sides, it was after some delay that seven plates arrived tableside and although presentations were sorely lacking, save for the young man who described the seafood tasting, it would be nearly impossible to find fault in anything save for mundane potatoes - the smoky bone marrow portion exceedingly generous given the $6 tab while both the crispy duck bacon and thick, cheese-imbued rice were equally well prepared, all of them dishes best shared.  Speaking to entrees, for myself the beef was a bit humdrum, though the sear and center were both on-point medium rare, while both tastings were every bit as good as the quality of sourcing, the whitefish admittedly a touch fishy thus allowing both salmon and scallops to steal the spotlight while each constituent of the wild game trio was peerless, the Osso Buco tender and full of funk while both elk and boar delivered on the chef's promise that even his leaner cuts were bound to impress, the latter particularly impressive as smoky saline notes met a perfect foil in housemade chutney.  At this point feeling the effects of a full stomach combined with the restaurant's toasty temperature it was in an elegant iced coffee presentation that I indulged while my tablemate fancied tea and genuinely unable to resist dessert the team at Tender had me at the words "Bread Pudding," the sizable round swimming in a pool of boozed up bananas beneath slowly melting ice cream - an excellent dish its own right but certainly no match for the torched s'mores cake, an absolute stunner that was neither too sweet nor too heavy, something I only wish could have been said for a fallen-on-arrival souffle that was worth neither the twenty minute preparation nor the calories involved.  Flying well below the radar given its gaming-floor adjacent location in Luxor, Tender is at once the sort of 'big meat' place that many envision when thinking of the typical Vegas steakhouse AND the sort of place where a largely unheralded chef has been allowed to carve out a niche that few would expect - if only the front of house could be brought up to speed with the team in the kitchen there is little doubt that this diamond in the rough could shine amongst the city's best.

DrqBFya1LTn29EnXw_jjww.text: Great restaurant for being in the Luxor. Our server Juan was amazing, very professional and knowledgeable. He recommended a bottle of the Stags Leap Cabernet which was amazing. We ordered the wedge salad with bacon, the bacon was probably the best piece of pork I've ever had. Got the filet mignon again amazing. Got the bone in ribeye and potatoes au gratin, those two where the ones that made me give this a 4 star instead of a five. Total bill for 2 people $300. Not bad for a restaurant of this caliber. Will be back next time I'm staying here.

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QwLVIQL7ygRjqKo68LkVdA.text: Loved the service. they have a great menu and the fool was good enough to return. I ordered seafood tower for two it was delicious and filling. I cant remember anything standing out or anything negative. It was very quiet and very slow when we came. Its also very comfy and warm here.

7S6mUR1omyAtzfLnomx2ZQ.text: Save your money and go *anywhere* else. Getting a slice of greasy pizza and rubbing it on the back of your head would be more satisfying. Tender is a third rate establishment with first class aspirations, but fails miserably and somewhat embarrassingly like Ted Cruz's presidential campaign. What do you expect when you're in the basement of the Luxor?  Dim lighting hides scratched furniture. Waiters being pushy on drinks that are way too strong and poorly mixed. Belike their target customer just tossed their giant neon drinking tub into the waste bin before cruising into Tender, but if you have any level of sophistication in your palate you may want to reconsider.  Still none of that would matter as much if the food was even passable, but after tasting several dishes I have to imagine there's a huddled mass of culinary school dropouts and failed clowns pouring your dinner out of Sysco labeled shrink wrap.  Steaks are overpriced with very low quality beef. Poorly cooked and the sin of no seasoning whatsoever - not even salt and pepper. Zero. WTH. Who hired these people? Instead they try to upsell you one of their crappy "steak toppings" no doubt to cover the total lack of flavor in their choice grade meat. The irony is that my ribeye wasn't TENDER. It felt like I was sawing through a warm garden hose.  Look, this review may seem harsh, but you'll want to write one just like it if you make the mistake of eating here. I had the misfortune of having to eat here because a co-worker picked it and sat down before I had a chance to voice an opinion. So take my word for it - I'm trying to save you from a deeply unsatisfying meal.

C2e4evLVFrw7Vwwzgkw6hQ.text: What an incredible experience! The food was superb! The European fresh bread with dip is the best ...ever! Staff was friendly and waiter very professional. Atmosphere was perfect! Lighting and temperature perfect! About time a restaurant reaches perfection in each category!  Thank you for making my mother's birthday extra special just by doing it right! Xo 10/10

rh5-cnSS8zLC4q5bVFVjdw.text: Tender was good.  I don't know if I would crave to go there again.   The service was excellent. Our server was very nice with a sense of humor. They did however get the cuts of meat mixed up and cooked them the wrong way. We did not bother to correct it.    My steak was cooked the way I wanted.  I also asked for extra butter to which they forgot.  The oysters were good.  The Mac n cheese was probably the best thing I ate.  I love truffle.

t3kF6gys3dpXIQf1Snf85w.text: Easy restaurant to get to before the Cris Angel show. Food was delicious and staff was friendly. Noticed that the server was a bit hesitant on sharing their pre fixe dinners they've been offering.. which I get.. higher check total means more tips.  I didn't order off of the prefixe anyways. Their bone-in rib eye special is worth sharing with someone and their sides are of decent sizes. I do recommend this restaurant if you're looking for a good steakhouse on the south side of the Las Vegas strip and for the simple convenience of eating before the show.

LpOGyBxXry5grpWYoEA81Q.text: I do not know what is going on with Las Vegas service this week. It seem that most of the restuarants at  the mgm resorts do not care about service. We come to Vegas about every couple of months and each time we eat at Tender. Last night at Tender it started off with the hostess being rude, the wait staff forgetting that we requested lemon in our water and this was the first time we did not get fresh pepper grounded on our food by the wait staff, but the salt and pepper container handed to us for us to do our selves. The food was great and after ordering the waiter and his bus boy were great. I/We will think twice though about eating here again when we visit.

XlW9phjsntOFxyxlISoofg.text: Went for a family dinner and had a wonderful time. I recommend the Game Meat Trio and the Lamb Sampler. Fantastic Wine list and friendly staff.

7mhsvAlacR-3vnAnyTLOZg.text: Very good food.  I had the Bison Ribeye and was very good, cooked to perfection.  Tender and very flavorful.  My wife had the petite filet and was cooked to her liking.  The atmosphere is elegant western and was just the right setting for me and wife.  Dewey our server was very informative and engaging.  I would recommend to anybody.

dWflb4ZWivn7NN_H2E1shQ.text: I had a delightful dinner at Tender. Service was good, not impeccable but overall service was quite good. The food was pretty standard steakhouse fare. I had a caesar salad, oysters (so good), filet mignon with bleu cheese and potatoes gratin. My steak was cooked perfectly. Overall prices seemed a little high compared to comparable steakhouses but we had MLIFE credit so it was a great experience for the price we paid. A solid 4 star experience.

IqnDW2RzKPki2sjcMWP-BQ.text: Came here with some friends to celebrate our first night of our Vegas vacation. The place looks so nice inside. Leather booths, large black and white photos on the wall, great ceiling fixtures. They gave us sourdough,  Multigrain and feta bread with olive oil with pesto sauce for dipping. Great start.  I had the ribeye medium rare. It was a pretty good cut of meat. It was seasoned well, tender ans had a good flavor because of their 21 day aging process. Also got their petite lobster addon. Delicious! It came with a tail sliced in half and 2 claws in a rich lobster sauce.  For the sides, we got potatoes lyonnaise au gratin, mushrooms and creamed spinach. The potatoes were perfectly creamy and rich with sour cream and chives on top and lots of melted cheese. The mushrooms were well seasoned, very soft and juicy. And the creamed spinach was perfect. Slightly sweet from the cream and onions and the sauce was really good.  All in all, it was a great meal. I've seen previous menus where they had more variety of steaks. I would like to see thrm bring back the kobe and wagu options. But if you're in luxor and you want a great steak dinner with all the trimmings, look no further than Tender.

z-U_LaPwMzHgIJ1dFfXb_w.text: An auspicious start with Wagu beef carpaccio and good bread.   We split the wedge salad - kitchen pre cut it for us. Nice touch & well executed   Both our bison top sirloin and Kansas strip were cooked to perfection and highly flavorful.   All in all a wonderful meal in a very good steakhouse tradition .

I can't compare this steak house to the others in this tier but I had an enjoyable dinner and I'll definitely be back.

ieICuzjn6uDxTNCdCwUTtg.text: The steak was $48 and came without anything no veggies no potatoes. I ordered it medium. It was rare. I sent it back. It came back rate. I ate it. It was good.

P8aADR8Qe9gQJ0uMmWnhcg.text: I don't have much to say, other than - wow. Hands down the best steakhouse meal I've ever had. The food was top notch, from the wagyu beef sirloin I ordered as my entree to the bread dipped in olive oil and pesto.   Dessert was an absolute treat, literally! Brazilian coffee ice cream topped the meal perfectly.  The service though, that's what truly earns five stars. Ezequiel handled our party of four with patience, grace, and professionalism.   For those who might knock a star for the menu prices: you clearly are in the wrong place.

J_f639NX-6TSyO4WyH2IsQ.text: We stayed at the Luxor for 6 days for a couple of Conventions and had dinner at the Tender the first night and last night we were there. Both evenings, the food was excellent. Our last evening in Vegas 2/5/17 was the best. My husband and I both agreed this was the best dinner we ever had. Everything was done to perfection. I had the lobster tail and it was wonderful. My husband had the Filet and you could cut it with a fork. I had the exotic mushroom soup for an appetizer and it wasn't what I expected (exotic mushrooms in a broth) but it was almost a puree, but the mushroom flavor was wonderful. It was Super Bowl Sunday and we weren't really into a loud crowd, Tender had the game on and it was just an overall wonderful experience.  A huge thank you to our server Robin for making both experiences a wonderful memory.

fh644MZhsKUsf7dSWNuyJw.text: Visited with a party of seven thirty minutes before closing time.  Their hours seemed a little early for Las Vegas, but I am not complaining.  They were able to comfortably seat and serve us promptly.  The staff was very accommodating, and the service is approaching five star but not quite that formal.  I had the 10oz Filet with Bearnaise, creamed sweet corn, and one of my favorites, Creme Brulee.  All fantastic.    As the adage goes--you get what you pay for.  Tenders is not budget friendly, but the food is among the top 10% of any I have had.  Additionally, we discussed business long after closing time.  I never once felt that they were trying to chase us out.  Again, very accommodating.

Yr_krnw6vrTomSGW0cg6Gg.text: The absolute best crab cake I've had in my life. It came drizzled in a miso truffle aioli, which was delectable. The dish was accompanied by a seaweed arugula salad. The name may not sound that appealing but it was dressed perfectly. Just describing it now makes me wish I was back at the Luxor!

OrsNkP9jAx-4o70JtVA_uA.text: Felt horrible after eating here. Bar service for dinner not good at all. Pressure to up sell, to drink more.. we had just arrived after a long drive, really hungry and not looking to have more than 1 drink with dinner. Had a coupon from the Luxor to keep us dining at their casino eatery. Showing the coupon prior to ordering really means you receive sub-par food. For $38 our seafood cioppino looked like it was missing half of it. Of poor quality and we think the shrimp may have been bad. Was sick for 2 days. The Panamanian cobia sea bass for $34 was actually very good but not much of it came on the plate. 1 star added for tasty bass. Had to ask for bread with our meal which is supposed to come with it. Would never come here again, would not recommend. Way too pricey for what you get and I cannot risk getting ill again like that on vaca.

NSaxtn6b24MYhV4QyKHDGQ.text: Looking for a steak spot in Vegas and Luxor was toward the direction we were driving.  This place is classy but service sucks.  We arrived at 9:15 and was told that the we couldn't be seated till 9:45.  But we could sit at the bar and order the same food.  I asked it doesn't look full in the dining area and was told that it was policy.  What?....should have walked out already, but we were hungry.  We stayed and sat at the bar.  I ordered the Angus 20 Oz bone in for $56.  Not work the $$$.  It was more like $$$$ per person after the bill came.  Not coming back

PYItDwzMqtqbRFiRiLisIw.text: A great location to grab a phenomenal dinner before shows at the Luxor or nearing casinos. The service is a 10 on a 1 to 5 scale. Our wait staff was attentive and ensured that everything they could control was well above standards.   So why did I rate this a 3? This is a steakhouse. And while we were there, the place was 1/2 empty, meaning that the chef(s) were not overwhelmed by a huge rush of orders. However, in our time there, we saw three meals sent back due to meat being undercooked. Two filets at the table next to us, and my lamb. This wasn't simply underdone because we were picky people - the center of these cuts were all rare. Cold & uncooked.  The wait staff was quick to respond and get these resolved, but at a steakhouse of this tier, this occurring 3x in one sitting is simply a red flag.   That said, once cooked properly, the meat was phenomenal. The wine & cocktail list is well above standard. The starters were perfect in size and preparing our pallets for the main course. And dessert was spot-on.   I will qualify that the desserts being spot-on comment had nothing to do with the fact they were comped due to the meat being sent back.  This taken into account, I would actually return. The peripheral meal and experience was phenomenal. Perhaps I'm too forgiving, but I'd still recommend Tender to anyone visiting Vegas looking for a solid steakhouse.

MhKsLcB7YRNSnxiUGrdb8g.text: Hvng bn to Tender a cpl of times now I can absolutely w/o a doubt state that this a 4 out of 5 star dining experience for me. Ambiance is fabulous.  Service is phenomenal. Food is fantastical!   I've ordered the top sirloin w/some disappointment as I felt it t/b too tough a cut and I've ordered the rib-eye w/great satisfaction indeed. The rib-eye is a huge cut and takes the place of an entire plate by itself!! In addition to, I also ordered a red wine sauce, which I am absolutely in love with, as it brings out so much more flavoring in the meat itself. I also ordered a baked potato w/sour cream butter and chives.  Yummy.   Tender serves an amazing bread basket w/3 varying breads and an olive/pesto sauce for dipping prior to the serving of your meal. It's heavenly.

JlejTeXbU3gNwaJjP4uXXg.text: The food was delicious. We decided to eat here because we had a coupon from the Luxor and the menu looked good. We made a great choice. Service was good as well. The creme brulee was amazing and the biggest portion I have ever seen anywhere. Would definitely eat here again.

qecL08WjpDTeex5QAhKLtg.text: Liars. Rude. Don't fix what they say. I went with my sister and our men and they wanted it to be the best night and dinner. It was the special with the Chris Angel tickets. We were told on the phone filet mignon, and they brought out chuck steak pretending we wouldn't know it wasn't filet. That's just insulting and pathetic. $100 a plate that's ridiculous.

ucobKTvWAEjEC_UyUwYAfQ.text: I'm sorry, but if you like steak, and you're in Vegas, and you don't get the beef angus filet mignon medium rare at Tender at the Luxor and don't have Raul as your server, I feel sorry for you.

photos.caption: Photo of TENDER Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CjZAsYvmNxT5S6GFC26YvQ.text: TENDER steak and & seafood looks like an old-school steakhouse, with its dark leather chairs, hazel floors, and its burnished umber surroundings. But this restaurant in the Luxor also plays by its own rules, offering diners a chance to sample meats like bison, venison and boar.  My first visit here was a late night one. The main restaurant was slowly closing for the night, but the bar and lounge were still open. We ordered a selection of cheeses and the charcuterie board that included wild boar sausage, duck ham, and antelope pastrami. Those quick bites hit the spot, and along with their selection of Belgian ales, led to our decision to visit a second time.      Unfortunately, trip number two was a bit of a disappointment.   First the good. The appetizer I sampled was astounding. It was a short rib ravioli that was cooked to perfection and served with a horseradish marinara sauce and a bit of crisped smoked bacon. I would highly recommend it.  Having dabbled with their game meats the last time I was here, I ordered the wild game tasting as my main. I was feeling adventurous, and I imagined if it was good enough to be on the menu alongside the Omaha beef and Kurobuta pork chops, they knew what they were doing. The tasting included three meats, but sadly, each one was tougher and a bit more disheartening than the last one.   I need to stress that this wasn't my first encounter with wild game. I've typically eaten it in bit and bites, most often in sausage, or cured, or served tartare style, as I did on my first visit to TENDER. I know these meats can be quite tough if cooked less than perfectly, which is why they're often served as charcuterie items. You get the full flavor without having to gnaw through meat that would be better used to make Lady Gaga a Grammy dress.  The wild boar loin was the best of the lot and did echo this restaurant's name, but the venison medallion served alongside it was a bit too dense. Venison tends to be drier than beef, because it lacks the same kind of fat marbling in its meat, and this cut was cooked just a bit too long for my liking. Next.  The Nilgai antelope osso buco was even more vexing. A perfect osso buco is cooked low and slow and falls off the bone. This one was simply unyielding. To be fair, I've never cooked antelope myself, much less in an osso buco, but my understanding is that the process is very similar to the veal version, and the meat should be cooked slowly until it is fork tender. This was not the case on this night, and most of the meat on my plate remained uneaten.  It's truly unfortunate, because this dish was priced at $36, which is not unreasonable. It's low enough where one might be willing to gamble that amount for a new foodie experience -- this is Vegas after all -- and a fair price for the exotic meats  included in this tasting. But they were definitely not representative of what they could be, and I would hate to think someone might be enticed to try them (as I was) and leave with the wrong impression:   "I went to Vegas and ate antelope! It wasn't that good. It was dry and tough. It's probably just a gimmick, but I can scratch it off my bucket list."   I am not, however, ready to condemn TENDER completely, and might try a regular steak there some day, just to see if they've got the chops to handle the chops. I did really like the side I ordered with my sampler -- a trio of exotic grains that included a quinoa and corn pilaf,  farro piccolo, and black forbidden rice.   I am also fond of the cheeses they have available, that are typically served with fresh baguette, honeycomb, dates, quince paste and a cherry fig chutney. I would suggest the cabernet sauvignon soaked Purple Moon Cheddar from California's San Joaquin Valley, the nutty Marieke gouda from Wisconsin, and the butter-like San Andreas sheep's milk cheese from Valley Ford, California, if they're ever on the menu.

XhO13nsX7u1jrZG7Q5bSrA.text: Service was so-so, some people were better than others...thanks to yelp I expected this.  Hubs got the buffalo ribeye, it was "flavorless" and needed to be seasoned (salt maybe) and I had the free-range ribeye (4 stars) the sides were good but the side of Mushrooms...UH-MAZE-ZING! The apps of the big-eye tuna and cheese board were pretty good.

-W9sQGNIra1FkZg4x2NKgg.text: Food was good and two waiters made up for the lack of Gary's tude.  It was ok......... I have had alot better for less $$ if your looking for a nice romantic dinner, look somewhere else LOL

ZtdER0vRqutzUEPLVee56w.text: Had a great meal here! The scallops were good and I tried the steak another person ordered and it was good.  Loved the chocolate souffle.

gsLne7k9Gxzo8SzhyBsaXA.text: Meh. Old school all the way. The Brussells sprouts were grey and in soup. The Foie gras was tiny and on fried Rissoto. The Wagyu steak was perfect as it should be. My wife had Mahi Tuna that was inedible.

ZiouNj2DaQ_juOfus5aP0g.text: Everything we ordered in TENDER was delicious and perfectly cooked.  A bit overpriced, but tasted perfectly.  The only thing that wasn't right - server asked which side do I want with my steak and  I chose one and then I realized they charged me for this side, even though other dishes came with sides, included in the price.  So if you charge for side dishes that come with steak - I would make it clear for customer.  Everything else, again, is perfect.

2oezE_LWKxskxiDTDQZQfg.text: Always my favorite restaurant on the strip for steak and ambiance. Celebrated our ten year anniversary Saturday October 5th and they did not disappoint! Started with two waiters~ one nice and one mediocre. Cocktails with cold bread and basil olive oil...yummy (just wished it was warm) .  Next up mushroom soup and lobster bisque~ so good! The soup had five kinds of mushrooms (including truffles) and tasted amazing (served warm...wished it was hotter) . Lobster bisque had good portion of lobster. Next up was chef's special: filet trio to split with accompaniment of duck bacon and blue cheese on the side. Loved it! We also had the garlic mash with truffles and asparagus~ very good. Tab was $185 and worth very penny.  HINT: Plan on $100 per person...it is worth it. Also, ask for bread warm, and don't be in a hurry. I noticed most complaints are the price and time- this is a place to enjoy and not be in a rush.
